This is annoying and unnecessary in and of itself, but is especially annoying that the same request is made over and over EVEN AFTER PAYING for a subscription! You'd think Nest would have the decency to remove the stupid ads after I paid! In addition to the image quality and intelligence of the alerting, there is also a live microphone and the ability to speak to an intruder. Some people have commented that this would be 'easy' to defeat.  I guess it would.  Take a bat to it, spray paint the lens, or pull it off the magnetic mount and it would be done.  And if the bad guy put some thought in, he could probably do this without being caught 'on tape.' Then again, this is kind of true of any system really.  Just ask Kim Kardashian, who can clearly afford a lot of security. When it comes to security, I think that no system is perfect.  But I got this more for just knowing what is going on at the house.  Was a package delivered?  Did I leave the garage door open?  Did someone just come to the door?  Is someone snooping around back?  That kind of thing. A well motivated criminal is going to scope out the house, disable this system and break in anyway. But the real question is this.  If you are just a regular person in a regular home, is a regular criminal really going to take that much time to try and defeat this system when your neighbor probably doesn't have any security at all? Criminals are generally lazy and would rather take advantage of a situation, so in all likelihood, they will just target another property, rather than plot how to disable this system on your home. For most basic security needs, and the convenience of being able to check on your home in real time, this is a great system with a lot of upside. I'd like to see version 2.0 have a better connector so I don't have to put a 1" hole in my wall to thread the cable through.  And I'd like the app to be updated to stop hassling me about subscribing, even after I have already subscribed.  This is outrageous and annoying.  But with those two reservations aside, I think this is a great product, and I have already ordered two more.  Now we just have to see if it survives a brutal Minnesota winter!
title: Pretty Great - Not perfect

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Visceral Soul
content: We're very happy with this so far (it's been a week). I can't find the link where I read about this, so I will state that I found it very easy to cut the cable coming from the camera and the resplice it together. This allowed me to drill a small hole in the top of our vinyly window casing and pass the cable through it to inside the house. Then I could just pass the cable through, rather than drilling the 7/8" hole required to pass the big connector on the end of the camera cable where it attaches to the usb power converter. I used three wire nuts to reattach the three wires to each other, but those are hidden behind our window shades, so no big deal. I found zero loss of power, video or audio quality after doing this, and now I just have two small holes in our window frames, rather than having to drill the big 7/8" holes through the side of the house. I don't mind the monthly subscription for recording - it costs a company money to host and maintain all the severs to record and store that video. If you want a system that allows you to record to your own computer or an SD card, then look for another option. I do wish Nest included a connector on the camera cable so you could just disconnect it when routing the cable, rather than having to cut and splice the cable yourself, but oh well. In the end these do exactly what we need and the app and interfaces just work. Well worth it for us.
title: Does exactly what we need and pretty easy to cut and splice the cables to enable drilling a smaller hole

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: CMR
content: Mixed results.  As others have said the hardware, packaging, and features are top notch and very well designed and manufactured.  It is almost worthless without the Nest Aware subscription however which is $100 for ten days of recording history or $300 for thirty days of recording history. Without the subscription you will only get three hours of still picture "Snapshots", images of noticed activity by the camera, and even then you will never be able to view these "Snapshots" from their webpage or account, you can only view them through the App on your phone or tablet, when it is in a vertical orientation. I had an hour long conversation with two support representatives today with Nest, both of which provided me with links that had lovely information carefully displayed, and both of them could not answer basic questions and ran me around in circles fixating on small aspects of my conversation that I understood, but they did not.  In the end I complained that there should be more than these two costly subscription packages, like a 5-Day option or 1-Day, that could be much more affordable than the two they currently have.  They insisted that they had more than two options as I could also pay monthly at $10 a month for the ten day recordings, or $30 a month for the thirty day.  I had to point out that their way was more expensive than their already pricey solution, and I would not be interested.  They assured me they would share my feedback with their engineering team, which seems like a waste.  I asked them to speak to management and sales instead. tl;dr  Nest Aware needs cheaper options with less days of available recordings, once it does, this review will be five stars and I will return to showing off my Nest camera and recorded clips with everyone I know. Edit: Nest just quietly added a 5-Day option for $50 a year for one camera.  I'm very happy to hear this, unfortunately for me it was after I was charged for the 10-day plan last month.  But overall I think this is great and I will be contacting them to move my camera to the 5-day plan.  My original review was two starts.  With this new plan I've updated my review to be five starts.
title: Great Hardware, Almost Useless Without Pricey Nest Aware

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JP
content: I waited to review these cameras after using them for about two months. I purchased one indoor and two outdoor cameras. They worked great for about a month and then completely stopped working for hours/sometimes days. I've tried re-installing them, resetting them and of course I have checked wifi signals.  Nest Help says "check wifi connections" but they're running on an eero mesh network with 60-80 MBs and 10-13MB upload speeds (tested at the site of the cameras themselves) Reliability is very poor which defeats the purpose of a security camera. I have not reached out to customer service but given other reviewers, I'm not optimistic. I'll update this review if I have any luck there to be fair to Google.
title: They worked great for about a month and then completely stopped working ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Zimonomiz
content: This product could be so awesome but there is one big issue. Nest charges a pretty high $10 per month fee to use the camera with Theo functionality. You don't have to pay it but then you get a really dumb camera that is not worth the big price tag. Who is willing to pay another $120 a year per camera in order to use the product the way it should be used. I would never by nest cameras again
title: Nest you could be the best...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Michael Albany
content: I got this product because the flag on our porch was stolen. After about 6 months the network connection kept going out and support suggested that I move the camera closer to the router. I repositioned the camera from the left of our door to the right taking it from 20’ away to about 15’. It got worse. After a bunch of back and forth it was determined that a direct line of sight to the router was required. This meant the camera now faces away from the street so we can see the front door. Flag was stolen again. Network issue resolved I looked into getting it to playback video so I could see when a package was stolen. Video is only available if you have a subscription. Stills are only kept for 3 hours without one as well. No stills or video of a package suspected to be stolen. 2 $30 flags, 1 $15 package in 18 months and nothing caught on camera. Subscription cost is about $300 a year after the first year. No. Can’t justify that cost. Video quality is ok but not great. At high resolution it’s good in daylight and night vision works, but it’s not going to be admissible in court unless the crook waits to have their picture taken. It’s also slow to respond. My mail person doesn’t move fast but she can get to the door, drop the mail in the slot ant leave and IF the camera catches it at all, I get a blurred image of the top of her head as she’s leaving our 9ft long patio. The motion detector is great at catching the leaves on the plants moving in the wind.  I have 70 notification of that over the last 3 hours. Oh and one possum visiting. Very disappointed in this system, the video quality, and the cost of the subscription for 1 camera.  Don’t waste your money. All I use it for these days is to watch the feral cats that visit our porch now.
title: Too expensive, you can do better.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: muaad
content: The camera is nice, but I can’t pair it with the cloud subscription that I purchased, TWICE!  It useless without the subscription. I tried the support options, three times, wasted hours of my time, before finally one tech guy on the phone said he can see the problem, but needed a manager to fix it. So he “escalated” the problem to a manager, promising someone whould contact me with a solution within three days. This is day 5 now, no has called me. The worst case scenario of customer relationship: non-function product combined with HORRIBLE support!!!! This product, in my experience, is absolutely overrated, overpriced, and under-supported. Fail!!
title: WAY OVERRATED, failed experience!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: TheArtOfFussy
content: I pre-ordered this as soon as I heard it was coming out. We have two Nest 2nd Gen Thermostats and three 1st Gen wired Nest Protects and I love them. I personally had a bad experience with the 1st Nest Cam, but really wanted to give this a 2nd chance. I was hoping that the power cord would be connected through a micro USB port that I could switch out the cord for a Ring Stickup Cam solar panel that I have, but alas, no luck. This thing is really meant to be plugged in at all times. I'm guessing that is because of the constant recording which caused my first Nest Cam to feel so hot I was afraid it was malfunctioning. Hopefully we won't have this issue with the Outdoor Cam. Here are my thoughts so far. I'll update if anything interesting to share comes up. The Good: - The camera is rather large compared to the Nest Cam and seems watertight enough to not have issues being plugged up outside in an uncovered driveway. - The night vision is really nice, and far superior to what I have with my Ring Stickup Cam. Like there isn't even a comparison. - The notifications are almost instantaneous. Of course I'm at home with everything all on the same wi-fi, but still impressive. - There are no delays in live streaming. This is especially impressive considering my Canary (which I love by the way) has a 10 second delay. - Setup was incredibly easy. I scanned the QR code added the wi-fi and password and we were ready to go. It took less than 5 min to get going! - My husband and I tested two-way audio and it works really well. The sound is clear at close range and if you shout you can hear it from the ground. Right now it's about 10 feet off of the ground. - Also, the landscapers were here working outside today and set the motion sensors off but the trees swaying in the wind have not caused the sensors to activate. The Not so Good: - I'm still annoyed at the cost of the monthly/yearly subscription fees. - I'm not electrician by any stretch of the imagination, so someone please let me know if I'm overthinking it, but the plug is not grounded and that bothers me for being outside. The Other: - The packaging is nice and standard Nest. I'm a sucker for good packaging. - There is hardware included to mount this indoors or outdoors. It comes with 12 screws for some reason which is way more than you need to install. I've included a bunch of pictures, but so far I'm really happy with the picture quality and performance. Time will tell though how things go!
title: So Far I'm Impressed

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JoshJnkyll
content: I was looking for a good camera that I could help me later or to check h¡what happen later this is good cameras. To install the cameras was the easy part the hard was to decided how I want and in what position. Once it was settle to instal was more easy just used the magnet in one camera and didn’t have to drill nothing, the other camera yes i have to drill but with what is included it was more easy and don’t have to set to many holes. The first month free after we decide to invest on the cloud makes it easy to decided if I want to use the cloud system. There are two down sides not every system is perfect. The price I don’t like that i have to invest more on a system that I already pay for but if you want to keep that information in some place that will cost you and that will be the bad side because I have to invest on a HD and that will cost more (yes I will not have to buy another one but the will have to be replaced later, so that is a con/pro). But to invest fro two cameras and the price is not so bad only have to pay for one cloud system and not to pay for to separate subscription. The other the app there are some flows, I have to download two apps so I can use it with IOS The home app and the nest app. Why I would have two if only one could do the job of one. I want o set on and off the cameras from the easy access ces not to set different steps to do it that is nothing convenient. I know there are some restriction between apps but there should be more collaboration between google and apple so I could use the cameras in my own home app of IOS but NO, i have to use another app. I would love to have the nest app separately but still use the home app of iOS. Besides that the cameras are great and the quality I am not asking top quality it is ok for night vision helps a lot.
title: Two great investments.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: NY
content: I have experience installing residential and commercial security systems, I worked as an engineer in the optics industry and I taught college computer science so I know networking.  With all that I do believe I have an expertise relating to networked home security cameras. I've dabbled with a variety of options and there was always something missing frmo the offering.  I bought a nest system and it massively exceeded all my expectations.  I bought a "while in use" locking outlet cover which took under 5 minutes to install.  Once done, I set up my first camera in about 10 minutes.  I literally was looking at live streaming video within 15 minutes.  The hardest part of the entire installation was figuring how to route the wires so they were secure and out of view, but every home will be different so that is just something you have to figure out. If anything the 25' cable was even a little longer than I needed but that's a good problem to have I suppose. I've been using this for less than a day.  I get alerts on my phone and I see the mailman delivering a package to my door and listen as our son greets him and takes the package. I set up zones (super easy on the app) and added our whole family (super easy). This was so seamless and satisfying I, literally, bought two more cameras immediately.
title: Exceeds all my (expert) expectations

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: B-Rad
content: Pros: Install is relatively straight forward. Overall, it's just easy to setup and get going. Maybe takes an hour total for a one camera install. This is its biggest pro. Ease of setup and use. They lowered the cost to $50/yr for 5-days continuous recording. Not bad. Does feel like robbery though considering the quality of the video... Cons: * Over alerts for random things. "spotted movement". You watch, maybe a piece of paper fluttered in the wind on your patio table. Who knows what you're looking for. It'd be nice if it showed you a box where it spotted movement. * You'll get alerts every time you go into the things periphery. Annoying for us because I put this on our patio and we spend quite a bit of time out there. I guess the Nest IQ is supposed to fix this issue by recognizing faces. * The video compression is extreme. If you have a lot of movement going on, it will be a pixelated mess! If a robber didn't want to get spotted, all they gotta do is bob and weave their head and you'll never be able to identify them. If a person just stood still for 10 seconds, you might be able to identify them. Maybe this is better with the Nest Outdoor IQ but that's to be determined. And for twice the cost (I paid $150 for this), that's a big gamble to take. * The delay between live and what you see on your phone is several seconds. I can't imagine trying to talk to someone with this thing. * The cord sticking out the bottom of the camera is pretty annoying. It isn't super flexible either. It looks ugly. * Google could cut this at any time and then you have a worthless piece of tech. Plenty of startups out there that were cloud cameras have already done just that. Just know what you're getting yourself into on that front. Biggest issue here is that the compression (even on highest quality - I have a high-end 802.11ac router with a gigabit internet connection through AT&T Fiber) is horrendous. I am really disappointed as review videos I saw didn't make it seem like it was that bad but it is actually terrible. You will not be able to make out faces at a distance. You will probably need a camera to be right in the face of someone AND hope they remain still because if the video has a big change (like a fast moving object taking up a lot of the screen) then the video just turns into pure confetti. Watch some videos online to get an idea of what I mean about video compression - if you don't know. Verdict: Don't buy. I will probably end up selling this on Craigslist at some point but until I find something better, it's what I am using.
title: Can't recommend if you want this for security purposes

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Customer in Sacramento, CA
content: Update: After using both indoor and outdoor Nest cams for a couple of months I was forced to downgrade my rating due to the amount of data they use. Excellent hardware and software but I can't afford to exceed my 1TB cap every month. I dialed back the resolution to 360p but still found the cameras were chewing through data like it was going out of style. Going back to my tried and trusted NVR w POE cams. It would be nice if Nest had a setting to opt out of 24/7 uploading of footage and allowed the user to set the amount of footage to record per activation...Say 1 or 2 mins. Over the last several years I've tried a variety of home surveillance systems. Started with four Hikvision IP cameras attached to a NVR. Great coverage, reliability and night vision but the install wasn't easy and the motion notifications were much too sensitive. Added some Kuna porch light cameras and was very impressed but those provide a limited field of view/installation options. Recently purchased a Nest Outdoor Cam. Installation and set up was extremely easy and took less than 20 mins. Accessing the cameras and receiving notifications via the Nest app was and continues to be simple and reliable. The price for the camera and monthly Nest Aware is a bit steep for me but you get what you pay for. I was so impressed I ended up purchasing another Nest Outdoor cam as well as an indoor one (after I was able to save up some money). The one thing I'd change about the design would be the power cord location on the camera itself. I would have it come out the top closer to the back of the camera. Otherwise the cameras look and work exceptionally well.
title: Great Home Security Addition but data hog

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ryan
content: I'll start with the good. The video quality is great, both day and night. I can open the app and begin viewing the live video very quickly (usually takes less than a second to load live video). Unfortunately, that's about where the good ends. While the camera's themselves are good quality, the app as well as video viewing on nest's website is another story. I have had nothing but problems since setting them up. I was aware that I needed to pay a monthly subscription to view video history, and had no problem paying for that. However, after subscribing to Nest Aware Plus, the nest app did not recognize I had a subscription. I waited a few days to make sure it wasn't just a syncing issue. Contacted support through the chat feature in the app. Spent around 45 mins texting back and forth before they had me delete and re-install the app, which resolved the issue. However, I've had multiple problems since. As part of the subscription I was paying for, I am supposed to be able to view recorded history for the last 10 days (video stored on the cloud). This feature has not worked for me in either the nest app on my or thru their website on my laptop. Spent over an hour chatting with support thru the app about that. The rep had me try adjusting multiple settings  - then asked me to logout of the app and log back in. Did everything that was asked, and still wasn't working. To make matters worse, by logging out it ended the chat - so I was unable to continue trouble shooting the problem and wasn't about to waste another hour starting over with a new rep. I am also unable to view videos of event-based recordings (i.e. when motion or sound triggers a event to be tagged in the video history). I get notified if there's an event - but when I click on the event it only loads a still shot of the event (it should be playing the recorded clip so I can see what happened). I just did a google search to see if other's are having this problem and found a thread on google's support forum with comments from many users reporting the same problem (despite having a Nest Aware subscription). Another disappointment was the Nest Aware app surprisingly lacked a basic feature that my inexpensive Wyze Cam (and app with 14-days free cloud storage) has. You can't set a timeframe for motion detections (i.e. say you only want to get notified if there is motion detected at night while you're sleeping). The only option is to set a schedule where the camera turns off completely. One final complaint is the cord/power source. Google does not currently offer a shorter cord for this camera - and because the cords are custom - it's not possible to easily swap out the existing cord (a 15' or so cord comes out of the back of the camera. This cannot be removed from the camera. That plugs into a power hub, which has another 10' cord that plugs into a regular power outlet). So if you're not running this camera 25' feet away from a power source, you've got a lot of cord to try to conceal. Unfortunately, I will be returning these cameras. Was really hoping they'd be my upgrade solution for a continuous recording camera to replace my Wyze cameras...but not the case. If the app worked as expected, I'd be willing to keep them and overlook the other issues. But alas. I'll keep looking.
title: Returning these cameras.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Allan R
content: If I had known what I know now about their support products, such as their app and website, I would have NEVER EVER EVER purchased a camera from Nest.  The app is a straight up joke.  Virtually none of the features work, including the Home/Away assist feature, which is only sort of important!  It's supposed to work with phone location, and change your notification preferences depending on whether you are home or not.  I do not want constant notifications when I am home, but more importantly, I DO want notifications when a person approaches my house and I am away.  But of course this feature simply does not work.  I have to manually change it every time.  Also, even when I am away, and I have it set properly, many times it does not work.  I will go back and review the activity from the app, and I will see a time when a person or something should have triggered a notification to my phone, and it did not happen.  The solution from customer support is always to "uninstall the app" or attempt some other ridiculous ways to try and fix problems.  It's almost as if they are sitting around laughing, seeing how many different stupid hoops they can make users jump through, as a joke.  "Sir, the solution to this is you need to stand on your head and eat your shoe, this should clear up the problem". Despite repeated please to Nest customer support to add custom notification sounds, it still has not been added.  As with any smartphone, I am bombarded by various notifications throughout the day, from text messages, phone calls, emails, other apps, etc.  It would be nice to be able to personalize a chime so that I know it's a Nest notification, and I can view it right away. As far as the website goes, I recently tried to input a new payment method.  Did not work properly, and did not make the new card the default payment method.  The solution offered is to unsubscribe to my Nest Aware, then get a partial refund on the unused portion of my subscription, delete my old payment method, then input a new card, and re-subscribe.  Of course be sure to pay in full for the new subscription, even though this is our fault for our website not working properly! I could write a 100-page book on the many problems with their app and website, but I think you get the idea.  It's a complete nightmare, and clearly they have no idea how to fix their many problems, as the solution is always to "just start over".  Delete everything, uninstall everything, see if that helps.  The camera picture quality is decent, but there are other options which are probably just as good.  Save yourself the headache and find another "smart" camera system that works better.  It's not a high bar to clear.
title: Product is ok, all their software...apps, website, are a NIGHTMARE!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Teresa
content: Well, I now have 9 of these cameras. I  know, you must think I'm paranoid or something, but 4 of them were gifts for family members. My family members are aging and the Nest Cameras help me keep an eye on them. I pay for all 9 cameras on my Nest account which runs me well over $300 a year. The picture quality is best during the day (duuu) and I run them without night vision at night which seems better. You can get a 10 day subscription or a 5 day. I need to switch all of mine to the 5 day, which is good enough or 24 hours without a subscription. You can save clips and rewatch any time. The sound quality is very good. The only downfalls I have are 3 of my cameras are more than 100 feet from our internet connection which makes the cameras a little unstable at times. Nest has control of the bandwidth which we learned during the COVID outbreak when I received a message from Nest that they were turning down the quality of our cameras due to overload on the networks. The cameras sometimes doesn't pick up all the action, for example you backing out of your driveway just under the camera's nose. Not sure why this happens, maybe someone reading this knows. Obviously, they are good cameras, why else would I buy 9. Very easy to set up, I can now set them up with my eyes closed. *UPDATE 7.28.20 My new cameras are dark compared to my 7 other Nest cameras. Something has definitely changed in the quality of these latest Nest cameras. ---Please see my photos which were taken on the same day at the same time facing the same direction.---
title: Not Bad if You Can Afford the Pricey Subscription (UPDATE 7.28.20)

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Henyaman
content: There are quite a few issues here on these cameras. I've had the indoor and outdoor both for a few years. The software, on Apple or Android is too slow to really use alerts. If someone is at your door you won't get the picture up before they walk off.  The cable setup is pretty terrible if you have to run it through walls (I think this was modified in the newest outdoor cam) but the most worrisome part for me and what is making finally move off Nest products has been the "integration" with Google lately. They are moving off Nest and slowly starting to have people login to Google first. Sure, just what I want a company that makes money collecting info and data to be behind my cloud cameras. Then, as if to give everyone an extra swift kick they decide to showcase the biggest drawback to cloud products. That being you have no control. This week they removed the ability to shut off the LED that shows the camera is on. We have ours off outside so someone sneaking around at night wouldn't locate and avoid them. Same internally, we have it on most of the time and I don't want to see an LED on my mantle but now that Google is in play they decide to just remove that feature and force it always on because of some complex they have trying to improve the world or whatever. I bought the cameras, I can decide how I set them up on my house. Or, apparently not. So goodbye Nest.  There are more pro's and cons of these you can read all over the reviews here, I decided to post mine as I have had these for a few years and am unhappy in the current direction of Nest and would not buy them again.
title: Not what I had hoped, and getting worse with more Google's interference

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mystery
content: you can no longer disable the status light. seriously WTF? one of the main reasons i purchased this product was the ability to control the product, including disabling the status light. it is bad security practice to show your defenses. having a status light on shows your defenses and can lead to someone working around the camera, breaking it, disabling it, stealing it, etc. google has ruined nest.
title: changing my rating as nest team has butchered the product

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Righteousdude80
content: A brief summary. The camera unit itself is well made and has crisp say and night resolution. The power cable is horrible- the camera end is not removable and the male end is 3/4 of an inch thick. I was planning on drilling a hole in the eave and hiding the cables in the attic but since the hole would be a massive to just fish he line through- i couldnt do that. Annoying neglect in design. My camera also kept going offline intermittently. Through problem solving I discovered that it doesnt do well on the 5ghz wifi. Switched to the 2.4 ghz wifi and it runs solid.  Wouldnt have been easy for a non-techy to figure out.
title: Annoying neglect in design

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: SharpieItBlack
content: Update, A Year Later: Overall, I am still very happy with this camera. They have made app improvements I believe and therefore in the past year I feel the app and connection to their server has definitely improved since then. The only time my camera ever goes offline or drops connection is when my power or wifi goes out. But once reconnected it works perfectly fine. I only need one camera right now as it's on a patio of my apartment, but if I had a full house I would definitely invest in more. Update July 3rd: The mobile app and desktop views of my camera keep saying I can't connect to Nest services. I got outside and the green led is lit saying it is connecting and streaming. But every time I open the app it says I can't connect to Nest services. If I can get into my camera view, it does show recorded events while I was unable to see them. But it's a huge pain when the app won't connect to the server or cloud or wherever so I can actually use it. Taking a star off for unstable app. Original: Shipping: Very fast so I could set it up really quickly. Actual Setup: Without revealing too much about my home; I have very fast internet both down/up speeds so the feed won't drop unless my wifi drops (the fault of my ISP not the camera itself). It took several tries for it to connect to the Wi-Fi network, however once I got it connected it has been quite streamlined. The Nest app is installed on both my Android Galaxy phone and Android Galaxy Tablet. It runs well and simple to navigate. Not everything is available in app, and must be done on your computer (such as account details and subscription details, but that's to be expected and not an issue). I live in a one bedroom apartment in a conservative area, and as a social minority I fear for my safety. As well as an owner of several gaming systems. This camera has alleviated tons of anxiety in regards to my safety and security. Physical installation portrayed some road blocks. But after some thinking I got it eventually. Luckily there is wood around my patio door so I just screwed the clips into that. And luckily I have an exterior outlet as well so I don't have to risk breaking my lease by drilling into a wall. Concealing it hasn't been as ideal but I got it to work eventually. The magnetic back is STRONG. Especially when attached to a metal object. I have a metal hanging planter I secured the magnet to and it holds well. I put flowers in the planter to better hide the camera. Infrared lights are not seen at all from the outside unless you're staring directly at it and are extremely close in proximity. I mention this because I've seen some similar type cameras with IF lights that are really noticeable. Suggestion: Add a feature to turn the green led off. The green light is fairly bright and noticeable when the surroundings are all dark (especially at night). Not sure how this would be implemented but it's a thought. Video Quality: It is so so. For a smart phone security camera connected to Wi-Fi, if actually has way better quality than I expected. If people want better resolution they're gonna have to spend A LOT more and for way better business-grade cameras. This is for your home and it'll work just fine. I only have the one camera so I cannot speak for a multi camera setup or a larger home. But for a small apartment it works great.
title: Works great for a small/medium home

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Sam P
content: The Nest Cam Outdoor was an upgrade from my three year old Arlo, and in a big way. The quality of the video, and the speed at which I could pull up a live view isn't even close to being comparable. The added bonus is the speed and accuracy that Nest Aware is able to see motion, identify it as a person, or other moving object, and then pop up the notification on my Apple Watch! It was easy to set up. Super happy with this camera.
title: Huge Upgrade for Arlo

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Joel P.
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Ok let me just start off by saying that like most shoppers I spent a lot of time researching and comparing different types of cameras and What I was looking for was for something easy to use, easy installations and wireless. I’ve lived in my home for 2 1/2 years and never had a package stolen and within 2 weeks of installing the cam right around Christmas I had 2 packages stolen, and thanks to the crisp and clear image of the nest cam I was able to identify the car and spotted it the next day. I contacted my local precinct and they waited for the perpetrator to come back to his cAr and as it turns out he was still wearing the same clothing as captured in the video. He was subsequently arrested. Bottom line is if you’re looking for a good quality image and a camera that is easy to use with awesome alerts look no further. I installed it with ease in 30 min or so and can now monitor my home from anywhere in the world. Not to mention the ability to talk to anyone coming to my door live.
title: Must have for homeowners

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: the product truther
content: I waited a while after purchase to submit a review.  The Nest outdoor cameras are very nice units, but there are a number of issues that buyers need to consider as they invest in this product. First off, the camera video quality is very good in daylight as well as in darkened conditions.  These cameras have a very nice feature of a microphone and speaker that allows one to listen or to speak in a zone.  Another nice feature are the notification settings where the user can elect the sensitivity of notification event and can elect to be notified via email of any occurrence detected by the cameras. The cameras are installed in a fairly  straightforward fashion that relies on power sourcing from a typical home electric 20a/120v plug.  This reliance can be problematic as camera placement can be dictated by your specific power sourcing options available.  If the consumer elects to use internal home plugs, this will require drilling a 3/4 in hole to fish the power cord into your home. The cameras use a wireless Internet method of "vaulting" your camera video within the Nest Cloud app, and there is a monthly fee associated with this process.  $250 for the first camera and then $60 per camera there after.  Not exactly cheap. Things to keep in mind, due to the nuances of wireless Internet capabilities, the consumer needs to ensure that a sufficiently strong Internet wireless sourcing is available and can dictate placement of cameras to avoid weak or dead spots of your wireless Internet.  In my case, I have fairly expensive Asus wireless router and use 2 amped wireless repeaters to help push my wireless coverage of sufficient strength to help with operation of the Nest cameras. There is also the issue of video clarity and total bandwidth usage.  The lowest setting on the cameras require about 30 GB of data usage and can grow to 120 GB per camera at the highest setting.  As you can see, if you use 4 or more cameras, this data usage can be problematic with your ISP's allotment of total data usage allowed.  I personally use 6 cameras, and I have to set some cameras at medium settings and others at high so that I can avoid going over my 1TB monthly limit.  And, this usage is 1 way to the Nest Cloud.  I don't think that Nest expects consumers to "monitor watch" these cameras for extended periods as this would push your data usage considerably higher.  Something to keep in mind for sure. The above review aside, in totality the Nest cameras are a fine choice for security camera selection.  The cost is reflective of their quality, I just want the consumer to appreciate the costs of operation of this wireless model vs a more traditional wired camera solution that incorporates an on premise hard drive.
title: considerations!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ataritron
content: So here's my take after a year+ using these. I like the cameras, hate the subscription service. Just got some wyze cameras and they do the exact same thing for $0 monthly. For $25 for wyze versus $200+ for nest, absolutely can't justify or recommend these to anyone. Probably depends on your needs and these are outside cameras versus the wyze inside cameras. product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Little Jim
content: I'm really liking these Nest Outdoor Cameras. They were easy for me to get registered and set up online for the different locations. I hired an electrician to do the hardware install. It only took a few seconds after the cameras got power for me to see a picture on my iphone and have the electrician make slight changes in the field of view. The app is fairly intuitive and easy to figure out. I did have a slight problem with the two farthest cams from the router. The front door cam would reload quite often as would the driveway cam which also would drop out quite often. But moving my router off the floor and up to the top of a file cabinet about 5 feet off the ground seems to have solved that issue and now i'm not seeing any cams drop out and the only reloads i see is when i first open the app my iphone or launch the website on a computer. One of the things that held me back from getting Nest was the Nest Aware subscription price but they have added more options with lower prices that looked reasonable to me. There is now a 5 day option which lowers the price considerably. I bought the 5 day for two cams and the 10 day for another. But I'm thinking I'll probably go 5 days on all three cams as I really don't see the need to save 30 days or even 10 days worth of video. It's easy enough to download something to my computer if I see something I want to save on my hard drive. My electrician has installed a lot of security cams, though never any Nest cams, and he was very impressed by the video quality.
title: Great product

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Brad Murchison
content: After the Arlo system failed to live up to its hype, we ordered these as a replacement. I was skeptical at first, where a lot of these reviews say the cameras are useless without Nest Aware and talk about its high price. It seems like Nest listened, and created a free package. This package is still limited compared to other services, only offering clips 3 hours back, and only recording clips when motion is detected. However, that it still plenty useful. If it's not for you, then they've also included the addition of a $50/year or $5/month Nest Aware package, which includes more intuitive features like person detection and 5 days of continuous recording. The cameras themselves take great wide angled views.  Set up is a breeze, download the app, make an account, and scan the QR code on the camera with your phone. The mounting method is a magnetic swivel base, that attaches to the back of the camera, and then to a backing plate that's screwed into a wall. While this may seem insecure at first, like someone could just grab your camera and run, Nest has included a bunch of cable tie-downs, that you would snap over the cable and drill into the wall. This makes a quick grab and snatch nearly impossible, meaning they'd have to stick around and unscrew all the tie-downs. The camera is also locked to your account until released, and would alert you once it detected it was being moved. While these cameras are more expensive than Arlo or Logitech cameras, I'd say that you get what you pay for, with great build quality, picture quality, and the sheer convenience of not needing to ever replace batteries. If you're looking for a home camera system, I'd say this is a good choice.
title: Great, even without Nest Aware

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Michael Kennedy
content: I have one outdoor security camera and 4 indoor Nest cameras.  I've had these for almost a year and I have mixed feelings about them.  The ease of installation is great, especially the indoor cameras are a no brainer to install. But the subscription fee to the recording service is expensive.  The price to record 10 days worth of footage is $100 for the first camera and $50 for each additional camera per year.  That's $300 a year to record all my cameras for only 10 days of history.  With no options of creating your own video server I don't think the cameras are worth it. The free service they do offer, will take still snap shots if the cameras detects motion, this is super hit and miss.  It often misses people and if it does detect a person, it always seems to be their back.  It's great at sending pics of vehicles driving by the house and small creatures like cats, birds and skunks.  How it regularly misses humans is beyond me.
title: Price of camera + subscription fees = to expensive

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mitch
content: First let me say I am a big Apple fan - I have many products and was looking forward to Homekit. This is of course, AFTER I invested money in Nest/Dropcam/Protects/etc. who are now owned by Google. Thought this was going to be an issue until I used these products. I have tried almost every other home camera on the market today; even configurable IP cameras, NOTHING is as easy as these are. They auto-learn if your power goes out (come back on AND connect to your network in a matter of 15 seconds), the app is easy enough to share with people you live with (my wife is NOT tech savvy and Nest is wonderful), the infrastructure is great (never in a couple years since Google bought them have ever had an issue with the service, and the service is outstanding (see more). I was hesitant to spend money on the subscription service - as anyone is. I would cancel ANY other service before this one. Having the opportunity to see who is outside of my house/walking by/mailman/garbage man/dog walker/whoever else after the fact in near seconds after opening up the application is priceless. The person recognition is fantastic after I set up the "zones" and the audio is crystal clear and instantaneous. iOS users when something is recognized via a notification you can "force touch" from the lock screen and see an animated GIF of what it saw: EPIC, so you don't have to go into the app and rewind. Additionally, finding camera alerts are easy, tap on the purple dot in the timeline (in app) and it rewinds to that exact moment for you. And exporting the videos or pictures is seamless too, and takes only a matter of a minute or so. Seriously, for a piece of mind, nothing can compare (we watch our dog using an inside one). OH and also, if your Nest Protect goes off, the camera automatically takes a video and sends it to the registered users so you can see what could have caused the trigger (for me it was the steam from the shower in the room across from the Protect). Alright, I could rant all day about this device - really. I do like it - for a Google product (and that says something). Especially in the Midwest, I have had this device well below zero, and above 90 degrees Fahrenheit with ZERO issues. I just make sure the power cord is somewhere behind a locked door or garage so it cannot be disconnected by someone tampering with your device. Hope this helps in the decision making for anyone. Two thumbs up.
title: Highly Recommended - Subscription Service is GREAT. No BS.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: falcomar
content: i was very impressed by the camera quality and product design, though you get what you pay for in this case if you don't need to install many cameras and all you need is simple security on one or two locations the camera is great. the software and web application is also pretty simple and mostly works, i did at first get some customer support but that quickly dropped off...i expressed various ways the product could be better i thought this was one of those progressive silicon valley companies but that seems to have been ignored. the worst part about the camera system is the requirement to pay for a nest aware subscription and not having more choices, for example 1 day of video would be great so would 12 hrs...for example being able to recored overnight would be very useful, the free 3 hours is not. finally my biggest gripe is not being able to setup zones without nest aware for me this make the camera largely unusable as you get so many false motion detects since it has such a wide field of view. i explained this to their applications people and they said you need the video history to do motion detect, thats not true you can easily do this within frames, seconds minutes of video. now what do i do with the $350 worth of cameras i bought?
title: cameras unusable without zone & more hours of video history

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kendra
content: I know people write incredibly long reviews about these but I am going to be short and sweet. My family and I have had these for years. When I moved out my parents demanded that I have at least one for the house. It has been great to keep an eye on packages, watch out for the animals escaping, seeing who's at the door, etc. I would agree that the picture could be a little more clear at times but honestly that's why they charge you an arm and a leg for the upgraded camera which I just don't think is necessary for every day use. product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: C. C. Rodgers
content: I have only had it a day but very easy to set up (plug and play basically). I have outlets in my attic so I am running the power into the attic. The clarity is incredible and I really like the fact you can use it to talk back and forth. Some people have complained about the subscription service but all I would want is 10 days of recording and at $100 a year ($150 when I add a 2nd one) I still say that is better than a security company that will run you around $400/year. The people I know that have had their house broken into all had alarm systems (ADT,etc) and the perps basically did a smash and grab so what is the point of paying for an alarm service. I would rather have clear video evidence if somebody broke in. If they want in bad enough, they are coming in regardless. I am looking forward to getting a 2nd one soon; I just wanted to see if it was as clear and easy to set up as the reviews set.
title: Exactly want I wanted and a breeze to set up.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: A. Hawley
content: I got this camera to monitor my front door and porch, mostly to see who's out there before I open my door. I'm home most of the time, so police-report quality images of thieves or vandals weren't really my goal, and I'm not concerned about weeks of backups. The picture is wide angle, high resolution, full color during the day and vividly infrared in the dark. Installation was not complex (took me about an hour from start to finish). Sound quality is very good coming in from the camera's microphone, and maybe a little less brilliant going out via the camera's speaker. It does NOT do well if my phone is picking up my voice via bluetooth earbuds, which is, like, 98% of the time. While this camera is very high quality--really, the picture is amazing, both night and day--I'm docking a star because even if I keep the app foregrounded on my phone, it takes a few seconds to load and show me the current picture, like, who's knocking on my door, or is the cat on the doorstep waiting for her dinner? What would be ideal is a desktop app that I could just keep running in the corner of my monitor, where I'm working all day anyway. Barring that, this is a heck of a nice camera.
title: Slow app but excellent image

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JC
content: Purchased 8 cameras in September 2017, after the surgery then loss for our special horse. The service was great and the ability to record and go back several days was priceless. A year later, all my videos of our then dead and beloved horse were gone. Nest support just said oops! That was my first mistake to trust them further. Very disappointed in this service. Shopping. Law
title: I was robbed today. I’ve paid nest aware since 2018. They took my money with no active account

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Erock
content: I currently use Foscam wifi cameras and had one die so was looking for replacements. The Nest Outdoor Cam seemed to have all the features I wanted, the one in particular which I contacted them to make sure it did was be able to watch live feed 24x7 without any timeouts so I can have the feed up all the time on one of my monitors. After using the camera for about a month here's what I found: Live feed - the live feed is NEVER truly live, it always lags about 30-45 seconds behind what is happening in real time. I have it pointed at the same area as my Foscam and I always see everything first there and then 30-45 seconds later on the Nest live feed. I believe the reason for this is no matter how you connect to the Nest Cam (ios/android app, browser) you are always connecting to their servers and not the camera directly if you are on the same wifi network as it. So the cam is sending the video feed to Nest over the internet and then you are pulling it back from Nest's servers to view it. And this camera is essentially sending and saving all video on Nest server which can chew up a lot of bandwidth. No open standard support - you're locked in to using the Nest website or app, you cannot use any 3rd party cam monitoring tools like Blue Iris, ContaCam that leverage the universal RTMPS streaming protocol. Lag, lag, lag - It's always laggy either watching live or already recorded video. At times it will just sit there and blue circle for a while and looking at the real time feed or playback of recorded video either via a web browser or the ipad app is always slow and laggy as well. You would think already recorded video would playback smoothly as I'm just streaming video from Nest servers but that is super laggy, I have to create clips and download them to watch it smoothly which is a pain. I doubt it's my network either as I have gigabit cable (700Mbps down, 45Mbps up) and a high performance mesh wifi system (Netgear Orbi) as well. I've tried it on medium video quality also and still laggy. Mounting - the mount could be better, almost impossible to mount it on a horizontal surface like under a soffit and have it point in the direction you want, limited to pointed downwards. I had to end up buying a 3rd party mount that had more flexibility in setting a viewing angle. Pay to save - Unless you subscribe to Nest Aware it's only going to show a live feed. With my Foscam I use ContaCam on my PC which records clips when motion is detected and then Dropbox replicates them to the cloud which costs me nothing. I'm OK with paying a bit for Nest to save my footage by $10 for 10 days is not really worth it, add more cams and you're paying even more. If the $10 got me 30 days I'd be happy. Clips - creating clips with the web browser (can't do it in the ios/android app) is cludgy and difficult. Moving there little controls around is cumbersome and laggy. All in all I really wanted to like this cam but I doubt I would by another one or recommend it to anyone else, the lag is mainly what killed it for me.
title: OK but has a lot of issues

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Zoey S.
content: The camera is relatively easy to install and stays put even in heavy wind or hail.  Video quality is pretty decent, even at night time, though don't expect to be able to make out faces of anyone more than 20 feet out. Pretty decent camera all in all... except for the service required if you want to save any video from it.  $100 per year to record 10 full days worth of video which is both expensive and way more footage than most people will ever need, especially since you can create and save clips indefinitely.  On top of that, their service seems to go down pretty regularly and is extremely slow most of the time.  Viewing a live feed is almost impossible as is viewing prerecorded content as it just keeps buffering.  That's not to mention the constant disconnects it experiences despite the camera itself being right next to the wi-fi router inside and having the highest priority of all our devices. It's still nice to have but if they would improve their servers to remove the constant slowness and disconnecting issues then offer a much cheaper alternative to saving the camera footage, I'd give this five stars.  As it is, the Nest subscription and interface are the biggest problems with this product.
title: Great camera, crappy subscription model and servers

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Bettina B. Hawkins
content: i have been using dropcam, nestcam and now google nestcams for many years my original is still working, but not exactly up to the resolution of the latest products. the quality of this pair of cameras looks good, but the industrial design was derived based on a very narrow usage model. let me explain ... The camera is hardwired (has no connector) to a c.10 foot long white cable with a USB-A connector on it. that has a locking cowling attached to it that has a diameter of about c.3/4-inch. That connector and cowling lock into the puck style power supply which itself is hardwired to another c.10 foot long light grey AC power cable. You cannot change either cable, regardless if you damage the cable, need a different length or want to avoid making a large diameter whole through your home wall to thread the 3/4” cowling through. It’s not exactly flexible, and other than enabling a relatively water resistant power puck to be placed outside (if that’s your desire), it’s hard to see who gains from the design limitations.
title: Good product, but limited installation flexibility

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Patryk
content: I went from a hard wired camera setup using the geovision dvr card. Personally i purchased this as i thought it would be easier vs cabling but i was wrong. Positives: -the alerts you get are pretty nice where the camera detects if its a voice, motion or person. -solid design overall and as always nest provides the tools and doesnt seem to cheap out on packaging Negatives: -the wire sticking out if not my concern its the monster hockey puck that you connect the usb to the outlet. -the usb that connects from the camera is also large and you need to drill a big o' hole to fit it through. -quality of the wifi is really trash in my opinion. =i have old and new devices that have full signal however the camera is choppy and cuts in an out in the same spot = having to pay for storage is also frustrating BUT you really dont need it if you check the alerts immediately For me personally there is not massive benefit to owning these compared to a hard wired system going to a computer. If you dont have  or want another computer to be running then i do recommend it.
title: its ok, the cable ends are too large and wifi signal is sub-par

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ed Stubbs Jr.
content: I'm really enjoying my outdoor nest cam! It was a breeze to setup. The configuration to get the nest on my wifi took under 5 mins. The instructions are step by step and very easy that anyone could accomplish. After connected to wifi I took it outside to see if the wifi signal could reach my location and it did.. Great! So next all I had to do was drill a hole for cable.. I used a 3/4 drill bit which was just big enough to slide the end of the USB cable cord thru so it fit perfectly.. I mounted the cam mount and magnet.. plugged it in and we were in business.. The app for this thing is soo soo simple..It's great.. very user friendly and easy to use..I just love checking it all the time! And being able to see live coverage of Everything is awesome! I only have one camera and I don't think 100/yr for 7day footage is bad at all.. Also being able to make my own clips is amazing and great when you want to share something with someone.. I did a ton of research before I bought this, between arlo and ring and other systems out there and I'm glad I chose nest.. Now my only gripe about this is sometimes the live feed will go offline for a period of time randomly and I have no clue why. But it comes back on.. other then that I love this thing!
title: Way better then expected! Love the user experience

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Timothy J Gale
content: The camera has great video quality and functionality, but the wire makes it hard to easily mount.  The USB end of the power cable has a locking ring that makes the hole need to run it through almost in inch wide and you are limited by its length. I do like the magnetic mount  but unless it's up high, it would be very easy to steal this camera. By far the worst is the yearly fee for 10 and 30 days cloud access. NEST charges for each camera, $100.00 for the first and $50 for additional ones.  So please beware that to get the functionality that NEST advertises, there is an excessive amount of yearly cost that must be factored in.
title: The camera has great video quality and functionality

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Sean Bateman
content: I unboxed it, plugged it in, and nothing. It didn't work at all. No lights, no picture, nothing. I boxed it up and returned it. Little did I know, YOU CAN'T RETURN THESE! Amazon received it, 3 different representatives confirmed this and assured me I would be refunded, but nothing. Nada. I spoke to a 4th representative, who helpfully informed me I would not be getting refunded. This is unbelievable. To be clear, Amazon does not let you know this is not returnable, so that's why I'm leaving this review. I would've never bought it - or any electronic, for that matter - had I know they wouldn't let me return it if defective. What a scam.
title: WARNING: You Cannot Return These if Defective!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: D. L. Munchrath
content: Pros:  Outstanding packaging. Quality build. Clean Look.  Ease of set up.  Quality images.  Wide viewing angle.  Sound and speech.  Full time recording to the cloud. Negative:  Unable to schedule when motion alerts are on/off (Are you kidding me?!?  So I either have to manually turn off the camera when we are using the area, schedule it to turn off completely, OR put up with non-stop alerts telling me that I am on my own patio).  Fairly expensive on the cloud recording.  Must be near a plug in that can be covered with the camera view or it could easily be disabled by a bad guy. UPDATE:  Nests response to my inquiry: "Thank you for getting back to us about this. Besides creating a schedule for your camera (which turns the camera on or off as mentioned previously), you can also either set the Nest Cam to only send alerts when no one is home, or you could manually turn off notifications under your camera's settings. Note that there is not a separate setting that you can enable/disable for personal alerts, as these are only a certain type of activity alert.  Since this is always how our cameras have functioned, I'd be unable to provide information as far as if or when we'd offer the ability to schedule alerts while having the Nest Cam remain on or enable/disable person alerts separately." So they are aware but because THAT'S THE WAY IT'S ALWAYS BEEN they don't intend to do anything about it even though their competition has the feature and it would seem to be very basic logic to program.  I downgraded to a 2 star as a result of this response. Our apologies for any trouble this may cause you, and as always don't hesitate to let us know if there's anything else we can do for you at this time.
title: Good cameras but lacks basic scheduling logic for notifications.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Chris J. Owen
content: I'd recommend this camera. I use mine to watch the driveway of my mountain home-away-from-home for strangers parking and to see how much snow is piled up, especially after the plows have been through - useful for when I'm driving up there and need to park. Set-up was easy. For my purposes it works just fine. My reason for 4-stars and not 5 is that the cables are very long, I can see why but if you don't need all of that length what do you do? See photo for my solution, I bought a plastic electronics box from Amazon, modified it and stuffed everything inside, mounted the camera on the front, and just had a short power and camera leads coming out - a nice little self-contained unit.
title: Recommended - with Modifications

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ever_Would
content: These are great cameras. I purchased a two-pack and liked them so much I purchased another two-pack. The install is easy and all the hardware is included. The most difficult part of my install job was adding a power source at the install location but that has nothing to do with the camera install.  Adding each device to my network, app, and integrating them into my “home assistant” was pretty easy. But it did take a bit of work integrating them with Alexa home assistant. I had to uninstall and reinstall the skill a few times and also had to adjust settings in my Google Nest website user profile.  I was also able to share the cameras with members of the household using the Google Home app. The cameras perform very well.  They have a very wide angle aspect which picks up a lot of space.  This is nice since you want as much coverage as possible by a single vantage point. The features all work very well including night-vision, motion sensor, and sound sensor. The app also provides a lot of customization like setting up notifications for detecting motion, sound or persons. The subscription to Nest Aware expands the functionality and adds some nice features and probably worth the cost since it has been priced at $6/month and now supports all the cameras.  This subscription really enhances the Nest Hello doorbell/camera features by adding Familiar Face detection and Package notification and if the pricing were to revert back to a per/camera cost, I would only subscribe the Nest Hello to Nest Aware. I should mention that the subscription also includes saving video/audio capture to the cloud for an extended period of time; not long but long enough to review suspicious events in the prior week or so.
title: Easy home security upgrade

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Razz Man
content: I owned a Dropcam Pro for years, which eventually became the Nest Cam. I placed it outdoors using a pretty well designed, Dropcam Outdoor Enclosure. I worked pretty well, but I did get some steam up on the lens. And from time to time I needed to take it apart and clean off the inside of the enclosures lens. So, I was excited to see the Nest Cam camera designed to be located outdoors. In addition to my order for the cameras, I ordered a 20ft USB extension. Dont do that, the outdoor version has a completely sealed and attached power cord. The instructions call for this to be wired to an "outdoor outlet". If you have a home with waterproof outlets, they would be placed in convenient, obvious and visible locations. If I wanted to vandalize or gain unlawful entry to an home "protected" by Nest Cams, first thing I would do, is, unplug them all. Problem solved. But, the engineering for outdoor use is excellent. Right down to the giant, male-USB jack that is permenentally connected to the lead wire of the camera. This eventually plugs into what must be the transformer/transmitter. If you use this outdoors, there is no way to extend these cables. In my case, I run the cables inside, conveniently through the rafters of my garage. Because of the size of the locking sleeve on the male-USB connector, I had to drill one, giant hole. The sweet spot was a 7/8" boring bit. The cable is small and flat. It potentially could be fished through a coaxial, wall grommet which would seal up a smaller bore hole. There really isn't a grommet made it finish off this hole which you would want to seal to keep out critters. Your only hope is a tube of silicon caulk. Overall, the quality is terrific, and I like the use of a magnetized base for easy positioning. Kudos also for the extra hardware supplied like stainless fasteners and cable clips. Nice touch.
title: Holey Moley!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mariusz
content: Hello and thank you for reading. I have been using the nest outdoor camera for well over a year now and I have to say that I am very pleased with the width of the lens. I would have to use two amcrest cameras that I have to cover the same area as the nest camera, a major plus. The motion detection is great. I really like the fact that you can set up different zones and get alarms based on what zone movement is detected in. I don't really care about when someone walks on the sidewalk, but when there is a movement detected on my stairs, I'd really like to know then. With this camera I can do just that. A big minus and the reason I didn't give the product five starts is the lack of an Ethernet port. I understand that it's supposed to be wireless but I do loose signal from the camera, there are days I loose the signal several times a day, but that might be to an improper router placement, but I cannot change that at the moment. The WiFi signal isn't the major issue here though. No camera is truly wireless, you always have that power cable that you have to connect. If this camera had an Ethernet port I would be able to run a cable, up to a 100m I believe. This would allow me to place the camera wherever I want. Currently I am limited to the length of the cord and my power outlet placement. Besides, I can hide an Ethernet cable quite nicely, not so much with the power cord. Thank you for reading, I hope this review has been helpful.
title: Lack of an Ethernet port is a minus

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Rowe
content: I got a pair of these for our family cabin.  I didn't buy them to PREVENT a crime but I did get them to record and store activity that might need to be reviewed later. I am not disappointed at all.  Nest, as usual, makes great hardware and has the mobile integration down SOLID.  These are easy to setup using a mobile device and they are fantastic quality.  I am going to purchase more of these for sure. The subscription is nice...You get some decent features for the money but honestly, you don't have to use the subscription to have some great benefit...Here is what I learned when the free trial of the subscription ended: 1) I still got alerts in real time with texts and screen captures 2) I was still able to see live views and scroll through time. 3) I was still able to see and store footage to my nest account What I noticed that went away when the subscription stopped 1) Recognition of people versus "movement".  That's kind of important but even w/o the subscription, you can tune this. 2) Scrolling through the history and getting a live real-time preview or "Time Lapse" of the camera.  I didn't think I would care about this but actually it's kinda handy to have.  Still, you can live without it but it's somewhat painful to scroll through history without the preview to "guess" when an event happened.  Once you stop scrolling through time, it will show you the recording but ... They did this on purpose hoping you would prefer the time lapse feature.  I agree. I can't think of anything else at the moment.  I think the subscription is worth it and honestly it's not that bad.  It's $50/year for one camera and every camera you add after is only $30 a year.  So for 2 cameras, it's $80 a year.  In my situation, I think it's totally worth it.  The alerts are fantastic and the AI behind facial recognition is fantastic as well.  The cameras even alert you specifically to PEOPLE TALKING which is a pretty cool feature.  Have someone at your door pounding it and yelling?  Yeah, nest is going to report that to you and record the whole thing. So many other reviewers here do a much better job at the review for these but for me, I review based on practicality and these cameras are very practical!  Love them!  I can't wait to purchase more. Pro Tip:  Nest account lets you have multiple properties.  Ensure that you create a property for the cameras FIRST before adding them.  I already had a nest account for my home with the thermostat so when I added the cameras for our vacation home, I did not make another location and that made things very confusing for the home/away features.  I basically had to undo them and redo them again under a new location.  Normally it's not that bad but when they are on subscription, it's a huge PITA.  The more you know....
title: Fantastic Camera! Even without the subscription

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Bado
content: As an owner of many Nest products (4 Thermostats and 13 Protects), they were obviously my first choice when I decided to add some cameras. Since Amazon was having great Black Friday deals, I decided that it was time to pull the trigger. Set up, as with all Nest products, was simple. Installation wasn't difficult at all, other than having to drill some pilot holes for the mounting plate and the cable clips. A couple of minor nits: 1) I don't like that it has to plug into an outlet. I would prefer being able to have an electrician connect it to existing wiring in the walls. This would, of course, make installation harder and costlier as drywall/stucco etc repairs would need to be made, but it would be nice to have the option. 2) When I first connected, the video I was receiving was horrible. The camera is literally 6 ft from my router, on the other side of the wall (wood frame, stucco). Using my browser, connected via hardline Ethernet with a REALLY fast internet connection (100+ down, 5+ up), the signal coming from the Nest website was choppy, grainy, and continuous buffering. I did notice that I couldn't sign in to my app for a bit, so it's possible the site was just coincidentally having issues when I was trying to do this. However, the video feed in the phone app was better. The picture was clearer, though still choppy and buffering.  I decided to order another network extender, just in case, that I could put on the other side fo the wall, right by the door where the camera is. As I was still setting the extender up, I noticed that the website's video feed was now working nicely. So, apparently it was a problem with the site, but still... was annoying. At any rate, I installed the extender and all seems to be well now 3) When I set up the network extender, I needed to change the wireless network the camera was connected to. This required re-setting up the camera from scratch again, which meant getting on a ladder to re-scan the QR code on the cam. That was obnoxious. Would have been nicer to just use the app to tell it which connection to switch to. That being said, so far I really dig it. I have a second cam to set up out back this weekend, and an indoor cam to bring to our vacation condo
title: So far great, with just some minor nitpicks!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Krishnan
content: Update: The objective of this company is to force the users to subscribe their service. Only the first week,the Person Alert and Short Video recording worked. Now there is No short video recording, No person alert!!! All it does is live video and a single snapshot of the event. All good features are taken off gradually. This is very disappointing.
