I am not asking for continuous recording or other great features. I am asking for at least these two features: 1. Person Alert 2. Short Video recording of any motion or sound detection event. If these two above mentioned features are removed, then what is the use of this camera? I am looking for a good front door camera with recording without any subscription.
title: Good Camera with Audio

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Casey Murray
content: Nice camera with good clarity both day and night. The listen and talk features are nice too. Setup was pretty simple and straightforward. I purchased a silicone skin to make it less noticeable against my house. My problems are with the notification settings. During the free month of nest aware, which lets you review up to 10 days of video, the notifications were sporadic at best. The "person alerts" came through but it seemed to pick and choose which motion detections to send. I would get a notification for a flag waving in the breeze but not a car parking in front of my house, but then I would get a notification as a person walked by on the sidewalk in the distance. It was bookmarking all motion it detected for later review, just being very random about which ones it thought I wanted to know about. One thing is certain: when I leave my home, both with and without a subscription, it would send a notification for the very first detection, wether it was a person, dog, passing car, pedestrian, etc. then, radio silence for most of the day. After the nest trial ended, the person alert has gone away and the notifications for motion and sound are as random as ever. I am still able to stream live video perfectly but even if I got a notification and wanted to check in, they only keep snapshots every now and then for the previous few hours and video playback has been impossible for me. The need for a nest aware subscription wasn't clearly stated when I purchased this product, and it's pretty useless for security without one, and even then I'm not sure it would let me know about the things I want to know about. I'm considering selling it and pursuing another solution.
title: Poor notifications, pretty useless without a nest subscription

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Denzil Khine
content: Not going to bore you to death with why one needs this product. The camera works as advertised - running the wire can be tricky if you're doing on your own with limited knowledge on how to drill into siding or bricks. Once you have the wiring figured out, it is pretty straight forward install. I like the fact that nestaware comes with 30 days trial right out of the box but I wish there is a way to delay the start of the trial period (for me, it started as soon as I registered the product). The quality is pretty good for something that is constantly recording. Provided is the video quality comparison based on data usage setting. One drawback is the notification for the zone movement. It can be overwhelming at times but other times, it downright doesn't notify you no matter the movements in the zones. The video streaming is also slightly delayed. It maybe because the videos are uploaded to the server first and you're streaming back from the server, in some sense it is like watching a slightly delayed DVR. Pro: - Easy install - Looks good and blends in well. Con: - Slight delay with video feed - Notification for zones More updates to come as I just started using it.
title: For now, happy with the purchase.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Peaches
content: Update: After 6 months this camera often goes offline; and usually when I am away from home and need it most! Nest (Google) customer service is also useless! This camera should have lasted for more than 6 months! I would not recommend. The main feature I like is the constant recording it’s very useful compared to other cameras which only record when motion is detected. It allows me to scroll through and see all activity. The night vision on this is pretty useless unless someone is up close. I purchased a set of 2 cameras 6 months ago and Picture quality deteriorated on one camera after 6 months. The night vision is distorted and blurry. The cameras are plug in so you need to be close to a socket. This isn’t as convenient as battery cameras but the constant recording is worth it if you are monitoring a high traffic area of your home.
title: Junk

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mechanical King
content: I'm only giving this a 2-star review because you cannot talk to people very easily on a Android or Samsung phone. AND They still haven't fixed the app to where you can talk to and hear the people outside. In order to see all the footage 24/7 for the past 10 days you need to pay a $150 a year subscription.
title: Costs even more to see footage and you can't talk to people with android.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Dustin Sartin
content: These cameras have been a great addition to our outdoor security. They worked with our existing NEST doorbell camera. We used one of these for our driveway/garage. It has given us additional peace of mind when leaving the garage door open. Also, when I’m traveling, it’s nice to see my children out playing basketball in the driveway. The second camera is currently being used as a baby monitor for our toddler, which is nice because our little one will soon be trying to climb out of her crib. The motion detector will send us a notification so that we can intervene when the time comes. This camera will be re-purposed to a back-yard/pool security camera/monitor after the baby monitor is no longer needed. My favorite feature about the NEST is that I can review 24/7 movements and sounds very quickly by scrolling through the day, so to speak. I also like that they do not require batteries; I don’t want to have to “maintain” batteries in my security cameras. Only difficulty is getting power where you need it. I added an receptacle  in my attic so that the power was minimally exposed under the eave of the house.
title: Great purchase. Highly recommended!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Keyser Soze
content: The good: *I actually like and trust the magnetic mount.  I was not sold on that initially but it actually does a great job and allows for more range of motion for initial placement than most fixed mounts. *Picture quality is good to excellent. *Night Vision is pretty great for seeing out to almost 130 feet from my front door into my yard. *Mounting hardware is quality products. The disappointing: The cabling.  It has an enormous plug that has to plug into a hockey puck sized power source.  I would have expected this from others, but from former apple engineers?  Hell nah.
title: The good: *I actually like and trust the magnetic mount

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Foot 74
content: had the cameras for a few months and have had trouble with only one of them being offline more than it should be. when i contacted support they had me go through several test to try and determine the problem they felt it was my wifi causing the problem which I found strange as the camera is closer to the wifi signal than over half of the devices on wifi in my house. after going through about 45 minutes of the test they wanted me to do i got frustrated and asked them to send me a new camera. they did not respond so i hung up very frustrating to deal with.
title: Service

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: M and B
content: We love it but not cheap! :(
title: Five Stars

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: DavidsList 📝👍💬✅
content: This is outstanding outdoor camera. I've had it for over a year and it worked without any issue during hurricane, tropical storm, snow storm, and even during polar vortex when outdoor temperature was single digit. The camera captures excellent high definition video during the day along with pretty decent and impressive night vision video.  Please note that you will have to purchase subscription if you want to keep more than last 3 hours of recording but they now offer 5-day option for $50 a year with 50% discount for the second camera subscription so it's very reasonable. I wish they would offer 3-day option or even 2-day option since you get notifications as motions are detected and you can save and download video clips so I have never had a reason to look back more than 2 days ago. One of the benefits for the subscription is that the video is stored in secure cloud so even if your camera is tempered, stolen, or destroyed, you can still access the recording up until that moment.  This is the biggest downfall for other security cameras that records on memory card without subscription. I love this camera but more than anything, I love the software app it provides. Nest really nailed on the design and user experience aspects of security camera. Imagine that you went away for 3 days and came back to find out that somebody drove into your retaining wall, damaging it but just took off.  If you had to rewind and review the 3 days worth of recording even with fast speed, it would take some time and would be tedious.  Nest app has easy way to filter only when the motion was captured so you would find it immediately. It also provides advance feature where you can hand draw any specific areas to create zones so that you can easily filter based on motions detected for that specified zone.  This allows me to ignore and not get alerted whenever cars are driving by in front of the street every day but do get notification as soon as any car or person crosses any zone that I have created.  Just look at the attached pictures to get an idea of how useful and amazing this zone feature is. If you are looking for outdoor security camera, look no further. Remember that camera/hardware is just the half of what you need from security and usability point of view.  You need good software to have full coverage. ** UPDATED 11/1/2019 ** Both cameras are still working wonderfully after a year and half and I couldn't be any happier.  Highly recommend this camera for both hardware and software! I hope this helps and if it did, please vote so that it helps others, too. You can leave a comment below if you have any questions and I will do my best to answer your questions.
title: good quality camera with the BEST software  ** UPDATED **

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Gabe G.
content: The Camera itself is great!  The reasons why I rated it 2 rather than 5 is that there is no local storage or viewing. - If the internet goes out it is useless. - With Comcast's new data cap it makes it an even harder sell.  It uploads 24-7, so if you have it set on 1080p (which looks awesome, by the way) it will eat up close to 500GB of data on its's own.  You can set it to only be on during certain times, but I don't know when you would not want to monitor your front door. - Also, if you want to take advantage of any of its features (besides live viewing) you MUST pay a monthly fee which makes an expensive product even more expensive. Like I said, the build quality and picture quality is awesome, but be prepared to keep paying for it through the subscription service and additional data if you have a cap.  I would not recommend this camera to a friend due to it being exclusively tied to the internet ($$$).
title: No Local storage!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Cody C.
content: As with other Nest products, the camera works incredibly well and is dead simple to setup and use. I have a major gripe with the design of the cable though.  The fact that the cable is hardwired to the camera and terminated with a plug that is over 1/2" in diameter is flat-out unacceptable.  This is meant to be mounted outside and, in best case scenarios, wired to an outlet that is not accessible from the exterior of the building.  In my case, I mounted it on the exterior of my garage and ran the cable through the eave soffit.  The idiotic design of the cable meant I had to drill a very large hole to run a cable that is 1/4" across, then fill it with silicone and a rubber gasket. Nest needs to rethink the cable design for the second generation (or better yet, update this product mid-cycle).
title: Great camera, stupid cable design.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: OUT2SEE
content: We have two homes, we use Nest Cameras for security, if one of our three Nest cameras goes offline, which they do for a variety of reasons, you must be physically present at the property where they are installed to put them back online.  Major issue; I'm at our summer home in Minnesota, one of our Nest cameras goes offline at our Arizona home, you simply cannot restore it unless I'm at our AZ home - if I had only known this I would not have spent hundreds of dollars on this technology!!!  When the cameras work, they are great - when they fail and you are away, you are screwed.  GOOGLE, please refund my investment or fix this ASAP.  2020-07-30
title: Cannot restore offline device unless you are at the location

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: J. Stee
content: These outdoor Nest cameras are meeting every expectation for me.  And a big bonus was the change in subscription plans.  The new 5 day recording option really helps enhance the "bang for the buck" from these cameras.  To have 5 days of 24/7 recordings on 2 cameras for $80 a year is a great value. The cameras themselves are outstanding.  The video quality is fantastic both night and day.  The app for the iPhone is intuitive and easy to use.  The activity log is quite powerful and makes for a quick review of the highlights of the day. I have also noticed no decrease in my homes overall internet bandwidth.  I'll likely add another camera to my home sometime this spring.  These little buggers are addictive. UPDATE 11/2018 - I've been very pleased with the usefulness of my first two cameras and ordered a third on Cyber Monday.  Two things I learned during my second order from Nest.  1.) These cameras really would be worthless without Nest Aware.  My third camera is currently waiting (up to 5 days) for my Nest Aware subscription to kick in.  Going back and only getting the limited still images vs actual video from history seems worthless.  You get only a fraction of a person, fraction of a car, etc and so on.  I would not recommend buying these cam's if you plan to use it for live only.  There are cheaper options.  And 2.) I cannot believe Nest is taking up to 5 days to process an order for an existing account, new camera.  It surely seems like they should be able to enable my camera the moment my credit card cleared.  Very unusual.
title: Great product and a great value with the new 5 day recording option.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Caboose
content: The streaming service is HORRIBLE. The camera is about 10 ft away from the router... no matter where I am (work, school, home) it takes forever to stream the video, very choppy and never stable (cut's out after a few minutes to "load" again). Stay away until they can fix their streaming speeds.
title: The streaming service is HORRIBLE. The camera is about 10 ft away from ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Common55
content: Absolutely do NOT buy this camera! My wife works with computers and we have the best wifi you can get in a domestic environment yet 60% of the time we cannot connect with nest app or camera and constantly get the never ending rotating circle of death...and every other device in the house is turned off! When you do finally connect there is a ten second lag time and my wife stood directly facing the camera and the blocky pixels were so bad I couldn’t recognise her! I really have become very suspicious of all the good reveiws I read because the product is ‘not fit for purpose’ ie: a security camera! When you add that you HAVE to buy a subscription to view past events it becomes even more like a bad joke. Not sure I could give it a worse reveiw...how can a multi-billion dollar company get it so wrong? Haven’t a clue! Im boxing this up and hoping to get a refund!
title: Look elsewhere for a security camera.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Tom Burke
content: It is very rare for me to write a "hate it" review, but this time I must. Nest Cam Outdoor is made useless by the fact that that there are WAY too many false alerts--and this is while using the crazy-expensive Nest Aware subscription which is supposed to use "advanced cloud algorithms ... to give your camera smarter alerts". I can't use it at night--when I most need it--because my phone would be beeping constantly from all the "ghosts" it sees (see the photo below--the creepy white centipede is typical). It also gives lots of false alerts during daylight hours, apparently because of light reflections on my house from passing cars. So why have it if the alerts are so annoying that you have to turn them off? And yes, I know about the detection zones you get with Nest Aware, and I have wasted far too much time tweaking them futilely. Also, the cameras too often go offline. This is despite my having a mesh WiFi router system that gives a very strong signal everywhere on my property--one of the routers is just ten feet from my Nest Cams. I also have the power supplies for the cameras plugged into a high-quality Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) that eliminates any brownouts or noise on the power line. And, my internet connection is through a fast fiber-optic service (FiOS) that is very reliable and also has battery backup. So, there is really no excuse (at least, not at my end) for the cameras ever going offline, which makes me suspect that there is a problem with Nest's (expensive) cloud service. I won't be renewing my Nest Aware subscription since it's a complete waste of money. I just wish I could return the useless cameras, but unfortunately it's too late for that.
title: Great for detecting ghosts!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Nickski
content: I will start by saying that this product does almost everything that it is supposed to do. My complaint is that they advertise that the camera can tell the difference between people and small animals.  It can't. As a result, I get lots of false motion alert notifications of someone approaching the zone, when it is just a squirrel or a cat. This becomes frustrating after awhile. I also had to disable the noise alert, because many times when a car goes by on out street, it sends a false alert. Update 4/29/17 Still too many false alerts!  I will say that every time a squirrel, or a cat walks across our porch, I get a motion alert.  This gets a bit frustrating and, like the boy who cried wolf, you start to not pay attention to the alerts.  Of course it will be one of these occasions when a legitimate intruder will be detected and we will not know about it, until the damage is done. Also, I added another camera in another location/zone.  Be aware that for each camera you want on your recording subscription account, it costs $100/year for a 10 day recording period before recording overwrite occurs.  So, if you have 5 zones to monitor, it will cost you $500 per year! It would really be nice if Nest had an option for local recording on my computer.  I suppose that the subscription fees is how they make their millions of dollars per month. Update - I feel like I am a victim of "the boy who cried wolf" so many times, I don't even bother to look at the images when notified of activity anymore because there is a bug that flew in front of the camera, or a squirrel went by on the ground.  Also, both of the cameras that I currently have in use go offline on a regular basis, even though the camera that is furthest away is only about 25 feet away from the WiFi signal and the other is only 9 feet away. Multitude of problems for something that is so expensive.  And then I have to pay an expensive subscription cost in order to get full functionality. I would not recommend these cameras to anyone.
title: Too Many False Alerts - Updated

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: NVW
content: No detection of obvious things like garbage truck, person walking, car passing.  The camera picks up the activity, but there's no tick mark on the timeline, so you have to painstakingly go through the whole history to see what has gone on.  It's bad.  Support was no good at all on this.  I see that other people have the same trouble.  Bought it in 2018, and the problem is getting worse as time goes by.  I'll not renew 'Nest Aware' when current term ends.  I'll just trash this unit and find something else.
title: Does not detect activity/motion most of the time.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Peter F. Gawne
content: We loved Nest Cam while the 30 day trial subscription was active.  Once that expired however, this camera is next to useless.  You only get 3 hours of still images to review, so if something happens at 1am in the morning, you'd better set your alarm for 4am to review the event.  It is too bad the Nest camera gets so stripped down after Nest Aware expires - it turned a really positive experience into a completely negative one.  We'd return it if we could.  We've replaced our Nest Camera with much less expensive Yi Cameras that have improved functionality that doesn't require an ongoing subscription.  To be fair, we preferred the Nest Camera with Nest Aware to the Yi Cameras, but the ongoing subscription price isn't worth the slight boost in features.
title: Only good if you pay for the expensive Nest Aware subsciption - without it, this camera is really poor

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Jon W.
content: This is my third Dropcam/Nest Camera. I would say that the quality of the streamed video is on par with my Dropcam Pro. The specs may be better, but I can't tell the difference at all. Nest "automatically" detects your connection speed and chooses a resolution for you to view your streaming/recorded video in. My experience has been that it will lower the resolution significantly in that process so that you're viewing something roughly equal to VHS video quality the majority of the time. For the most part that's fine as you can tell if someone has broken into your house or if your dog has gotten into the trash. The problem is that you can't tell what he got out of the trash because it all just looks like a pixelated mess. The setup for this camera is actually really nice though. The quality of the camera, the wiring, the mounting hardware and even the plug are fantastic. Everything feels really solid and made to last. The magnetic mount is probably the best thing ever. It allows you to perfectly position the camera where you want it to get the exact shot/angle you need. I'm actually using this camera indoors because I preferred this mounting method and the white case of the camera. The wide angle view allows the camera to be mounted in the corner of my home where it's able to see the front and back doors in the same shot. The night vision works well also. I'm able to see things (with drastically reduced resolution) in the dark up to 25 feet away. While I may not be able to see a person's full facial details in the shot, I can tell if they've broken into my back door 25 feet away. Within about 15 feet you're able to make out a pretty good amount of detail in the dark. Last, and most importantly, this camera requires an expensive recurring service fee. The fees are as follows: $300/yr or $30/mo for 30 days of history for the first camera, and then a 50% discount on each additional camera ($150/yr). $100/yr or $5/mo for 10 days of history with a 50% discount on additional cameras ($50/yr). If you only had one camera and wanted just the 10 days of history you would pay $700 for the first 5 years of ownership. That's ok when compared to a monitored security service. However, if you wanted to have 3 cameras (front of house, back of house, and interior) you would pay $1,548 for that same 5 years of ownership ($348 for a 2-pack of outdoor camera, $200 for the interior, $200/yr of 10 day history). That starts to get pretty pricey. This is the primary reason I had to lower my stars on my review. There needs to be a better option for recording footage. The camera is completely worthless without their service - unless you only want low-resolution live streaming. I was considering an additional camera to look out my back porch but the additional monthly or annual service fee was too much. If there were a cheaper 48 hour option this would eliminate most of the cost concerns. You would have 2 days to login and download footage of an event if you needed it and it would reduce the amount of server space Nest had to make available while saving everyone money. Pros: GREAT installation options Well made camera Above average night-vision Works with Alexa! The Streaming timeline makes it easy to review the entire day Simple, but useful web portal and phone/table apps Cons: Video has never looked even close to 720P quality To make out facial details the person would need to look directly at the camera from no more than 15 feet away Cost prohibitive for multiple cameras - a never-ending fee for every camera is not a good pricing structure No Home server option to hold your videos locally instead of in the cloud
title: Great setup, high price, mid-quality video

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Prisoner of Planet Moron
content: My home faces onto a cul-de-sac, and I had previously installed a dusk-to-dawn light on the front wall of my garage.  As added security (and for something fun to play with), I purchased this Nest Outdoor Cam. The installation was completed today, and I am quite impressed with the quality of the product and the ease with which the camera was activated and integrated into my smart home environment. The physical installation was a bit challenging, as I am very much a senior citizen and it is SUMMER (90+ degrees) in Gulf Coast Florida.  Some years ago, installation of the dusk-to-dawn light required both a junction box and a corresponding hole through the soffit into my attic.  With some difficulty, I enlarged the soffit hole, and with greater difficulty maneuvered the camera wiring through the junction box, through the soffit, and into the attic (warm up there!), where I connected the power cord. Worked like a charm!  The camera is at least 40' from my router, being separated by interior and outdoor walls, but connectivity has been rock solid.  Alexa lives everywhere in my home, including garage and bathrooms, and Nest Hubs of various types are also well-represented.  Using the Google Nest Skill, all these gadgets were soon happily co-existing with my new camera. Pix include: 1) garage, showing Nest Outdoor Camera above pre-existing dawn-to-dusk security light 2) same, close-up 3) detail of connection through soffit 4) screenshot from my PC:  daytime camera view 5) screenshot from my PC:  nighttime camera view (dawn-to-dusk light is on) I have yet to experiment with all the various settings, but simply using the camera defaults has provided very satisfactory results, including notifications via both push and email.  Fine tuning to follow.
title: Quality Product, Easy to Install and Operate

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: mxb
content: These cameras are great. I can only speak from my experience with the app on iOS, but it works beautifully so far. I am a network engineer and had no problems installing, configuring, and since then keeping my 4x outdoor cameras connected and running. On that note: you will need a high quality wireless router and high speed internet connection for constant video uploading! Get this before you setup your system. The app is nice and it alerts me any time any camera detects motion. I get alot of alarms for cars passing my house, but it definitely works. For those concerned these are easy to remove or steal - mount them higher out of reach. The magnet is STRONG and it would take pretty serious force to remove - if someone wants it that badly they probably also have no issue breaking into your home anyway. The cable is hard attached to the camera and cannot be used on any other account while they are paired to yours - so even if a camera is stolen, it's worthless for resale. Also, if it comes to that, you'll have the culprit on camera before it's stolen - so who cares? I have one camera mounted above my garage door, one above my front door, and two in the backyard. They all look great in daylight and the infrared vision at night works nice too - but it isn't as clear, of course. I pay $25/mo for the 4x cameras with 10-days of Nest Aware backup (less than $1/day) and have had no issue at all reviewing past alerts from home or on-the-go. I can see when my mail is delivered, when my trash cans are picked up, etc - and the overall environment is cool since I have a Nest thermostat all tied into it. Most importantly - if you get these cameras, ensure that you get a UPS battery backup for both the cameras and your internet router/modem. (I'd recommend 2x battery backups - one for your internet, one for the cameras). Because these stream over the internet - be careful not to leave a potential weak point of failure. I have heavy locks on my power box, my outdoor junction box where my cable comes into the house, and battery backups running on my router, modem, and another one where all my cameras connect for power. I tested it a few days after installation and each camera uses less than 10 watts even when using the IR lights, meaning all 4x cameras kept running on my battery backup for almost 8 hours.
title: Fantastic cameras, nice app - get a battery backup

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RainNW
content: UPDATE 1/19/2019: Nest Aware, the core benefit of the Nest Camera product, is a complete train wreck. But it is not what you expect to hear. Sure, Nest Aware is great -- it detects people, dogs barking, all sorts of important things. However, where the system breaks down in is the actual billing system. Its a complete train wreck. I have been back and forth with Nest Support trying to re-activate 4 cameras for TWO MONTHS. It goes like this: Order placed. Order goes for days/weeks without being activated. Support contacted with free service offered. Doesn't activate in the timeframe promised. Contacting support again. I have reached 4 contacts now with no resolution. Although, some comforting statements during chat: "I understand how inconvenient it would be for you,"  -- yup, ending in a comma. Likely a canned response. FIRST REVIEW: There are a lot of good security cameras out there, all with so many great features. Here's why I selected Nest Cam over the competition. Pros: 1) All around great video both day and night. The night vision is impressive and perfectly suited for its sole mission: a security camera 2) Easy to install and get running. I had both cameras up and going within a few minutes. 3) Paid service is reasonably priced and additional cameras are discounted. The paid service offers a great value like detecting people, if someone is in the pool, etc, not just recording history. Cons: 1) Inconsistent user experience while on mobile app vs. website. I hate having to find a computer to sit down at so I can get full access to the camera feature sets 2) Requires constant AC power. Has no battery backup if a cable is cut or simply unplugged. This is especially puzzling as the recommended installation is to plug it into an outdoor outlet. 3) Indoor routing of wiring is not an easy process. Right now I have mine routed along door jams and closed windows until I am brave enough to start drilling through the walls with nearly an inch wide bit. The waterproof cable from the camera that plugs into the puck (which then has another AC power cord) has a considerable diameter to have to push through. 4) Cameras take considerable bandwidth and require careful planning of your WiFi router placement and configuration. I have a 3 radio access point, and I put them on a dedicated channel. The cameras also seem to have poor antennas inside. And since the optimum placement of cameras are on the exterior of your house, its sometimes not a great mix. Overall, I am happy with the Nest Cam, and I believe I will be purchasing a few more to complete the coverage of our property. It has made a great compliment to our Ring Doorbell. UPDATE: I added two more cameras to a four camera setup, giving us a nearly 360 view of our house. While our neighborhood is uneventful, it gives us piece of mind and gives us situational awareness of the property. You can't beat that!
title: 1 Year Update: Nest Aware Train wreck, Do not buy

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: John M
content: Why I chose Nest to begin with? Simple, I wanted 24 hour recording with less cables.  The ARLO CANNOT do this. Installation- a breeze minus having to drill a 1" hole through brick to fit the USB cable.  If you cut the cord it voids warranty to this was the only way. Picture- great.  Probably the best out there. Sound- Picks up sound very well.  Mounted 13 ft up and can pick up conversations of people in my driveway. Connection- here is the bad.  Both are not mounted far from my router and my internet speed is 100mbps.  Just a little less by the cameras themselves.  Both my cameras go offline multiple times a day.  After multiple phone calls (they always pick up without a long wait) they told me they're not made to get a signal through brick.  As outdoor cameras you would think most are mounted to brick because the majority of houses are brick.  However, nest says this isnt the case.  Keep this in mind when choosing. Bottom line- choose a good camera system with feed that doesnt require WiFi that way you dont run into issues down the road.
title: Why I would go elsewhere for camera's

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Sara
content: I've only had these cameras installed for 3 days now, but as long as my wi-fi/internet isn't being stupid, they work great! They don't have that Hubble-Telescope-quality picture the super expensive cameras do, but what these cameras provide is more than sufficient. They came with a free 30-day subscription to Nest Aware, which I highly recommend unless you plan on watching the live feed of the cameras all day long. Aware stores what the camera sees for 5, 10 or 30 days, depending on what subscription you pay for and it's not expensive. The install wasn't terrible, just a pain in the arce because I wanted them in hard-to-reach places, so I did that to myself. The only thing I'd change about them is the length of the cord from the camera to the power converter. I only have (1) outlet on the exterior of my house and the way I had to route the cords to hide them (sorry, not removing the siding just to hide the cords when they are the same color), is more than 25' long, but hey, that's what extension cords are for. The Nest app is really convenient and easy to use as well. I'd highly recommend these cameras if you're looking to save thousands of dollars on the expensive set-ups. I'll probably end up getting (2) more if these first (2) maintain a good track record :)
title: So far, so good...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ronald J. Widner
content: I'm shocked this isn't mentioned more often in the reviews here, but the speaker volume is so soft/quiet that the idea of communicating through these things is preposterous.  You know - the commercials where you see someone eyeing that package on your front porch, or some ne'er-do-well milling around your car in the driveway - and you yell at them through the camera and they run off scared silly.  Well, guess again.  They could be standing 5 feet away from this thing and you could be screaming as loud as possible.  If there's a bird chirping or a running car 200 yards away, the thief isn't going to hear a thing you say.  Even indoors, we had the near a running fish tank and you can barely hear it over the little filter motor and the gurgling water.  It's mind boggling really.  My $8 clock radio with its tiny amplifier and speaker can make a noise around fifty times louder than this camera.  I mean, its like all that's in there is the same thing as in a typical cell phone.  What the heck was Nest thinking?
title: Speaker volume is pathetic.  The Talk function is completely useless.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Dusty
content: I purchased this to thwart package thieves and because I am a bit paranoid. So far I am pretty impressed with the my purchase. The video quality is great and the connection is reliable. First, installation was pretty simple, though I wasn't thrilled with puncturing my exterior. I decided to mount this on the aluminum flashing that surrounds my front door, rather than drilling through the vinyl siding. Once I decided on location and got over having to drill into my house, installation was pretty simple. I will echo other reviewers and state that the included cord is way too long if your outlet is near your camera. Following the lead of others, I did not connect the included AC adapter and instead plugged the USB end into an extra iPhone adapter I had laying around and it works just fine. This allowed me to reduce my slack from like 10 feet down to a foot. I use the Nest app on my iPhone 7 Plus running iOS 10. I do have two Nest Protect sensors, but not the thermostat. While the Nest app works pretty well, there are a few bugs that still need to be worked out. My biggest annoyances are 1) only about 85% of the notifications include the GIF and I still get quite a few that include no preview and 2) there are times where the app just won't load the video when I click on a notification and I have to force quit and restart the app and then manually find that point in time. Outside of these bugs, there are some usability annoyances. It would be nice if you could just arrow between events in the app. You can try clicking the little colored dots, but my experience is not consistent. Therefore, jumping from event to event is a bit of a pain. Also, it is annoying that the software cannot distinguish lights from people/animals/cars/etc. I often get notifications about activity only to have it be headlights that shine in the zone. Since my home is located at a "T" intersection, it is unfortunately very common to have headlights in my walkway. The Nest Aware subscription is a bit expensive, but there are not many competitors out there, so it is what it is. Also, there hasn't been a firmware update in over a year (Jan 2016), which is a bit concerning. The picture quality is great, so no issues there. I would love to add more of these around my home, but given the cost of the camera and the subscription service, I don't think I will until things come down in price some.
title: Great video quality, App has some bugs, Some usability issues, Expensive cloud service, Reliable

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Jordan W
content: After a few looking sketchy characters showed up on my porch with what I hypothesized were bad intentions, I looked into security options. This camera fit the bill and had pretty good reviews. Install was extremely easy. I ran the power cable through the attic crawl space (had to use an extension as well) and then installed this camera right above my door. It uses a magnet (held on by a screw to the wall) to keep the unit actually attached to the wall. My first thought was: This could be relatively easy to rip off the wall. So, I made sure to wrap the attached power cable (it does NOT unnattach from the unit BTW) around a rafter to attempt to deter that. But, that was never an issue. The picture is good but don’t be expecting to be able to read license plates from the road. In your driveway, maybe, but the distance is not anything more than should be expected of a camera of this size. Connection to Wi-Fi was easy and I was up and running in less than 15 minutes after the install which took me probably about 45 minutes (longest part was running cable through crawl space and fishing it through the siding). Keep in mind a part of the power cable is roughly 3/4 inch wide, so that is something that needs to be accounted for when doing your install (as it CANNOT be detached or at least could not on my version). But, this was not a show stopper for me. Once installed, I was happy with the picture. Night vision is surprisingly good as well (close range). You will be able to make out a face if they get close enough to the area you have selected to overwatch. The app is very user friendly and allows you to attach and link other cameras, however, the montly price goes up the more cameras you add. But, the subscription service is a must have as it keeps 10 days of recorded material on the nest “cloud”. I paired with one indoor camera as well. (Of note, I hung some decoy cameras and also put up some Brink’s Home Security for additional deterrence). The notifications that the cameras send you can get old but it does differentiate between “motion” and “person”. Expect to get a notice everytime a car drives by or a bug crawls in front of the lens. But, this was not an issue for me. Also, the noticed stop when the app smartly detects that you are “home” once you link the app to your location. I used this product for over a year and the only time the camera quit working was when my internet or power went down. (That is the only draw back - no internet: no access to the camera from your smart phone which is the biggest plus of this product) WAYS TO IMPROVE: There needs to be an option that if a “person” is detected during late night hours (ex. When you are sleeping) that you can set the app to wake you up. I know this was one of the things I wished that app had. Also, removable storage in the camera that keeps recording when the internet is down so that it can be removed and viewed at a later time (with maybe up to a week of storage?) not sure how feasible this is since there is probably limited space. Overall: highly recommended for peace of mind. Durable. Easy to install and de-install. Note: I did not use this product in the extreme cold. Also, the spot I mounted it left it covered from rain/snow. It did survive Georgia heat with no issues though (do not mount in an area that is exposed to direct sunlight). Hope this helps!
title: Peace of Mind

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Travis Palmer
content: I want to say first and foremost that this camera does exactly what it is supposed to do.  I am very impressed with its features and its cloud storage abilities.  If you have high speed internet in your house and its reliable then these cameras will work well.  Literally all you do for installation is pair these cameras and plug them in that is it.  The app on your phone is also wonderful and detects relevant motion perfectly.  I live in a neighborhood where many people are walking by and many cars come and go.  This camera records every car and every person going by and records it as "events" you can scroll through the event video thumbnails and zero in on just who is suspicious easily.  After I installed these cameras at my front door and back I started to notice all the odd behavior happening in my town.  People walking around at 3 and 4am.  Wild dogs running around and a lady who specifically lets her dogs pee on our little patch of land by my mailbox.  You will be surprised also how peoples behavior changes once they know they are being watched.  This camera has a bright green light that lets everyone know hey your on candid camera.  The only downside to this camera is what people have been saying.  It is difficult to pass through your house.  You need to splice the wire and get it through.  Well worth the trouble once you see the results.  Also I wanted to mention that nest offers a cloud service for video storage for only $150 for two cameras for the YEAR! so if anyone complains about that then they are being cheap.  Peace of mind does have a cost and in the internet world that is dirt cheap.  All in all these cameras are great.  Search no more
title: The app on your phone is also wonderful and detects relevant motion perfectly

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Cedric
content: The product has great built quality and the setup was easy. However, I soon to realize the customer service from Nest is subpar. The Nest App on iOS shows the expiration date of the trial, and I was granted one year of free trial according to the App. After one month of the date of purchase, I received a prompt stating the trial is ending soon and I contacted the customer service regarding the inconsistency via Chat. The case got escalated twice and I chatted with three different representatives. All I asked was for Nest to honor the trial expiration date showing in the App (12/30/2020). The representative insisted that the App was showing just a system glitch, but yet the glitch persist as of today. The representative insisted that the customer should know that all Nest Cameras come with one month free trial, but yet the product page and purchase page didn't mention anything about the length of the trial. Without solving my problem, the representative started selling the different subscription plan to me, and I felt a sense of disgust. I'm regretful for choosing Nest and their poor customer service left a bad taste in my mouth. It reminded me of how Comcast/Xfinity used to be. Would not recommend.
title: Disrespectful Customer Service

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: T
content: Camaras are very easy to operate and install. Software and apps work great. There are a lot of false alarms for tree shadows on windy days and we have a bat at night that triggers motion and we get about 10 clips a day of "the bat" but it also catches every car, person and potential threat which we like, having been victims of several breakins recently. Our biggest complaint would be The cameras going offline for 10 minutes or more periodically thru the day This is more than likely due to poor internet service from Comcast and not an issue with the Nest product. I made sure an upgraded my modem So that it has multiple upload and download channels and I also bought a wifi signal repeater to insure each Camara has a strong connection to the home network we supposedly pay for 10mb upload/25mb download speed we occasionally get that performance but it's not consistent and we don't bother complaining to them because it would be more useful to tell a tree stump. Other complaints are similar to other customers the cable end on the camera cord is just way to thick and requires drilling a 3/4" hole thru the side of your house if you want to run the wires inside, without that thick end I could have easily fit the wire thru a 1/4" hole. Hopefully  enough of us complaining will result in a redesign on that,  otherwise installation is great. The field of view is very wide, images are very clear when zoomed out but get very very grainy when zooming In. there is an important trade off because of the frog-eye GoPro like wide angle lenses if you need to read a license plate or identify a persons face the subject of interest really needs to be very close (within about 10ft) of the camera. In order to capture a clear image of the thief the camera really needs to be mounted down where that same thief can probably damage the camera but I suppose by that point you may have a picture of them on the server. If you mount it up high out reach you probably won't be able to clearly see the face. But you will know when they came and how they got to you. So far we like them, but I would highly recommend you check your internet speed and wifi range before purchasing, if your performance is less than what nest recommends I would check with your ISP and find out how much more it will cost you to upgrade and factor that into the total cost of your system.
title: User friendly cameras

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: R. Wilson
content: I bought these cameras 2 years ago.  Google has recently decided that my security cameras MUST have a light on at all times to warn would criminals that they are being recorded.  Because a criminal's right to to privacy is more important than MY safety.  THIS IS NOT OK.  If I had not been able to turn off the light, I would not have purchased the cameras. DO NOT BUY THEM!!!!  There are plenty of other alternatives available.
title: DO NOT BUY!!!!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kindle Customer
content: What a disappointment. Easy to set up, 3/4 hole required in side of house. (that I now have to patch) Alert zones do not work. I spent many hours with tech support trying to get alerts. I was told you need to wait 30 minutes between alerts!!!! So lets say you you arrive home, the system alerts you at the door then the bad guy has a 30 minute window without alerts. I know it makes no sense but 3 different tech support people told me this. When I said I am returning it I got an email saying have a nice day, not can we send a replacement, or maybe an additional camera at a reduced price, not even an extra month subscription. The good news is Amazon was happy to refund us.
title: only 15 foot alert range

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Skyler
content: Amazing cameras, garbage app These cameras are amazing. Great quality, easy to set up, no hassle. But! The Nest app is garbage. The entire thing reloads if you have even a slightly unstable connection (not just a loading symbol-it kicks you back to a screen that says you’ve been disconnected from the service with a “try again” button that just basically reloads the app), there’s no pause button for the video, you can only skip in 15 second increments, you can’t adjust the timeline scale to scroll through just seconds instead of minutes-it makes them tough to recommend in my opinion. Nest just needs to get their act together-they’re owned by google, so their app should reflect that. Other than that, if you just need them for recording, they’re great.
title: Great cameras, bad app

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: StarMile
content: Some days I love it, other days I hate it.  Check your wifi signal where you want to install thoroughly before installing!  The whole point of this camera is that it is outside, which inherently means that your wifi signal is probably weak.  I have bought extenders, and gone through heroics trying to make this thing work.  Some days it is fine, other days it just straight up does not pickup a wifi signal.  Nest support has been little help. Should also note that this requires an ADDITIONAL subscription for saving videos.  If you have another Nest cam, you will need an additional subscription, it is not one fee.  This wasn't clear to me so I was disappointed in this.  Other cameras like Blink I believe are one fee for all cameras. Other complaint is that you should be completely and totally happy with where you are installing before actually installing.  The dock what goes onto the wall for holding the cord cannot be moved without ripping it out of the wall.  It clips into place, but then cannot be unclipped.  When I didn't have a wifi signal and needed to take the camera down and bring it inside where there was a definite strong signal, I needed to rip this out in order to troubleshoot.  This was very annoying. PROS:  Good image quality.  Sensitive motion detection means you get notifications for passing cars, but sometimes wildlife doesn't set it off.  I like that I can speak through it for when people are visiting the house and I am not home.
title: The cons outweigh the good for me.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: karasdad
content: I bought the two pack to use to monitor my front porch and back patio.  Fortunately I have outdoor outlets nearby so the the installation was pretty easy and the wires easy to conceal.  I had previously tried the Arlo Q inside the house facing out but the IR illumination reflected on the windows and washed out the image and I didn't want the battery outdoor units.  I was impressed with both Arlo and Nest imaging and motion sensing but the Nest won for the outdoor application.  I am so delighted with the Nest that I am willing to pay the $10/mo monitoring fee for each camera.  I will probably get an Arlo Q to monitor the inside of my house.  In spite of the hi def claims, it's difficult to id someone on the camera just because it can't capture that detail.  And of course, the more ambient light you have, the better the imaging.  Day time video is dramatically better than night.  The smartphone app (I use Apple iphone) is very good and easy to use.  I did have to add the Netgear WiFi extender ($30) to improve performance of the camera in the back patio but it was an easy enhancement and it no longer loses wifi connection.
title: Very pleased!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: G-Lanz
content: I bought and installed one of these in my driveway after a neighbor was robbed. Less than 3 weeks later, my garage and cars were robbed and I caught it all on my Nest camera. It wasn't clear enough to identify the culprits, but I was able to make out the vehicle and submit it to the police. Also within that first 3 weeks, I caught a USPS delivery driver throw a package instead of gently setting it down. I also caught a man letting his dog poop on our lawn. Prior to this, I thought I lived in a good, safe place. Glad I have this, and I will be installing more soon.
title: Paid for itself in first 3 weeks

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: A Happy Customer
content: I had high hopes from Nest. We have 8 Nest Protect alarms in our home and wanted to add an outdoor camera. Definitely not worth the price tag this product has on it. Video quality is poor, even when set at highest resolution. Cameras frequently lose connection to WIFI router even in close proximity. Night time motion detection is essentially useless, you’ll get plenty of alerts to car headlights, but beyond that a person can walk right up to your house undetected. The app is very buggy and often does not provide details as you’d like to see. It comes with a 30 day trial of Nest Aware, which again is useless when cameras are jumping on and off network connection all day. To summarize, I would label this as a novelty product at best right now. Nest has marketed this product for a “clean design” look and neglected to add quality you’d expect when paying this much for a web cam.
title: Not worth the $

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mirza Mohsin
content: This camera was working well but it legit went to the dump suddenly. I installed it 2 weeks ago and the first few days it was capturing people walking by correctly BUT NOW it doesn't even do that correctly. It legit captures people walking by under motion and worse, it doesn't even capture anything. The pic I attached, I have 4 zones covering the front sidewalk and my driveway and a person walked from the sidewalk, up the driveway, into the back of the crib and legit NO MOTION OR PERSON DETECTED AT ALL. I have the sound setting & notifications on & even have multiple zones covering similar areas so I catch something and in this incident, nothing is captured. I went through the blank periods of history & there's multiple  cases like this where people are walking by and it's not even capturing it at all. This is so flawed, really expected better.
title: this camera sucks ... need help fixing or refund

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: John
content: First, of, this is one really well built and clean design camera, and stellar build quality! The positive: - It's super easy to setup and get working - It looks AMAZING on the wall! - The phone app works great and is easy to use - The web interface is ok, a little slow at times compared to the phone app. - It's easy to download recorded video The negative: - The 1080p video is heavily compressed, especially when people or branches move, most of the time the moving person is just a blocky compression mess, especially if they are in the shade, little chance to identifying someone by there face. But if you just want a camera to see if the babysitter has arrived, or the courier guy is out front, this camera works great. And this wasn't an issue with my internet, as I have 20 Megabits (1.25 Megabytes) upload speed, even the Nest support agent agreed, my internet should be fine. - Night time video is very grainy and average. - You get a lot of notifications if you have it turned on, even with the paid subscription, with only people alerts, often enough I'd get an alert with no one in it. - The WiFi, it's great if you're close to an AP, but if not, it's not great... at all. I'd love for a PoE ethernet powered one, I don't see why not, you can power the camera and connect it to the network at once, everyone wins, no need to find a power outlet where ever the camera goes and will always have a reliable internet connection to the camera. Also, something worth noting to international customers, it seems that Nest only has servers in the USA, so your footage will get uploaded to the US (at least if you live in NZ) and then back down to your country. I don't know how I feel about my security camera footage living in the US, I'd rather it be stored locally in NZ, under NZ laws. Having said all this, I think this is probably the best outdoor security camera for this price and ease of use you can get. Just a shame you can't pay $x/m tp greatly increase the video quality which you upload to Nest, especially if your internet connection can handle it. I returned this camera and bought a Hikvision DS-2CD2085FWD-I 2.8mm camera, which I would only recommend to advanced users. But it has AMAZON crystal clear 4K video and has little grain at night, and all for the same price as this Nest camera. The only downside with the Hikvision camera is that you pretty much have to do all the config/setup yourself, including your own inside or offsite video storage. It's not a plug and play elegant solution like the Nest. If you want ease of use/setup, and don't mind lower quality video, the Nest is for you, but if you know your stuff when it comes to computers, and want to have manual control over everything, then I'd suggest getting the Hikvision camera.
title: Super easy to setup and use, though video quality could be better

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Robert B. Hamilton
content: You simply can't beat these cameras.  Nice and wide field of view.  Crystal clear.  Works perfect at night.  And the Nest system pulls it all together with a great app on iOS or Android or even PC.  Fencing, clips, video storage on-line.  Check check check. These cameras do require a plug-in power supply.  They also have a large unsightly white circular disc that acts to reduce your 120V current to 12V or whatever the camera uses.  That ugly white disc has to mount on your wall and it's unfortunate.  Since you have to plug in anyway you might as well just go with a standard brick adapter.  Otherwise the install is a snap.  Adding your camera to your account is simple.  You scan a tiny little square tag with your phone.  Then you screw a magnetic holder to the wall, plunk the camera in the holder and nail the wire to the wall.  Plug in and away you go. But that simplicity comes at a cost.  First the camera is expensive but the costs don't stop there.  The whole Nest system is expensive.  You have to pay Nest to store your video.  Every camera gets it's own costly yearly subscription.  Ouch.  I justify this by comparing it to the cost of monitored alarm systems.  Then again, you don't have to pay your alarm company for every door and motion sensor.  You pay one flat monthly fee.  Nest should allow you to install 3 or 4 or 5 cameras on one account. So I've had to reluctantly deduct a star for cost and the ugly circle adapter.  Otherwise this is the perfect camera system.
title: Works great but costly subscription.  Ouch.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: ronajer
content: I agree with most of the one star reviewers. The software is muggy. Most of the time, it takes a long time to show recorded activities. After my free subscription ended, I was getting a lot of notification that my camera is offline, several times a day (and night). I still get notification of activities with still picture but there were nothing captured in the picture. Useless. As other reviewers had mentioned they should offer at least 1 day free of charge subscription or have an option of choosing how many days a week of recording. I don't think $10/month or $100/year for a week of recording worth the services and the software offered by Nest. I don't know if I could still return the camera.  What a waste of money. Nest should improve/enhance their software to justify their subscription charges.
title: Useless. As other reviewers had mentioned they should offer ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: john greiner
content: Bought these cameras, they came and looked great but one of the power cords was not working so I contacted the Google Nest user support and it was a nightmare. I spoke to 5 different people, spent 3 hours on hold with them over their chat support  because no phone number available and the manager wouldn’t compensate me at all for the wasted time and inconvenience. I won’t buy any google products again due to their terrible support. I also sent a message to their Facebook Messanager which is what their help website says to do and have gotten no response at all.  Here is a recap of my experience: I spoke to Franando first, sent pictures, told him about the issue. I spoke to him for 45 minutes but he could not process my replacement power adapter order and said I would be called immediately and received no call at all.  4 hours later I chatted again because the help site says that phone is not available. I spoke with Gilbert for an hour. He was successful getting the part ordered for me but I asked him twice about how I would be compensated for the inconvenience. I waited and waited because I was then supposed to be connected to a manager and waited 15 minutes and no connection. I then started a new chat connection with Allen Marie and I finally got a case number created for the first time.  She said I would be connected to a manager and I waited for another 30 minutes with no connection. I have been told three times that I would receive a call and have received zero calls. I have now spent 2 hours and 15 minutes waiting for Google Nest and to talk to a manager and get compensated this huge inconvenience and frustration and horrendous customer support. I have now spent so much time asking for compensation for this inconvenience that Google Nest has caused by sending a defective product. I have also sent this to Google Nest Facebook Messenger with no response despite the help section pointing customers to that because the phone lines are not available. After 3 hours, a “senior support” representative tells me there is nothing Google Nest will do to compensate me for the three hours wasted with them today.
title: Terrible customer support, hope your camera arrives working

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Charles V
content: So far I have purchased and installed two of these and I am pretty happy. I am not concerned about the pricing plan assuming that I can utilize the create clip feature that I have not yet tried. Assuming that works I think the pricing is fair. There are a few quirks: 1. When setting these up on your WiFi it takes a long time to get the appropriate responses back from Nest. I've become convinced there is an actual person there intervening on each connection. The set up app seems to work better than the PC version. The find networks function also seems faster if your device is on the same SSID that you want to use for the camera. I was unable to make use of the scan feature for set up (not sure why) and had to enter the numbers from the back of the camera. Do write these down before placing the camera or covering it with a skin. Due to placement, I had weak WiFi signals and ended up using two NETGEAR AC750 WiFi Range Extenders (EX3700-100NAS) to create dedicated 2.4 Ghz SSID's for each camera. Someone else said it worked better on 2.4 so I just believed them. My advice is to be very patient. Let the system respond before you start cursing much or give up. 2. I had an issue that ended up being related to power fluctuations where I installed one inside my garage. My window air conditioner in the garage is on the same circuit and as it would cycle this caused the issue. This was like a mini brownout (milliseconds) and would knock the camera offline sometimes without it ever coming back. Only the camera by the way and nothing else connected on the same circuit. If you are offline long enough, meaning not WiFi connected, you will sometimes lose your settings. I ended up installing an APC Back-UPS 425VA UPS Battery Backup & Surge Protector (BE425M) between the camera and wall socket. This solved that issue and the camera is no longer dropping out. 3. A small issue on reflection due to putting one in my garage looking out to the porch. I like it much better than trying to find power anywhere convenient outside. It is about two inches from the glass. I have double pane windows. I mounted this on a standard camera tripod standing on top of a table using the threaded magnetic base that comes with the wall mount by Wasserstein. After turning off the status lights I would get an "inside the garage" reflection at night if the garage was not completely dark.  This was all due to backlighting. This was easily solved by making sure the camera had the window curtains pulled tight behind it completely blocking the light (plastic clothes pins work great for this). 4. There is a very brief time during the day (one minute or less) where one of my cameras ends up pointing toward the sun. This is really unavoidable given the placement restrictions. This causes a whiteout of the camera and it shuts off the view and (I think) recording feature for some time (longer than it should). The WiFi remains connected however and the camera will come back on automatically after about five minutes. This is somewhat annoying. 5. As several people have already mentioned. The second piece of the cord, the part that connects to the electric socket, has this ridiculously large round connector to push the USB male end into (coming from the camera). This is not a transformer or anything else useful. It merely adds a few more feet of cord between the camera and electric socket (if you need it). Throw it away! You are better off using a normal USB wall adapter. If you need extra length you can also use an USB extension cable. Both are available on Amazon. Hope this is useful.
title: This is a 4.5 review with lots of advice

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RF
content: we have 5 of these cameras and the a doorbell and we couldn't be happier. Everything is highly customizable, easy to install and configure, resistant and pleasant to look at. The camera captured a delivery guy backing into our mailbox, the doorbell prevented a flooding while we were on vacation on the other side of the world...so we love these products and the monitoring software that comes with them. You have to pay a little extra to keep a history of the events but it's totally worth it.
title: best system ever

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: D. Abbott
content: These cameras are ok when they work. Constantly drop offline (and yes, I  followed all the possible fixes and, my wi fi is fine), see shadows as motion, see people as vehicles and vice versa, at times do not recognize movement or people as an event even though I see them go by with my own eyes, all of the IR lights do not appear to work, range is not even close to advertised. I can understand a couple of these things occuring occasionally but, they all occur frequently. For the price, these things should work much better than they do.
title: Work just OK, when they work

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Marco
content: Had mixed feelings about how this installed outside, with two different cords, USB followed by standard electrical plug in, with a cable just tacked to the wall. But I came up with a cleaner install using Legend Cordemate II wire channel, and drilling a hole at the eves of attached garage, to run the power cord through and plug it in inside the garage. Painted the wire channel to match trim and have a much cleaner more professional looking install. Camera works great, and the viewing and alert app is top-notch.
title: Nest Outdoor Camera clean install.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Quani
content: This was my first outdoor camera purchase and I couldn’t be more satisfied. Actually, I would be happier if Nest ceased their subscription fees but aside from that, I’m absolutely content with this product. Prior to purchasing, I scoured Amazon for the best affordable outdoor camera and sifted through many reviews. This option was at the top of the list. The fact that many reviewers confirmed that it worked seamlessly with their Echo solidified my decision. I also own the drop cam and have been content with it so far. The picture is crystal clear and the night vision is satisfactory. It lags just a few second behind real time but that isn’t an issue for me. Installation was incredibly easy, as the camera can be mounted by a connecting magnet. The magnetic force is strong and heavy winds haven’t shifted the camera a bit. I never use the microphone feature, but upon installation tested it out and was able to hear clearly. It picks up audio very well. It also rarely buffers and accurately detects motion. I love how seamlessly it works with both my echo show and fire tv. When I receive a motion alert, I’ll ask the fire tv to “show me outside” and it instantly shows the view. The only complaint I have is the bright green light that makes it very conspicuous when otherwise, one wouldn’t be aware of its presence. With the exception of that minor annoyance, I’m a happy camper.
title: Works Incredibly Well with Echo Show, Fire TV

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Debrina Maria
content: I read reviews looking for the easiest home security cameras I could find that even I  could install and it actually works wonderfully. So glad I purchased 2 of these camera's. I got one set up in the front of our house facing the driveway. We have had some late night egg throwers. And would love to know who's doing it. Hoping this camera shows us. Also, this subdivision has had numerous vehicle break in's off and on in the past few years. So, I know this camera will be the tool we need to catch some baddies. I received these cameras in 2 days everything I needed to install except I did order one of the brackets because I read that you can get wider angles. It was 15.99. Glad I ordered it separately. First I  tried the camera on the mount it came with. The mount is solid and magnet is very powerful pull to hold camera. However, I was able to get a wider angle and views when I installed the bracket that I ordered separately. This  camera is very clear. I took a few pics. Some during the day, and then at night, with automatic night vision and one without night vision and I turned my porch light on to see if there was a difference. Very happy with this cam so far. Thrilled I was able to install it all by myself, which is saying alot for me. Yay. The app is super easy. I installed it on my laptop so I can see footage in larger screen.  I also downloaded it on my note 8 cell phone. I did not sign up for the service. Trying to see if I can get what I need without it. So far, so good. And the fact it has sound is very cool also. Amazing what crosses your porch and driveway in the night, different wild animals. February 4, 2019 Update: I LOVE THESE CAMERAS.  So far we have caught 3 young guys trying to break in my son's locked truck in driveway and they also went to house next door until it started raining. I could hear them saying oh NO, it's starting to rain come on. Then they proceeded to run in back of subdivision to their get away vehicle. We got to them first. (That's all I will say). Had a Fed X package go to house next door instead of me. I got a notice saying package  WAS delivered to me. It was NOT. I zoomed in on FED X person and you could tell by the box it was MY COMFORTER SET, that I had ordered. So luckily I was able to get it back  from neighbor. Took her a while. I had to show my footage on my cell. (I think the older woman was going to keep it, my packaged had been opened and taken out of the zip up thingy). I have seen a couple of Foxes, a coyote, lots of raccoons and a big snake cross my driveway. And I live in the city. I pay the 5 per month deal and get recorded footage up to 5 days which is all I need. If something important is on the camera I just use my cell to copy it before the 5 days is up. Great cameras. I am ordering 2 for my rentals. So I can make sure if somebody tries to steal my rental AC again, I will have them on camera. Every angle. Cameras are everywhere. If somebody does something they shouldn't be doing they are MOST LIKELY BEING RECORDED. Some of them you can not see the cameras, hidden. My yard maintenance people even have them on their trucks and trailers (the battery kind). They caught a guy stealing their weed eaters off their long enclosed yard truck/trailers. The camera picked up their vehicle and tag and of course the man. They went to the guy's house. Apparently he had been stealing a ton of stuff all over from people. They called cops and not sure what punishment the man got, but all the stolen stuff was taken to the police station and they got their weed eaters back.
title: I feel safer already !!!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: ANNIE
