content: There is no way I can describe here, or that you would ever take the time to read, about the miserable, horrible nest  customer service I've had to endure, getting two cameras installed initially, and then whenever one went out several days ago, the long, abusive wait times I've had to endure just to get a knowledgeable person on the phone.  There are too many people at nest who can't function beyond reading a script.  I've had to explain over and over to people who were of no assistance whatsoever, only to be transferred yet again, to another 'agent."  Long and short of it, I highly recommend to you to search high and low, leave no stone un-turned, make sure, double sure there is NO OTHER CAMERA that would be suitable for your purpose.  In time, you will be sorry you bought nest cameras!!!  Believe me, I will dispense with these two nest cameras in the fastest manner i possibly can.  They are way too expensive for what you get!!!!  NOT reliable products.  HORRID CUSTOMER SERVICE.
title: BEWARE!!  DO NOT PURCHASE NEST CAMERA! YOU WILL REGRET IT.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Benjamin H. Mossberg
content: Good cameras, good picture, good app, but the unforgivable and glaring omission from these is the inability to store video locally and organically. By that, I mean you cannot take and store video directly from the camera to a local storage medium such as a NAS. The o ly way to save video is to choose clips via the app or online and download them from the nest service. That means if you lose internet or you dont have a subscription, these cameras are basically worthless. At this point I'm too heavily invested in these to switch as I spent hours trying to run the electrical cords through the siding and attic but I'm not happy with the options available.  It's pretty much subscription or bust, and you better not lose internet connectivity or your security is basically gone.
title: Fix your program, Nest

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: T Miller
content: Very disappointing after I bought this. The service, motion detection and quality went down hill considerably after google purchased it. I have notice considerable intermittent drops in live video, and literally watched vehicles and people walk within 40 ft of my camera and it never sent an alert. The phone app consistently crashes on my Xs max. And now the last update you the purchaser are not allowed to turn off the status light due to privacy issues which is a joke considering it is google who purchased it. My question is, since when has google been worried about everyone’s privacy?!!
title: Do not buy, it is now owned by google

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Outside the Box
content: Bought these in Home Depots and I am impelled to write about this as to the poor engineering is unforgivable. After hours of time installing the cameras, 2 of them just no longer works one after the other during the summer. Replaced them and in a few days broken again. I went to Fry's Electronics and one of the representatives told me that a few customers brought them back with the same problem. They seem to break when the weather is especially hot, like over 100+ degrees and Nest outdoor camera is specified at 103 degrees maximum, read the spec and verify. The ones that broke were the ones in direct sunlight so that figures. I checked a few other brands, they are not easy to setup but they are rated at 113 degrees, 10 degrees more than Nest. I am sure Nest is aware of this problem, just some users are unable to figure out the reason. Nest should not claim this camera as outdoor with 103 degrees max rating. I want to like this camera, I have the Nest Hello and the indoor camera and they are wonderful, so I do know how to set them up for sure. If the climate in your area ever goes over 100 degrees be ready for the burn out.
title: They are the greatest camera until they start burning up in the summer heat

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: D. Hoefner
content: It's okay - as others have noted it generally does what it says in terms of capturing video. That said, the software is very buggy and the camera struggles to stay connected to Wi-Fi despite close proximity to the router. The iPhone app frequently logs itself out, and does not support FaceID or TouchID, so you are forced to re-type your email and password each time you want to see an alert, which is frequently a passing bug. Annoyingly, the camera often fails to alert for human or dog activity altogether (even though wind, bugs, rain and the like often trigger an alert). For a reasonably expensive subscription service (the camera is crippled without the subscription) I would expect this camera to be better. UPDATE: Have been struggling with Nest support after changing subscription plans. I get varying answers depending on who I talk to, and nobody has been able to get my cameras working again. Most recently the person I spoke with on the  phone cited "engineering" and "back-end" issues that remain unresolved at Nest. FURTHER UPDATE: Video playback remains extremely slow and unreliable. The camera frequently does not alert when there are people clearly and largely in the frame, but will send hundreds of alerts if there is snow or trees blowing in the wind, etc. Per other comments here, it seems that Nest is not sufficiently supporting this product on the back end.
title: Okay but buggy and unreliable UPDATE: still poor quality

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: David J Runt
content: I've been looking for an easy to install outdoor camera that can be monitored from afar.  I selected the Nest Outdoor camera as I'm a fan of the Nest thermostat; I figured this was the magic bullet.  Installation was easy, however I didn't know that the entire housing wasn't magnetic and isn't a strong magnet.  Therefore, I can't set the camera to the best angle, but its close.  Today a bird landed on the camera and now I'm looking at the ground.  The installation is 500 miles away and I have to look at the ground for the next 60 days until I get back to the property.
title: Not a fan

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Al bondigas
content: The delivery was the best part of the deal. That said, Nest is a great idea with a lot of functionality that needs a lot of tuning up for the mass market. The bluetooth configuration is clunky and disobedient. You really have to be right next to it within 10 ft of the camera to configure, so if you're trying to use it as a hidden camera it becomes a little obvious if you have to stand on a ladder with your mobile device to configure it if you change your wireless network. The instructions are anemic and you really have to seem to will it to work navigating the websites FAQ's. Take a picture of the back of the nest camera so you can configure the device without having to remove it. It is easy to remove off the magnet base. Not easy enough to be moved by the wind, but a snowball or a branch might, so fasten the cable close to the camera base to prevent it from falling too far. It uses tons of bandwidth, so make sure your wireless doesnt have limits. Its about 50 gigs/month. The resolution is pretty good, but not so good that a little compression would degrade the quality. It needs to implement a compression scheme for its cloud recording to storage of the video. Seems like the best part is the design of the cloud part of the interface with the camera more so than on the home camera or delivery to the cloud system. Hopefully this will get more refined as time goes by.
title: Great idea, but still a little clunky and data hungry

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: PVJ
content: I've put off video security for years because I couldn't make heads or tails out of the complicated systems which require a DVR, hard drive, etc, not to mention having to send cables through the crawl space. This is a game changer! It's all in one little unit - NO OTHER COMPONENTS NEEDED! Power: Needs to plug this in, however it comes with very long length of cable so it should accommodate most situations. The only issue I could see is if the plug is low enough for an intruder to unplug the unit. Of course they would likely (but not necessarily) be filmed walking up to it, which would trigger an alert - so maybe that's not a huge issue. A wireless unit however might be very convenient - except when it's time to change batteries ;) Having an all in one unit like Nest Cam is a life saver - yes, it's pricier than the DVR kits but you get no muss, no fuss installation and the data is stored to the cloud so no one can simply take the hard drive and make off with evidence. Yes, there is a subscription fee - $100 for one year/ten day monitoring, which I believe means it will save ten consecutive days of data before it records over it. They also have a thirty day option. It's well worth it. Set up: Easy to get up and running and attach. Can I just say the magnet option is AMAZING! I needed to attach one screw!! The instructions are blessedly super clear and well laid out with text and graphics - thank you! I typically dread setting up new electronics - there are always hiccups and lots of frustration - Not with this one! Coverage: I thought I might need two cameras for the front of my home but the angle of the lens is wide enough that one gets the job done. I may need two for the back as there are some trees that obstruct the view. Picture/audio: crystal clear and audio is very sensitive (also can be turned off). I'm really impressed with the features: alerts if the camera detects a person in view, camera will shut on and off if it detects your phone in/out of the house, you can monitor on your phone or computer, and lots more features. Cons: The upper limit for heat is 104 degrees - as I live in the desert where it can regularly be 110-118 degrees, I'm wondering if I need to bring the camera in or if I can take my chances. I'd hate to cook a $200 camera (or multiple as I plan to get more). I suppose I could bring it in during the day and put it back out at night as it cools off - but what a pain - not to mention not feasible when I go out of town in the summer for a few weeks. I may experiment with setting the camera up indoors near a window - wonder what effect the glass will have on it? I can't recommend this enough - go for it - it feels so good to have this level of security for just a few hundred dollars! I'm on the fence as to whether to purchase the indoor camera - it's received some mixed reviews - so going to mull that over for a bit.
title: Not your mothers video surveillance - Great Product!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Gary Woodsmith
content: Good quality, nice design, strong magnet, good viewing angle, good software. Do note that these cameras will use quite a lot of bandwidth so keep an eye on your data caps for your ISP. The data usage estimation range is on nest cam outdoor webpage and located under specs. I talking a range around 60GB-300GB+ per month per camera depending on activity level and resolution. Just keep that in mind, it didn't really come to my attention until I saw the spec page myself. The software features are really top notch, really makes it feel worth the monthly cost. You can set custom activity zones, name them, set their color and shape. You have the option of sharing a link to the camera with or without a password or you can invite someone to have full access to your cameras as long as they register their own free nest account. It feels as though they thoroughly thought this out and use their own products. You can link your nest account to the MyQ liftmaster garage door app, a neat bonus feature. cons: Would like clearer video, but looks fine considering the price. It still gets the job done well, but don't expect to zoom in and get useful details. A suggestion to nest would be to design the attached cables in a way as to make it easier to run behind walls and holes. Needs more color selection when creating activity zones, there are four colors to choose from, the washed out purple being difficult to distinguish from the regular gray activity dots on the nest aware feature.
title: Yes buy this

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Porcupine racer
content: I had these for a year with the subscription. One of the cameras was fairly consistently disconnecting from the WiFi. It was on a 2.4 gHz channel with a direct line to the router, it did go through a garage door, but usually had no problem, just once or twice a month it would disconnect for a night or two. I'd have to go outside, take the camera down, rescan it, and reconnect it. If I was home. If I was away on travel, SOL. The picture quality was decent, but don't expect to get any details 20 feet out. It would generally notify me of motion, not sound. There were several occasions that I would watch some playback and notice a person walks by or a package was delivered and it didn't catch the movement. Kind of a big deal when it would catch the gentle sway of a breeze through the tree. I can't say that I'd recommend this product, it's not bad, but for the price, go with another company. The tier 1 support is also very hard to deal with. They often refuse to escalate you to tier 2 support. It's really quite ridiculous.
title: Not worth the cost

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Steve E G
content: The camera is only held on with a magnet to the mount, which makes aiming it easy, but worries me if a bird lands on it. And it gets warm, attracting bugs. I have very good WiFi at home, but the 1080 image quality is just flat out bad. Nowhere near what the hype would have you believe. I am seriously considering getting rid of these and investing in some wired cameras with a local hard drive system that backs up to the internet. The image quality is not good enough to clearly identify a stranger's face. The night vision is good if you have a camera that is not facing out a window (the infrared emitters reflect off the glass, ruining the image), and if you do, you can turn off the night-vision and still get a decent image if there is some light source. If it was just to see comings and goings, I would be satisfied. However, I really was expecting to be able to clearly identify people at a little distance, and these seem to struggle to provide good quality images, let alone 1080 images. plus, the 10 day history is a little expensive at $100 a year for one camera (then $50 per). For the cost and hype, I expected to see HD. Almost never actually get it.
title: Not quite as good as the hype

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Jeffery P.
content: I went back and forth between Ring and Nest. What eventually won me over was the quality of the Nest camera, specifically the night vision. Ring just didn't have the quality of picture during the night. I've now had these Nest cameras installed for about 6 months and absolutely love them! I had to downgrade the quality that my driveway camera records in because it is so far away from my router. That's not Nest's fault, so I did not let that effect my rating. However you should be aware of that when installing your cameras. I should also note that I do pay for Nest Aware, I have a review of that below. PROS - Nest gives you amazing instructions on how to install the cameras, makes it relatively painless. - They work. Very little downtime. - Cold and heat haven't effected them. I installed mine in shady spots because it gets 100+ degrees where I live, but no issues. - Alerts send to my phone/watch whenever a person is detected. (Must have Nest Aware for this) - The design is solid and looks great! - Easy to use App to control the camera - Quality recording, up to 1080p. I have mine set on lower quality because of router placement. - You can create "Zones" in which you want to receive notifications when something happens (person, motion, or sound) within selected zones. This is really handy! (Nest Aware only) - There are so many options/settings in the app/website to set your camera up just how you want it. CONS - The alerts with Nest Aware are 90% accurate. But it does miss some people from time to time. - You are dependent on your WiFi signal, no local recording. - No battery powered option, have to run a cord. - Night vision is great, but if you turn a porch light on it can slightly distort the image. NEST AWARE I did decide to purchase Nest Aware for my cameras. This takes a good camera and makes it a GREAT camera. It allows you to have a recording history (5 days, 10 days, or 30 days), get intelligent alerts, and create zones. I choose the bottom tier which is $5 a month or $50 a year for 5 days of recording backup per camera. Since i have 2 cameras the second one is 50% off. So I pay $75 a year for Nest Aware. This is well worth it for 3 features. First, having a 5 day back up history is nice. Without this you can only view 3 hours back of your footage. Second, the intelligent alerts are amazing. The camera can tell the difference between motion from a car or dog and a person. I only get alerts from people. This works about 90% of the time. Third, the zones make it so someone walking there dog on the sidewalk won't notify me. But someone walks up my driveway I get notified. This feature cuts the majority of the unwanted notifications out. Personally I think it's well worth the price. If you don't like subscriptions but want some of these features check out the Nest Cam IQ. CONCLUSION Overall I am very happy with my Nest cameras! I highly recommend them. Great product, great company, and great customer service.
title: Very Happy With Nest!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: clib
content: This is my second Nest Product. I installed the Nest Thermostat last year and love it. The camera was everything the Thermostat was and is. Excellent packaging quality parts and a real APPLE EASE about the installation. The sophistication of the package assembly lends itself to a series of steps that are not only easy to follow, but flowed with the packaging.  Right here I rate the product as superior. Following installation and using my phone and my Mac to view various activity including sounds (alerted me by smart phone similar to a text message), I began to explore the HISTORY feature of the camera.  To my great dismay after 30 days the history is completely unavailable on the computer and the prominent presence that it occupied (the bottom of the screen) is now blocked by a banner asking you to subscribe to Nest Aware.  Very frustrating; I can see limiting the history, but to wipe it out all together renders the camera useless; unless of course you want to stair at your screen all day for what is available, which is the active or "Live" shot. So when you consider the cost of the camera, be sure to include the History subscription fee...Because without it the camera is just a window. I actually installed two of these for a friend of mine who had been recently broken into.  Now I will have to explain the rest of the story and the $100+ dollars more that will need to be shelled out in order to restore the history function. Live shot image attached.
title: I installed the Nest Thermostat last year and love it. The camera was everything the Thermostat was ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: YEMSG
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. One month in and I love it! Our driveway is the only blindside of our house and it bugged me that I never knew if someone was coming in. The Nest Cam solved my problem. For those worried about the yearly subscription, there is now a $50/year ($5/month) option. I’m ok with that. If something was to happen, you can save anything you have recorded to your phone or computer. Very easy. Installation was easy for me. I took measurements and thought it out how I wanted to do it. The 1” housing on the USB plug is big and I definitely didn’t want to drill a hole that size in my house. So instead I was able to put the wire through the weather stripping for my garage door. I was able to attach the transmitter inside the garage and only needed 2ft of extension cord to reach the outlet. Definitely drill pilot holes for the bases, it’s your house, make it nice. My router is about 15ft from the camera so connectivity is rarely an issue. I’m getting push notifications into my phone for motion and person detection. Sometimes a big change in shadows or a tree nearby blowing in the wind will set it off but it’s not annoying to me and it’s nice to check in on the homestead. I knocked one star for the large housing on the usb cord forcing many customers to drill a big hole in their house. I’m handy so I would have done it if it was necessary, but to a general consumer it’s intimidating and will probably add cost because they would have to hire a contractor. Another reason is the mic on the camera is cumbersome. Good investment so far. I’ll update if anything changes. My ISP gives me 1000gb/month and I was under 300 for the first month of use. This includes streaming TV (no cable) + general web browsing. My download speeds are anywhere from 20mbps to 65mbps and the picture quality is clear.
title: 30+ days in and loving it.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Secret Monkey
content: I did a lot of research on the best outdoor cams and a super genius geek friend recommended these.  Best buy i ever made. There has been soe wi fi connectivity problems on one, and some notification issues on one but the customer service is unbelievable.  You get someone who reads the notes from previous calls and offers intelligent help to sort out issues. One of my original cams had some notification issues, and after trying a couple solutions, they sent me a replacement.  And it wasn't one of those " when we get your first one back, we'll send you a replacement" deals.  They sent me the new one and patiently waited for the bad one while i recouped from a hip injury. The replacement lost its wi fi connectivity but I'm not sure if that was a technical issue or a "non-geek" user issue :).  At all times i had someone's direct contact info and had follow up emails to make sure all was in working order. Without me asking for it, they reimbursed me for a time when I lost the subscription to Nest Aware, and added on 2 months for free.  Though I haven't caught any intruders in my back yard, I have to laugh when I see this HUGE  spider walking nightly across its web directly in front of the camera!!  Intruder alert indeed! I love that It records sounds, and that I can talk through it!  I live in a rural back woods community and I love to scare the pants off my handyman and the well guy when they enter my gate, and I speak through the camera to tell them the gate is unlocked hee hee:)
title: Best outdoor surveillance camera on the market

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Drjb74
content: I purchased the Nest Cam for a couple of reasons.  I like the size factor.  It is small and discreet.  I also have several other Nest products with I have been very happy with so far. The 130 degree viewing angle allows me to capture the entire yard where the camera is set up.  I also like the HD image.  It makes it easy to identify people/cars, etc.  Having a microphone allows me to talk with people in the yard from inside, such as when my kids are playing outside, I can watch them through the app, and call them to come in when it is time. Setup took about 30-45 minutes, simply because I had to mount the camera, then go inside and run the cable, and then come back out and adjust the camera, etc.  Very easy to do.  The magnet mounting setup is nice as it is easy to put up, and allows for a full adjustment of the camera to any angle.  It is also strong enough to hold the camera in place.  I have not noticed any movement at all from wind, weather or anything else. Connecting to the app was extremely quick.  Clicked on add product, and it found it right away.  The app even tells you to plug it in inside to connect it, and then take it outside to check your wifi signal and see if it will continue to work at your desired location. The only negatives I have are that the attached power cable has a USB end, with a large locking collar around it.  I had to drill a 3/4" hole in the side of the house to be able to thread the cable inside to the outlet.  I filled the hole with foam to seal it up, but I wish the cable would detach from the camera, or that it me a smaller style to not require such a large hole. I also wish there were other color options, as they now have for the Nest Thermostat.  While the white is nice looking, it stands out a little bit on my brown colored home.  A bronze or black color would have blended in better for me. Those two things are fairly picky, but otherwise I have been very satisfied.
title: Simple to install, easy to operate.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: jerry
content: I've set up the zones on this thing 100 times in over 3 years and it never has worked correctly.  It picks up any movement and shoots out an email 3500 times a day which basically makes the camera useless unless you just want to look and see what's happening at the moment.  It picks up cars going up and down my road all day long 24/7 , and the road is waaaaaaaaay outside of the zone I have set up.  I basically just have to choose no notifications at all or have the hundreds of notifications go to the spam folder.  Either way, useless for home security if you want to be notified when the camera picks up something.
title: Has never worked right from day 1

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Merle W Craner
content: I like the fact that it operates on 5 ghz bandwidth and the video quality is quite good. I don't like the lag time from detection to alert, 10 to 40 seconds. Certainly more than enough time for a "porch pirate" to remove a package from your porch and get away. The thing I really don't like is the fact that nearly all the features that made me choose this camera will cost $100 a year after the 30 day trial. ($150 for 2 cameras) This is the third attempt at fulfilling my security needs with a wifi camera. It is also the third failure. If you opt for totally wireless, you will have to contend with batteries and 2.4 ghz bandwidth. You may as well go with dummy cameras with hopes an intruder sees the camera and leaves. With these and other wifi cameras you still have to get power to them so there is really no advantage over poe. Some poe systems require additional hardware but newer systems are able to connect directly to a router and can also provide push notifications to a phone or tablet. The good from my experience is that I now know hardwire is vastly superior to wifi and by using Amazon for my purchases I can return them if I am not satisfied.
title: Quasi-security

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: YSB
content: Likely the best system on the market if you're willing to pay $100/yr for NestAware. The cost is understandable for the 10 days of continuous 1080p cloud storage, however, the other key features which make this system stand out from the others (person detection, zone detection), also require NestAware. One would expect that if you're paying a higher price for a better product, these two software upgrades should be included in the price and not require yearly fees.
title: GREAT if you're willing to pay yearly for NestAware, otherwise overpriced compared to competition

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: upptick
content: Camera set-up is straight forward.  It took me about 40 minutes to get it programmed and mounted, then another 10 minutes to adjust the field of view.  I would give it five stars but for the lag time between a triggering event and the report that appears on my android phone -- the delay is around 25 seconds.  I get it that it takes time for the camera to gather the image, process it, and then send it via cellular link to my cell phone, but one of the advertised uses of the device is to communicate in real time with people in the camera's field of view and a 25 second lag renders that function impracticable.  I would be interested in other user's experience with this feature, whether my lag time is typical or long, and any measures they have taken to abate the problem.  Of course, if the Nest folks are reading this review, I would appreciate a response and some advice.  I do have a wireless booster set up about 15 feet from the camera.
title: Lag time significantly degrades / renders inoperable real-time communication feature

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: AMLabrecque
content: These are great cameras, but they have there flaws. Picture wise, I have no problems. Installation and service is were these fall flat for me. Installation is fairly straight forward. Mount the camera with all the supplied hardware and route the power cable. If you are going to power your camera from an outlet that's inside your home, you need to drill and fairly large hole into the side of your house to pass the usb connection through. This hole measures 5/8" wide. Not a huge hole, but a awkward size to just uses silicone to seal up. I wish Nest provided a grommet of some sort to take up 80% of the hole. When I bought these, each camera came with 1 month free of Nest Protect service. This is a great service, but not worth the money per month, per camera to have it, especially that these cameras are already priced at a premium to begin with.
title: These are great cameras, but they have there flaws

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: N. F. C..
content: These are the best we have tried and I have no reason to try anything else at this point. The subscription fees are very reasonable and you get about a week's worth of full HD saved to the cloud. Picture is as good as it gets for this product type. We've been running multiple Nest cameras for about 8 months now, both indoors and out. Up to 6 cameras currently. We do have a very high speed internet connection to handle 6 full HD streams 24/7 + everything else modern day throws at the connection, before upgrading from comcrap internet we would sometimes get messages about wifi signal but apparently it was just a lack of internet connection speed (as I suspected) It's so great to be out of town, or simply away from home, and be able to pull up a half dozen live* HD camera streams from your home. *There is often a 3-5 second delay, sometimes there might be a 10 second day, tested by walking through the camera's field of view while watching live on the app. Sometimes it's only about a 2 second delay. For the purposes of the camera, in a practical sense, I consider all of those to be live, though. I also have Arlo cameras. They are nice in that you can put them anywhere you want (within WiFi range) without running cords, and there's no subscription service, but they simply do not compare to 24/7 recording, nor do they compare to the Nest's picture quality (regular arlo I haven't tried the Pro yet)
title: The best surveillance cameras we have tried

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: The Technological Consumer
content: I have a home setup with all of the Nest home products.  The thermostat, the Nest protect, and a collection of Nest cams (outdoors and indoors).  My very first Nest Outdoor camera had an issue where it would frequently disconnect and was basically unusable.  I contacted Nest support, gave them some information, and they shipped me a new camera within a day or two.  I setup the new camera, shipped the old one back, and the new camera worked perfectly.  The replacement camera has been operating continuously for about the last 6 months.  The winter weather has had more than a few days below 0 Fahrenheit and the camera did not have any issues or lack of feed.  The night vision sensors are great and have a decent range.  As long as you have them enabled, you can see in the dark.  I bought my second outdoor camera and haven't had any issues either.  I installed a bunch more for family and they are also going strong. One issue I have with this camera is the diameter of the cable connection between the AC adapter and the rest of the cable.  It has about a three quarters of an inch diameter, so when you are running these cameras outside, you have to drill these huge holes in the wall (3/4" or bigger). They fixed the issue with the Nest Outdoor Cam IQ by reducing the diameter of said part, but I can't justify the extra cost for the change. You are required to purchase a Nest Aware plan if you wish to watch your video history.  I wish they had a free 1 day cloud video history option like some of the other brands of cameras have.  I have these Nest Aware subscriptions and they will quickly cost you more than the actual hardware.  The price point of the plans are definitely the biggest con here. Overall though, I am very happy with the cameras.  High quality hardware, great picture, and an amazing mobile interface.  Customer service has been great also.
title: High quality hardware, great picture, and an amazing mobile interface.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: San
content: Every time that you have to  reconfigure the camera, either because it's the first time you're setting it up, or you just changed the WiFi password, you have to connect it to your computer, I've never got the app to work well setting up the camera, and I'm an advanced computer and gadgets user and hardware technician. The app just doesn't recognize the camera, it doesn't find the signal from the camera. The other complaint is about the image quality, either on Auto or on 1080p only, the image is not good enough to capture the face o people or license plates of cars at a not that far distance, but I guess there's no other "smart" camera that has a better video quality for now. The most important feature of a security camera is, guess what, video quality to record the face of criminals or their license plates, the technology has to improve a lot. It's just too expensive to be just a toy that maybe, just maybe, I'll be able to use it to show to the cops.
title: Decent, but it could improve a lot for it's price tag.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: CE
content: At the beginning it was an awesome product, easy to install (despite the huge connector in the cable), app worked great, and the push notifications worked perfectly inside the defined zones. After a month I noticed that you have to pay a subscription otherwise your camera worth nothing, it is just a brick or a paperweight. Well I tried the subscription and the functionality came back!!, but then multiple problems started. 1. One day the full nest service went down. 2. Push notifications were not sent, despite the activity was registered and that the configuration in the app was set to send notifications. 3. The two steps verification failed. It is still a pain with no solution. 4. One of the cameras went randomly offline, despite being just one wall separated from the router. The product is good, but the service and app are highly unreliable and unstable.
title: Not so good

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Maxx
content: Incredible camera. Super easy to install, everything you need is right in the box, almost. I did have to buy a small electrical box to install on my house to hide all the excess power cord. I would recommend that everyone buy an electrical box to install on your house to house the extra power cable. Before I purchased this camera, I really didn't want to have to use a cloud service for my video, but after thinking on it for a bit. I realized this was the best for real security. If you have an enclosed camera system, then your home is not really secured. The bad guys could just break in, steal all your stuff, and just take the pc you are using to run your security system; not very safe. If your video is sent to the cloud then it's game over, that video is safe and protected! The cloud service is incredible. I can watch on my smartphone, my ipad, on my FireTV with alexa, and on my PC! It lets you set up zones so you can receive notification if something happens in that zone. The video is awesome, I can read the license plate numbers from mine, and my wife's car. Also, for those complaining that the video feed resets after 30 minutes if you are trying to use the cameras as monitors, on the PC the feed never resets. I keep it on all day long while I am working. If you don't have a good internet provider, and you don't have WiFi coverage for the areas where the cameras will be setup, you will not have a good experience. I actually setup another router just to make sure the cameras have enough coverage. Very happy with this purchase!!! The only negative is the pricing for the cloud service could be better, and have more options, but for piece of mind, I feel good!
title: So easy to setup.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kelsey
content: I purchased a Nest system this past Christmas, but only purchased one indoor camera.  I decided to purchase two outdoor cameras after both of my doors were being simultaneously knocked on late one night. It is the best purchase I have ever made. I feel so much more secure and safe with these two cameras. The Wifi signal reaches about  30-40 ft from the Wifi router, so I'd say the signal is pretty good. The signal has only gone out one or two times for a brief period in the month that I've had it. I love the apps user friendliness and accessibility. I also love the ability to dictate specific zones that notify when there is movement in that zone.
title: Perfect for Outdoor Security

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: TONibabes
content: Don't be fooled by other 3rd party sellers. They're cheap but it's all a scam. They shipped the item to a different address to look that they gave you a tracking number. Other than that, Nest Cam Outdoor is a great camera & good quality but the monthly/annual subscription of the Nest Aware just killed the product!
title: No to MONTHLY/ANNUAL Subscription!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Katherine M.
content: We are loving our new camera. We have had the indoor cameras but just added this one for outside. The ease of setup was even better than when we added the inside cameras. The only thing you need to consider is where you have outlets outside as far as placement options. As soon as it was activated I started receiving motion alerts on my Apple Watch and my husband on his iPhone. It’s great peace of mind to know what’s going on outside, especially when you’re not home. We are very happy with this purchase.
title: Easy to set up and works great.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: GK
content: Excellent design, dual band (2.4 GHz & 5 GHz).  Works great at 5 GHz but you need a dual band router to use this frequency. I've learned the hard way that the 2.4 GHz frequency band is very unreliable due to all the competing interference from other devices. There are some issues:  First, since this is designed to be used outdoors you might not have a convenient power outlet outside your house.  The problem is the power plug is about an inch in diameter and it is permanently connected to a power module that is the size of a hockey puck.  The "hockey puck" then connects to the camera through a USB 2.0 type plug with a casing that is about 3/4" in diameter.  So it is not possible to drill a small 1/4 inch hole in a wall to connect to the camera from a power source inside a home.  The hole has to be about 3/4" in diameter and that will accommodate only the cord from the hockey puck to the camera.  A good solution would be a USB 2.0 computer extension cord.  I tried this and a standard extension cord of this type will not work properly with the camera.  So you are very limited in where you can place the camera outdoors if don't have a convenient outdoor power plug.  The USB extension cord will seem to work but the camera will only work intermittently and it took me hours to realize that camera placement and frequency band were not the problems - the problem was the brand new USB 2.0 extension cord I was using.  Second major issue - you need to sign up for the monthly or yearly subscription to their cloud recording to really use this camera and that costs a minimum of $100 per year for the first camera and $50 for each additional camera.  If you pay monthly it is more expensive.  I'm very impressed with the superb quality of the video, the wide angle of the camera, the software, the design, etc but it's pricey. Overall however, the system is well worth it to me.  The usual 720p camera resolution on competing WiFi cameras don't come close to the clarity and resolution of this camera.  Also the setup and software that Nest supplies is excellent and trouble free.
title: Great camera but pricey and with some issues

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: D. Pellegrini
content: For a first gen outdoor nest cam - this is very good.  I have half a dozen nest cams in my home and office - and had a few drop cams before that - to say I quite like them.  Many of the other reviews will walk you through what comes with this camera, how to mount it etc - but I had a hard time finding answers to a couple questions I had: 1. Can you use the camera without the power adapter?  The short answer is NO. For those not aware - the wire that is non-removable / attached to the camera ends with a USB plug.  There is then a second wire that the USB plugs into - which terminates in a electric plug.  I didn't need all of this wire - and would have liked to just plug the USB directly into an electric adapter.  Well, I tried it - and the camera does power on - but does not seem able to hold a wifi connection without this extra power adapter + long wire.  Bummer. 2. Can you rotate the black camera part in the housing - like the indoor nest cams - so say you could have the wire come out the side or top of the housing - but keep the logo / camera rotated around the other way / right side up?  Nope - the black part of the camera is part of the white housing - they are positioned together.  The app will let you rotate the flip the camera image 180 degrees - but nothing more precise than that. In the future it would be very nice if they would add a detachable wire to the camera - with color options for that wire, and a rotating camera eye in the housing.  Different cord length options would have also been a nice touch.  Otherwise this is a very nice camera.  I also bought the highly rated black silicone housing - to better blend this camera into its environment - unfortunately the cable is still bright white.
title: I had a hard time finding answers to a couple questions I had...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: CAC1031
content: I had the camera installed for about two months aimed at my front porch but which also catches the sidewalk on the fairly busy street in front of my house. About three weeks ago I had two Amazon packages stolen from the table on my front porch (deliverers didn't minimize visibility--a separate issue) and this camera caught it all.  When I saw the message that the packages had been delivered, yet they weren't there,  I went back through the day and found when the thieves walked by,  waited a minute, and came back and took the packages (a value under $70).  I made a clip, gave it to police and within a week they had identified the the thieves. And THEN,  three weeks later, the detective contacted me asking if I could look into my video to see if it caught a guy walking by who stole a kid's bike off the front porch of my next door neighbor in a certain time frame.  Not only did the camera catch him walking by,  but because of the angle, you could actually see him walking off with the bike.  Police posted a still from the clip on their website and are apparently still waiting for identification. I am thrilled with the usefulness of this camera,  not just because of the above, but knowing when people show up at my door for any reason is extremely helpful.  I've used the talk feature just once, but you never know when it will come in handy. My only complaint,  which I hope will improve over time,  is that I set alerts to come when there is motion detected in the zone I established within my yard so as not to be alerted when people are just walking by on the sidewalk.  That didn't work very well --I kept getting alerts from outside the zone--so I"ve turned them off.  Obviously, this would not be such a problem in less active view areas.
title: Extremely useful!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Fish Boiled
content: basic camera system that comes with the cameras. the program that alerts you and runs the security system only lasts a short period of time then you have to pay to use the Nest system which alerts you of intruders or movement or sound. then you must pay for the system. not to mention the camera system does not work everytime there is movement sound or something in the field of view you want to know about- hense getting security cameras. i would pass on this because not only this they dont work correctly. fault daily. i have unplugged my system and are now collecting dust. wish i could get them fixed atleast but amazon no longer gives me that option. its barely been a month.
title: most basic camera system that slowly decreases in value. READ

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mike
content: After trying the Netgear Arlo System (Twice!) and this Nest Outdoor Camera, I can say that the Nest Outdoor Camera is the better of the two by a wide margin.  The Nest has a MUCH better picture (I had both the normal Arlo and Arlo Pro), Better sound, and it records EVERYTHING for 5 or 10 days straight depending on the plan you get.  The Nest cameras were very easy to install and setup and they easily connected to my home network.  (I had trouble getting all the Arlo cameras to connect to the base station.  They seem to have a limited range.) There are two down sides to the Nest Outdoor cameras:  1 - You have to run power to the camera.  2- You have to pay for the recording.  But, you need power to the camera to have it record 24/7.  And paying for the recording is reasonable  with plans starting at $50 per year for 5 days worth of video. Overall, I am VERY satisfied with the Nest Outdoor cameras.  I was thinking of keeping the Arlo Pro system, (I have 5 cameras), but after using both, I am going to sell the Arlo and replace it with Nest Cameras.
title: Amazing Home Security Camera System

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Alex
content: Horrible! Bought 10 cameras and was very happy until they decided to do an update and take out an option of switching the security light off. “Sorry can’t get a refund because you bought your product on amazon and not from our store directly” “use a duct tape!” SERIOUSLY? A $200 camera and use duct tape? It’s like buying a 55” tv and get an update from samsung saying you can only watch 24” from now on. Give me my money back and update it as much as you want when I use it for free.
title: Avoid if you want to be controlled for your own money

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Michel Faleni
content: This camera has everything you might be looking for, it can operate without a monthly fee, without a recording device, monitors or any of that extra material that was needed before. Records 24/7, so you don't have to rely on the so unreliable motion sensors of every other camera out there. slick design that seems super strong. Great quality, the zone setting is amazing, as it allows you to set exactly where to look for motion/action. All in all great product. Cons: wires are extra think, so to put it through a wall is a bit of a project, need to to use a 7/8 concrete drill bit, which runs for another 50$. After so much engineering, they could have thought about the extra thick usb weather ready connectors. Also if you want/need anything longer than 3 hrs of recording, you need to pay a monthly fee for each camera. I understand businesses are there to make money, but monthly charges seem a little steep when you have more than one unit. Makes you think about buying the extra one. P.S. i am a heavy amazon buyer, and NEVER write a review. After buying at least 6 to 8 different security cameras, this is, hands down, the best version of what i needed. So if you are looking for continuous recording, with easy connectivity, lots of features via the APP, great image, wifi recording. This is your item. I write this review because it is really worth it.
title: What i have been looking for

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Tracey W. Larvenz
content: Attractive camera that goes well with just about any style. It has a very organic aesthetic that somehow can bridge just about any exterior styling. The camera offers very high quality imagery, and you can easily make out faces, assuming you've installed it in such a way to allow that. Set up is stupid simple, allowing you to scan the camera barcode and associate it with your Nest account (or create a new one and associate it). Its functionality is fantastic and I love the ease of installation. It comes with a fairly long cable that eventually plugs into a power outlet. The fasteners included are great. It comes with a number of cable fasteners and high quality screws to set them into your wall. Using a little additional hardware I purchased separately, I've installed mine through the exterior ceiling using a 1.25" bore hole drill bit and an eye grommet that has an insert to allow the cable to pass through. You can caulk around the cable and have a reasonably watertight fit. A 1" bit is a hair too small, as the USB plug is fairly large. I didn't like the idea of someone being able to come up and simply unplug the device from an outlet. ***One thing to note is that there is a monthly cost associated with the Nest camera service, and that service is PER CAMERA rather than a one size fits all that would include all your Nest cameras. Keep that in mind.***
title: Very nice outdoor camera, easy to install, but it could be a little better in terms of the service agreement

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RK
content: Very easy setup for a Tech Dummy like me. Had up and running in less than an hour. Motion detection is good. Will subscribe to Nest Aware when 1 month trial is over as will be adding Nest indoor camera. Only negative I found is power cord is unwieldy and can’t really disconnect it to run wire for setup. Overall great camera with better night vision than my POE Vivotek cameras
title: Great Camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: B. Boyd
content: I have 5 outdoor Nest cameras in two separate locations as well as several indoor cameras. In general they work, but there are a few serious defects you should know about before you buy one. Unfortunately, AFAIK no other vendor has a camera that covers all the bases so I've been willing to roll with Nest for now. On the plus side, installation and setup are a snap. IOS app is easy to use as is the web interface. Cameras have been through one winter in a cold, wet place and one summer in a hot place and are still fine. The indoor cameras turn off when we enter the house and turn on when we leave. On the negative side: - You cannot get person alerts within a zone. In my case, a sidewalk is in view but I don't need to know about every person who walks by. Conversely, I don't need to know about every squirrel and rabbit in the motion zone I set up. I really want person alerts ONLY within the zone but Nest does not support that (I have confirmed it with Nest). If you have person alerts on it will notify you of any person detected in the camera's entire field of view. - Image quality is good for things that are very close (under 10 feet) but not good for a greater distance. If you have a small, tight space - like a short driveway off an alley - you should be able to see a license plate. If you don't, you'll be able to describe a vehicle in general terms but that's about it. - Alerts have a strange randomness. I'll get an alert for a bug or squirrel, but then when I review the timeline there was a person that I didn't get a notification for. - If you have a lot of cameras, the spend for Nest Aware (even the 10-day history) starts to get into the hundreds of dollars a year (after, of course, you've already spent many hundreds on the cameras). The camera is pretty much useless without Nest Aware, as it's required for history, clips, person alerts, etc.
title: Pretty good with some serious defects

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Candace & Jeremy Coyle
content: I absolutely love what Nest is doing in the marketplace.  Their products are innovative, stylish, easy to use, and best of all... they work the way they should!  This camera is no exception.  Install took me a bit, but that was just due to me taking my time to run the wires are cleanly as possible.  Once installed, setup was a breeze with the Nest app on my smartphone.  The customizing options are plentiful, but not overwhelming or unnecessary.  I like how you can choose what definition you want the video recorded at... so for folks who have a slower internet service plan -or- are limited by data caps, you can lower the recording resolution to save on data usage.  In my case - the full HD 1080p recording is perfect.  I was able to easily setup digital zones within the camera's view to stop getting annoying alerts when a car drives by, but still get alerts when someone actually enters my property line.  Nest Aware subscription is kind of expensive when compared to the competition, but the competition doesn't offer as good of a camera in my opinion... so it's a trade off.  But for me - $150/yr for 10-days of recording history for both my cameras is worth it... and far cheaper than a standalone security system from any of the major security companies. One tip for anyone installing the cameras:  Even though they are fully weatherproof, I personally recommend installing them underneath an eve of the home (meaning - not just out in open airspace).  This will prevent them from getting too cold in the winter with all the falling cold/moist air, and too hot in the summer getting beat on by the sun (the directions actually say not to let them get basked in sunlight).
title: Excellent product all around.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: J. Hinkle
content: I've been very pleased with these cameras.  Set up was very easy, the picture and sound quality is great and the options for setting up motion zones and which alerts you get avoids the hassle of getting "false alarms" from things like cars driving by.  We have a busy street in front of our house and the Ring Wireless Camera we tried first simply didn't work as it was constantly sending notifications every time a car went by.  This Nest cam also detects and logs cars as motion, but it is smart enough to be able to identify people and you can set your notifications so that you only get alerts when it detects a person and not for general motion (though those are still logged and you can review them in the app. The other thing I love about these vs. the wireless camera options is they record 24/7 and with the subscription ($50 a year per camera for the basic option) you can go in and review the last  days of footage (longer periods available with higher price tier subscriptions).  With the wireless cameras that only record motion you're out of look if say someone broke in and in failed to detect motion.  With these you could manually review the footage and generate clips and stills even if the motion failed.  That said, the motion and person detection on these has been great so far--much better than the Ring Battery Cam we tried first that was not only triggered by cars in the street but also often failed to record us coming and going out the front door.
title: Great security camera if you have outside power outlets.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Richard L. Eaton
content: This is VERY easy to set up, and very easy to install.  The field of vision is great.  The resolution is fairly good.  I've tried to zoom into my own car's license plates from about 50 feet.  It's all a blur.  I was hoping to capture license plate numbers if somebody pulled into my driveway with bad intentions when I looked at archives.  I did purchase the 30 day archiving option which also includes the ability to set up 4 different monitoring zones.  So far, my largest misgiving is that the unit will occasionally go off-line.  I have an extremely strong signal (-45 dbm) as my router is just feet away inside.  I've had it go off-line while I am using my desktop computer, so I know that my wi-fi was up.  The weird part is that it tends to go off-line when something large moves into range.. like a UPS or FedEx truck delivering to me.  I did contact support.  All I got was try to reset it, move it, etc.  Waste of time.
title: Mostly Great, But Goes Off-Line Infrequently

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Squeaky
content: I LOVE these cameras. I cannot recommend them enough to friends and family. The picture quality is better than anything that's out there right now (in this price range) and the recording 24/7 is what really takes the cake. I have a RING Doorbell PRO for the front door, and three of these to cover the other areas. The RING says it's 1080P, but side-by-side comparison shows that's it not even close. I've even had SWANN 1080P wired cameras to a DVR, and the quality wasn't this good. Daytime and nighttime. The price for the NEST Aware is a little steep. $10 for the first camera and $5 for every additional for only 10 days of archive. In the grand scheme of things, it's not that expensive. If you have one camera, that's the cost of two cups of "designer" coffee. The best feature, which I think is downplayed a lot, is that it records 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Most other cloud based cameras (RING Included) does not do this. They only record when it detects motion. If it misses something, it DOES NOT RECORD. The NEST has a very easy app (and website) that you can view and save your clips. The motion settings are also very nice (must be setup in web browser). You can custom draw and color coat the motion zones. For example, my garage door code pad, I had that a separate color. I can quickly look through, and see if anyone tried to use it based off the color of the motion. You could also opt for local storage cameras too, but if you're worried about theft, guess what's going to happen to a camera that is storing data local? Get stolen with it. 10 days may not sound like a long time, but if something happens to your house, or something gets stolen, you're most likely going to notice right away. And if you are worried about extended vacations, then just up your plan to 30 days while you're gone that month. I've also read other people talking about a 1 - 2 second lag with the live video. Unless you have a local hardwired system with a monitor plugged into it, you're always going to have a lag. Especially if you are not at home viewing over your internet. 1 - 2 seconds is HIGHLY acceptable for 1080P content to stream to your phone, LIVE. The only downside to these is installation. The hole required to fit the cable is almost an inch big. That's a big hole to drill in the side of the house. I really don't think anyone at NEST was thinking about that when they decided to use an USB connector for the power. The cord length seems to be sufficient, and the mounting bracket is very easy to use. It's magnetic, so you mount the part on the house, then it "sticks" to the camera, so you can fine tune the direction. If you have metal anywhere, you don't even need to mount the bracket, just stick it up there. Also, if you ever (for whatever reason) need to change the wireless network name, the only way to connect them again, is by scanning the QR code on the bottom. Make note of that if you are going to mount these 50 ft in the air... I have three of these cameras, two I have NEST Aware subs on, and one I use for monitoring when I need to. These cameras are great if you just want to stick them up and go, without messing with setting up local storage, running wires everywhere and hoping if someone comes and robs you, they don't take the computer the data is stored on.
title: I can see clearly now...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: GEO_TIME
content: Works great. Installing is was easy. Setting it up with app was also pretty easy. 2 things I hate. First is the wire. It’s made to be installed by a home owner so there is a 10 for. Cord off of camera that must plug into another round hub with a usb, then that has a 15 ft. Cord that is plugged into a standard outlet. I can’t find a simple way to put this thing up without having excess wire and that wire hub outside mounted to side of the house. What I am going to do is blast a hole in the cinder blocks below with a 1” bit and fish wire from camera through. It has to be a big hole due to the connector. This will hide all of the extra wire and hub. The second thing I don’t like is the fact that you have to pay to record video footage. But it should be expected I suppose. Just another subscription. Overall it’s great for homeowners. But having electrical knowledge I know they could provide options for expert installers as to limit the wire and hub showing out side. But the camera quality is great. Picks up sounds and any movement. It picks up cars on the road that are over 50 ft away. I wouldnt count on that though because I don’t think they say it senses that far in specs. Overall a good buy.
title: Works well

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: jchugo
content: Item arrived as promised, but was not shipped with an outer box, the shipping label applied directly onto the product plastic. Hopefully the electronics inside are not damaged. The corners are pretty beat up and some of the product plastic was torn (from shipping). I’m glad my building has a secure package room where the item was waiting for me, but not having the outer box just invites package thieves to walk off with some pretty expensive equipment. I will try to install the product and follow up this review after installation.  Just disappointed in the shipping.
title: Item Arrived Without Outer Box

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Maggie Doodles
content: I have been using Nest cameras for over three years.  I bought the cameras because I got a free Nest thermostat when I replaced my A/C.  I access them through my IPhone.  I have outside and inside cameras.  I am running them through my standard ATT Wi-Fi that is in a back bedroom.  They compete with my Sonos speakers and Wemo switches without a problem.  I use them to see in front of my home when the mail comes, garbage is picked up, and lawn service arrives. I use them on my outside desk to watch who comes through the back gate, the squirrels and my dog.  I recommend the monthly service to begin with.  My neighborhood has youth that try to open car doors at night.  I record them.  I also record my Rumba cleaning my house during the day when I am at work. I issue commands to Wemo switches to turn on/off lights, radio, etc. and can verify visually in real time what is happening even if I am across the country.  I watched the neighborhood flood during Hurricane Irma even though I was miles away.  Pretty cool!
title: Reliable

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: F. Brammer
content: Initial Review 8/11/2017: I hate reviewing products after just a few hours or days of use because of the shiny new object effect, and here I am doing a review when I only installed these cameras last night. These are very solidly built devices.  I recently tried a cheaper consumer version and I can tell you these are much more substantial!  I read some complaints about the cords.  I think the cords are perfect.  Power and data are affected by the quality of the wiring and insulation.  These cords are designed for outside use in an electrically noisy environment.  That's a good thing.  They aren't that difficult to run. The field of view is great.  I wouldn't mind a larger one, but there are probably problems with that too. It seems to do a good job of detecting people.  It seems to ignore our Yorkies. I'd like to use it for another few weeks before "recommending" it, but I'm very happy so far. Update 8/14/2017: I think I've figured out the Zones and when I'm notified and the other flagged activity. 1. It seems to do a great job of identifying "People" versus other objects and animals.  Every time it's notified me of a person, it has been a person moving in the "Zone" or camera.  I like that.  There have been times where there was a person moving, but the camera just said there was activity and didn't say it was a person.  It seems to pickup people about 80-90% of the time. 2. Obviously, there is some algorithm at work determining how much of the data/image is changing and at what rate.  The camera seems to rarely flag my Yorkies moving around the backyard, I'm good with that; otherwise, it'd just be saying there's constant activity in those zones.  It's probably because between the size of the dogs and the position of the camera they don't take up much of the "frame".  Bugs occasionally, but rarely set off the "activty" alerts.  When bugs have setup off an alert, I can see why.  They were moving fast and took up a decent amount of the frame.  We learned we have a cat that visits our front door about 2-3 times a week to do some hunting. 3. Zone setup is easy.  The hard part is figuring out the angles.  For example, if a person is standing on my front porch, from the position of the camera, their head is in the street, torso is in the yard and their lower half is on the stoop.  Do I just zone the stoop or do I want to extend it out to catch the activity "earlier" in the approach to the house?  That catches more cars passing by, particularly at dark when the headlights are passing through the zones... Anyway, I like it.  I just need to get it set right for my wants.
title: Impressed, after a week now...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: SheShePTC
content: I bought a Nest door bell camera about a year ago and it works great. I decided to get some more cameras to put around my house for added security. I went with Nest so I could have all cameras on the same app. I spent a day drilling holes into my house and crawling around my attic installing the cameras. Unfortunately, they constantly go off line. My router is very close to the cameras so signal isn’t a problem. I went into the app and made sure the cameras are constantly on, the problem still occurs. I am buying a new house and will instal Ring cameras. I do not recommend these cameras.
title: Constantly off line

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Arrow Flight
content: Great outdoor camera.  I have only had this for a couple of months, but it works pretty much flawlessly. Just plug in, check your location and be sure your wifi signal is working via the app on your phone or tablet, or computer.  I have mine located on a detached garage about 40 ft from my router and it works great. I love the fact that it will send you notifications on your devices when it picks up movement or people. You can program specific zones to monitor within each cameras ranges.  You can also specify  which camera setting you want, i.e. 1080, 720 or Auto. You can turn notifications on or off. You can schedule times your camera runs. I also records sounds pretty well. I can hear conversations up to15 ft away from the camera and you can also talk through the device if that is something you need. Perhaps at your front door etc. You can turn the monitor light on or off on the camera also.  Pictures are pretty clear, but with a super wide angle, some items may appear smallish, but you can zoom in to see things better once it has recorded.  My only complaint is when you zoom in on an item, the clarity is not the best, (night mode mostly) but perhaps there is a fix I am not aware of yet.  $10 month or $100 year for 10 days of stored video in the cloud. A little more for 30 days of video.
title: It doesnt get much easier than this for an outside camera.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: GF12
content: Nest Windows 10 app is non-functional.  Nest will try to steer you to chrome (of course google owns them), but firefox does work.  Just don't ever expect a Microsoft compatible app if you were thinking of viewing on a PC.  "Camera off" notifications (which cannot be blocked unless you turn off all Nest notifications in your iPhone settings) are actually WiFi signal lost.  Not a big deal unless you get a wake up notification at 2am.  And no turning ringer off on your phones doesn't block these notifications nor can the Nest app.  Nest considers this a safety feature.  At my house common to get brief cable issues multiple times a day briefly losing WiFi.  Never did get the "away from home" feature to work that supposedly sends notifications only when phone out of range.  Bottom line is you have to activate camera notifications from your phone settings rather than Nest app unless you want stray notifications all day.  Resolution is okay - but not as sharp as you might think for 1080p.  Cable connector is large - about five times the size of the cable so expect to be drilling a large hole if you have to go through a wall - on the order of an inch in diameter.  Nice concept, but WiFi link and Nest app leave a lot to be desired.
title: WiFi link and app issues

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: OnTheEdge
content: I installed my new outdoor Nest cam in late September without problems.Having tried a couple Foscam outdoor cameras, I've been very happy to avoid some of the problems I had with the Foscam cameras.  Just one example, Foscam would make software updates every month or so, and these didn't occur automatically, so I'd have to call customer support, and often waited 30 minutes or more for assistance.  Nest cam automatically updates (as does my Nest thermostat). I really like the wide camera angle and high quality video, and especially appreciate the ability to designate areas in the camera's field of vision which should be highly sensitive to motion. I also highly value the email notifications when there is unusual or significant motion, particularly if it is a person, but not if the motion seems to be less significant or inanimate. I'm able to view live streaming from my iPad at any time, which is invaluable when I'm traveling. While it's not critical to me, the ability to hear any sounds in the area via the embedded microphone, and respond and speak via the embedded mini-speaker, would certainly be helpful for those who have reason to interact with people in the vicinity. (My camera is pointed at the back deck and beyond, and not normally intended for interacting with people in the area). The reason I don't give a full 5 stars is because the camera is a bit pricey ($200), plus $10 per month for 10 days of video history or $30 per month for 30 days of video history.  But overall, I'm very happy with the capabilities of this high quality outdoor camera!
title: This camera may be easy on the eyes, but the real beauty is within!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: donalddavide
content: The outdoor nest security cam is a great solution for home security. It has crystal clear picture and the app is easy to work. Pairing it with the Wink hub allows for automation based on notifications the device sends. Like turning on the garage lights when it detects motion in certain zones. The only draw back is that there is a monthly charge to have saved recordings and for the zone options. Having many cameras this can add up pretty quick.
title: Great outdoor cam, but no replacement for a centralized DVR/NVR system.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RVator
content: This the third outdoor camera that I have. They are all the same. When I first bought them, Nest allowed you to turn off the light on the cameras. Since then, they changed it so that now you can only dim it. Besides the fact that these are my camera, not theirs, I have no control over the lighting? Now, I get at least 20 tp 25 nag notices of movement every night due to bugs going after the lights. I sent them an email requesting to have control again over the light. They gave me some BS line and refused. In addition, during the day, when the sun is out and the wind is blowing,, again, I get notifications of movement due to shadows from the leaves in the trees as they get blown around with the wind. I would never buy these cameras again. I have to turn off the notices which defeats the purpose of having the cameras in the first place. If the phone is anywhere near us at night, we get woken up by all the notifications. Find another manufacturer that allows you to control your own cameras.
title: Endless notifications

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: TJ Stiles
content: Nest has now " migrated to google" and I dont want Google to have anything to do with the video surveillance in my home or business. Furthermore, now every time I want to log in to see my cameras they have this complete bitch of a process where you have to open your email and wait for a code to get into my account. This is the exact opposite of safety. I hear someone at my door late and night and I need to see my cameras,  now I have to wait 5 minutes to get to my cameras and see who's at the door. 5 seconds could be the difference between me getting rolled by a meth head out here, and being able to defend myself against a known intruder.
