This renders the camera system absolutely useless, unless I want to see what cats walked through the parking lot at 3am. 2 step verificatiin??? I didn't ask for that. Google migration? No thank I dont want Google having the ability to access my cameras for any reason. Read that fine print folks, if you go over to Google, they can access your cams anytime they want. Hell no. I just bought 2 more nest cams and I pay for the subscription, they are going in the trash. Thanks for breaking something that wasn't broken nest! Good job!
title: Dont depend on them, cant access quickly.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Rob
content: Ehhh...It’s alright. Claims to be 1080p but I don’t see it. Maybe if you don’t zoom in at all, but the picture can be choppy and you can’t read a license plate pass 20 feet. In the picture I feel like I should be able to read that license plate no problem. Update: So far the zones don’t work that great I get a ton of notifications for alerts outside my zones which is very annoying. Also I don’t always get a notification when someone pulls into or out of my driveway, kind of defeats the purpose. I’ll give the camera another week to see if it improves, if not I’ll be returning it and going with Arlo.
title: 1080p I don’t see it.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: J. Scott
content: I ordered two of these cameras, set-up was a breeze. The hardware, product design and aesthetics of the product are GREAT. I've been using the two outdoor nest cams for a couple of days and have been pleased with performance and was considering adding two more cameras to the system so I would have four total. However, that plan came to a screeching end when I realized that the monthly monitoring/service fee of $10/month for 10 days of 24/7 history only covers ONE camera. Each additional camera is $5/month. So, quick math, purchase price of 4 cams, $686 and Annual subscription of Nest Aware for three cameras (purchased annually for year 1) $350. Annual subscription for year 2, $350; year 3, $350 (as so on). At the 3 year mark, I would be at $1,736 in cost. Each successive year adds $350 in monitoring. What I was expecting when I ordered the camera is a cost investment of $686 and an annual monitoring cost of $100/year. At year one, I would have been at $786... by year 3, $986... this is what I was expecting, not the $1,736 that Google/Nest is charging for Nest Aware I do have the ISP network bandwidth to run these cameras over my network, however, with the hidden costs of running these cameras, they are going back. No where on the Nest site do they disclose that the 10-day monitoring of $10/month ONLY covers ONE camera. SUMMARY: These are being returned and I'm buying a stand alone security system with wired cameras for around $500 that will not have any monitoring fees.
title: False advertising regarding monthly monitoring

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ken Henderson
content: Love these cameras and the ease of install and setup.  They really Look great and work great.  Video is really good.  24 hour recording I think is the reason for having security cameras.  Like most I think the cord could be redesigned for running thru walls or soffit.  I’m not crazy about the magnetic mounts while they are convenient and hold strong.  I’d prefer a mounting bracket that attaches to the camera making for a little stronger unit and harder to knock off or steal.  Maybe just me but I’d like more secure mounts for security cameras.  If you mount these well out of reach it’s not really an issue.  But above a door while being in reach they can be easily disabled.  Love the wi-fi no cables to run to a recorder. Love the app seeing everything on my iPhone or iPad.  I do recommend these and I would buy again.  I prefer the ac power over battery units that record only if they detect motion.  And I did not want to deal with changing batteries. Who wants to drag a ladder around the house to replace batteries.  If the mount and cable were redesigned I’d give these 5 stars all day long.
title: Great cameras, easy install, easy setup.  Not crazy about the magnet mounts Or the cord design.  Still 4 stars...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Jessica Riese
content: Bought another Nest camera. Tried to add it to my Nest account that I prepaid for. Could not add the camera. Went to Nest support which forwarded me to Google. Google told me I had to talk to Nest. They sent me a link to Nest which forwarded me to Google. I told them what happened and they gave me a new link. When I tried to click on chat it said "Chat being cancelled" and then asked me to take a survey. When I tried to take the survey, it forwarded me to Google. lol. Mercy
title: Google ruined the product

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: MSG
content: I own four of these outdoor cameras and they are not terrible, but I will never buy another Nest product. Their privacy change forcing the green light to be on all time negates the majority of these cameras usefulness. The fact that they changed this after So many people purchased them has made me very unhappy with them as a company. I was already not too thrilled about the fees for storing the camera video in the cloud (your only option), but this is a final deal breaker. I hope they bring a class action lawsuit against them to maybe recoup some of my money so that I can replace these with camera from a company that actually care about their customers.
title: Ok at first but incredibly disappointed now

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Brian Earley
content: Once Google took over this, it gets a ZERO, during the last four days I’ve spent over four hours on the phone with Nest and Google.  Now  I try to imagine standing on line at my local Walmart or Grocery store for FOUR hours trying to resolve a problem with a product that can’t function because their website isn’t working correctly. Promises made and unfulfilled. This is pure rubbish and bush league.  I bought this system because it was Amazon’s Choice before they took a new direction.  Left in the dust, Amazon you really let me down.  My five hundred dollar investment is now nothing more than Fake Camera’s. The squeeze I’m feeling isn’t warm and comforting.
title: Never again.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: E Summers
content: There are other cheaper cameras out there that probably do the same thing as the Nest Outdoor Camera for cheaper but no one has the slick and easy to use interface that Nest is known for. It's so easy to bundle groups of cameras and other smart devices from the Nest line of products. The old adage is true, you get what you pay for and with this camera, you are paying for quality.
title: High quality camera for a steep price

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mohsin
content: BUYER BEWARE: The camera itself is great but I was not aware that it comes with a subscription...You get a free 30 day trial and then afterwards you have to pay $100-$300 a year PER CAMERA just to view recordings of your camera. It's all cloud based so it's why they're charging you for it. Personally I have an 8TB HDD that I could store the video files in but then of course Nest won't be bringing in revenue. Basically after the free trials, the cameras are paperweight and are only feesible when you're actually watching them 24/7. Otherwise someone could walk in front of them and break into your house, steal something off your front door, or anything else, and you get no notification or video capture. You do get "snapshots" every 4 hours or so...but if something happened between those other hours...you're basically SOL. For the price of these cameras individually...I should be able to save the video capture myself if I wanted to or put them on the cloud for $100-$300 per camera. I have 4 cameras...I am not going to pay $1200 a year just to be able to watch a recording...
title: If I had to do it all over again....i wouldn't buy them

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: better media
content: I think the product is good but the Customer Service stinks. One of the two cameras I purchased stopped working. I went through all the troubleshooting steps and it would not connect to wi-fi. I called Nest Support. They took approximately 10 minutes to answer and then another 10 minutes of questions but they couldn't fix the problem. When I said I had spent enough time on it and I needed a replacement the woman got rude and confrontational and told me I should have called when I had more time. Well, that got me riled up. I talked to her supervisor who eventually did ship out a replacement. I really did not like that first rep's attitude. It's hard to believe how lousy customers are treated these days.
title: Stopped working and Nest support was rude and confrontational

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: bkv64
content: What I expected this camera to do is keep an eye on my driveway and my back door, and alert me if it sees movement. It does that very well. There is just about a 5-10 second delay from when the movement really occurs and the notification hits my phone. That’s pretty impressive to me. This camera was easy to set up, easy for me and my husband to mount, and easy to adjust if needed. During the day, the video quality is really good. It’s not too great if you zoom though. The night vision could definitely be much better. It helps if we leave the porch light on. It picks up sound really good! Although we only use it just playing around, the two-way audio is pretty good too. I’m still in the trial period for subscribing to the paid service, and the jury’s still out on whether I’m going to do that or not. I use an iPhone and have an Apple Watch, so I get the nest notifications on my watch and I can view them usually immediately. Having the nest camera gives me peace of mind knowing I can be alerted and see if someone pulls up at my house when we aren’t there. I would absolutely recommend this camera to my friends.
title: Does exactly what I wanted it to do.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: City Gent
content: I’ve owned Nest and previously Dropcam since they came to market. I watched Google stumble badly while it tried to make the camera company part of its home automation project, Google Home. I’ve also watched many companies including Anker struggle to match the quality of the cameras while elbowing in this crowded market. Netgear’s Arlo, Blink (soon Amazon Blink), and a hundred other companies are out there trying to carve out a place for themselves as homes shift to using smart devices. I’ve stuck by Nest because they’ve been generally reliable and willing to replace defective products. Their app is easily the most user friendly on the market and informs the user when the camera feed can and does go down for no apparent reason. Installing Nest Outdoor was very easy. The hardest part was deciding where to put your device. Your decision will be limited in part by access to an outdoor power socket. Also, you will need to decide where it’s aesthetically ok to place a camera. Work this out ahead of time to save yourself the grief of having a shiny new camera and no good place to situate it. Overall the installation process was simple. My only criticism/complaint is the stingy quantity of screws and fastener clips provided. There should be, in the immortal words of Zoolander, at least 3 times more of them.
title: High quality outdoor camera that’s a breeze to instal

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Tampa8
content: Update - DO NOT BUY YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED... Four problems have developed. First you must wait for a code to be sent now to see your cameras as a security step. Not every time but often. Middle of the night you get an alert and yep - you have receive an email with a code to sign in. Second outages occur much more often and one was long enough they gave a partial refund if you use the monitoring feature. But they continue an hour here, 45 minutes there - I always check and it is widespread when it happens. Three - There is now a nagging screen on top of everything else to make you switch your account from the original NEST account to now a Google account. The problem is if you have others allowed to see your cameras, maybe family, extended family whatever if you do migrate to the Google account they will have full control of your account. Staying with the original NEST account keeps them from being able to change the sign in etc.... Now a fourth problem has happened. When you get the page that says you need a code to sign in, NOW YOU HAVE TO ALLOW THIRD PARTY COOKIES. There are many work computers including mine that do not allow that so no signing in to check on your house. There is a reason not to have 3rd party cookies enabled, so at home in addition to everything else just to sign in to see my cameras I have allow then turn off 3rd party cookies. The camera itself has a very good picture but the problems as described have mounted up.
title: No longer worth all the hassle

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Bhlaguna
content: This is a really nice product packaged with everything you need to get it setup and running.  They really thought through the installation and everything you need is in the box.  I have the Nest indoor cameras and so do my kids to monitor their babies rooms.  Excellent and reliable. But, I wanted an outdoor camera with enough resolution to capture a license number and a picture of someone walking up to the house for security.  This camera doesn't have the resolution for that.  If you know the person the camera sees you can easily recognize them but you can't get a clear enough picture to give it to the police.  I want a camera that can capture a license plate from at least 40 feet away. If you just want to monitor your front door and capture someone about 10 feet away, it's a good fit.
title: I need higher resolution.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Damian
content: I needed to record and store 24/7 video because of a neighbor complain. It was impossible because: - This camera goes offline for a few minutes multiple times a day. - There is no way to stream to a DVR, PC or other local solution. - There is no practical way to download all YOUR videos from their cloud, you have to go hour by hour creating clips and downloading them. Regarding the offline problem, I found many people complaining in forums but no solution. My internet connection is solid and I have Google Wi-Fi with the main AP about 10 feet away from the camera. I knew there was going to be trouble when setting up the camera, because instead of the single mesh this product detects the individual APs. Some aggravating product flaws: - There is no way to change wifi settings without actually going through the setup again, what a pain. - There are no statistics available to understand what is going on with the connection and troubleshoot it. With respect to the cloud storage, they locked things down so you depend on their service to keep records. Either you pay a fortune and have 30 days of records (what do you do if you need more time?), or you spend your precious time creating and downloading clips by hand. I also tried support, mostly because some mess up with subscriptions I ended up with (yeah, their web portal also sucks) Waited on the phone 30 minutes and nothing. Tried the online chat and I was number 54 on the queue until I gave up. After this I just returned the product.
title: Unreliable product and money grab subscription

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: James Glackin
content: I am very pleased with this camera, the advanced features/service, not so much. The camera itself, the construction and the quality of the picture, is great. The installation was so easy, I was scared that I missed something. It was far too easy. There's nothing more I can say that hasn't already been said about this camera. I have seen some reviews on the service and I will echo that the advanced features are great, on paper, but in reality, they just don't cut it. For me, I set up a zone for right in from of my door, essentially my door mat, and most of the time, when someone is at my door, there is no notification. The nest video feed recognizes that there was movement in the zone, as there is a green marker in the video history that is indicating that there was movement detected in the zone, but there is no notification. However, when my neighbor leaves through their front door, I will also get a green marker on the video feed indicating movement in the zone, even though they didn't go anywhere near my front door (8 feet away). I only sometimes will get the pop up alert and generally about 30 seconds after someone enters my zone. So, you can have someone come to your front door, knock on your door, and leave before you even get a notification that they are there (UPS drivers are notorious for knocking, waiting about 2 seconds, and then leaving). I made numerous calls to Nest, spoke with numerous technicians, had an open trouble ticket and nothing was ever resolved. It just isn't that great of a service. If you have a house, where your zone would be your front yard, and you have little traffic, maybe this would be ok. If you live in the city, where you need to specify a small area, in order to filter out neighbors and pedestrians, and you want an immediate notification when someone is at your door, I say skip the advanced features. They are worthless.
title: Great camera. Mostly useless special features.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Sydvicious_89
content: I didn't know this until I opened the box and started setting it up, but it is impossible to review events that happened even seconds earlier without a subscription, and 3rd party applications are impossible unless you're willing to use a public URL. So if Google sells nest or changes their cloud services to force obsolescence of old products, then you will have nothing. Security cameras are supposed to be for piece of mind. How is that when you have to constantly watch the monitor so that you don't miss something that can't be reviewed, and if you did see something nefarious, you will have nothing to show the police or investigators. This product is a lie.
title: works by subscription only

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Raynard C. Vinson
content: Had nothing but problems with the cameras. One camera had a night vision failure.  Replaced it. Cameras kept losing wifi signal. Camera recorded a vehicle break in but didn't alert us. Bluetooth connection process is a bust. Don't install them where you can't reach the usb connector to hook it to your laptop. They look nice but are a disappointing product. We even installed wifi boosters within 10 feet of the cameras. Operation was still erratic. Too late to return them. I wish someone would steal them.
title: Erratic Failure Security Camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Amanda Crenshaw
content: Great camera, great feed, easy to mount and install and set up. Love the fact that you can create your own monitoring zones, and the ability to determine how the camera reacts to each zone (with regards to notifying you of activity). The Nest app and website are very user friendly and the notifications we get on our phones are great, because I can see a thumbnail of the picture on my lock screen. I never knew we had so many stray cats in our neighborhood. :) I love how versatile these cameras are; you can basically put them anywhere, and position them however you want. The magnet that holds the camera to the base is VERY strong. I also love that we were able to route the cable under our siding and into our garage (that part... wasn't so easy, but my husband is a total champ). That way, we don't have any cords going in through the garage door, and no external outlets that need to be secured. I also love that you can buy silicone skins in different colors to match your home/surroundings. I got one in gray and one in brick red, and they match our house great. (Please ignore the white cable; I'll be securing it and painting it to match the stone eventually.)
title: Great Home Security Cameras.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: DJ_Ramo
content: Don't take all negative reviews as gospel. I've had a great experience with my Nest Cam Outdoor. Pretty darn easy to install and setup. The Nest Aware service is extra, but I knew that prior to purchasing. I believe you need to make sure your WiFi signal is strong enough to connect prior to purchasing the camera; this will help with a lot of potential headaches. The actual software to notify me of recent activity or seeing an actual person works perfectly. Someone here placed a negative review that the notification is too late and does not actual catch the "activity" in the act, thus a waste. I disagree, I received a notification of activity, and the screenshot had a bird in the clip (see my photo). I saw the video and the bird is quite fast, yet it was still able to catch it and notify me. That's pretty darn good. Overall, I'm happy with it. My only gripe is the placement of the power brick that's smack dab in the middle of the length of cable. I will be sure to follow up once the Arizona summer comes and see how well it holds up in the heat.
title: Great Security Camera for both  Inexperienced/Experienced Users

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: acmd1633
content: Simply amazing.  Probably the coolest thing I ever bought.  Very customizable.  One customizable feature I would have loved to know about before I installed it was you have the option to install it upside down and then rotate the image 180 degrees on the app, which allows the cord to come off the the top of the camera instead of the bottom.  Super high quality images and sound.  Very well made and very easy to install.
title: Buy one for your peace of mind

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kz
content: Picture quality is good.  Set up is easy. Customer support is awful, sent in two questions and each took a week to respond, with the responses being worthless. Instructions on how to use (both camera and software) are almost nonexistent.  Have to learn as you go. They say you need to subscribe to utilize 5 day + recording, which is understandable; but nowhere do they tell you that the camera is pretty much worthless without the subscription.  Actually missed out on an issue when the trial subscription ended.  Thought it would at least record a small amount, but it didn't - just a snapshot that was out of focus.
title: Good quality camera, easy set up, but instructions, information, and customer support leave a lot to be desired.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Eric D. Stein
content: Used to love this, but the recent change that forces the green led light to be on while recording makes this visible on the outside now. I will not be buying another nest cam and I have the doorbell, this, and 3 indoor cams and buy the subscription. No more.
title: Green Light constantly advertising camera locations now

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ryan Wagner
content: We already had several Nest indoor cameras, and so we decided to buy a couple of the outdoor cameras as well so that we could take full advantage of the night vision. Previously we used a couple indoor cameras and suctioned them to windows to monitor things like our front door, but the downside with that approach is that the night vision has to be disabled otherwise at night all you see is a reflection off the window. By actually using the Nest Outdoor Cameras we are able to use the night vision since the cameras are no longer placed behind windows. The quality is superb just like with all the Nest cameras, and the cloud recording is reasonably priced. The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the power cord. We essentially had to punch holes from the outside wall to an inside wall, and then plug them into an outlet inside. From what I've read these power cords are not rated for installation in attics or anything, and so passing them through a wall is really one of the few options. That did work out well though in the end, and we filled the holes with "Great Stuff" gap filler. The holes needed to pass the cord through was much larger than I would have liked them to be, but using the gap filler helped make sure we didn't leave a hole for weather/insects to get through into our house. There may be better solutions for that, but it was the easiest we could find.
title: Great Cameras, Installation Options Could Be Better

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Scott Herz
content: It's very cumbersome to mount. I ended up having to build a stand out of wood to hold it. The bigger problem is Nest Aware. For as much AI capability as Google apparently has, this thing is constantly confused by the world. It freaks out at shadows and completely ignores people sometimes. We've been on the phone with support for weeks trying to figure out why it doesn't turn on and off when the app says it should. That's still unresolved. Still, it's one of the few cameras that doesn't have known backdoors in it. I wish it didn't suck.
title: Keep hoping this product will get better. I never does.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: James M
content: If you like being notified about every shadow, bug, critter, or any other useless event all while paying a monthly fee this is the perfect security camera for you. If you're planning on running more than two Nest cameras just buy a real security system with a DVR. To use the Nest camera to its fullest potential you need a solid Wi-Fi router as the camera is also a data hog (300GB a month). The 20 foot included USB power cord always seems to be 4 ft too short to reach the nearest electrical outlet. It is also absolutely retarded that you have to drill a 1/4 inch hole to run a simple wire through because of the oversized connections on the ends of the power cord. Never pay more than $150 for these cameras.
title: A Perfect Security Solution If You Don't Care About Real Security.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: D.Perkins
content: Received my camera a week ago.  It was easy to set up.  The daytime viewing is excellent, however, the night vision is not as clear as I would expect it to be.  When mounting it, you need to be able to extend the camera out beyond the mounting surface so the night vision isn't affected by the surrounding material.  If it can see the surrounding mounting surface, it causes a glare interfering with the night view. The video recording is an excellent tool to allow you to go online to see your entire day, if desired, but especially to monitor your alerts. Setting up to their app was quick and easy.  You will need to mount your camera in an area that is closest to where your wifi router is so it can pick up the signal.  I have a router at one end of my home and an extender at the other end, which should allow me some flexibility in where I can put my cameras. I would prefer immediate text alerts instead of the email alerts because there is a delay between the activity and the alert.  We are currently using the camera to try and help us catch a feral cat before winter sets in.  After we catch the cat, I plan on relocating the camera to a different part of our yard for security purposes.  I just ordered a second camera for security purposes and may add a third.  There have been some teenagers breaking into ungaraged cars in our neighborhood and in our town recently. 11/8/16 Update:  Not sure why, but I am now and have been shortly after I posted this review, getting immediate alerts when the camera sees or hears something outside, which is exactly what I was hoping for.  P.S. Still haven't caught the cat.  Was hoping to get him caught and indoors before winters frigid temps hit.  We're still trying.
title: Great camera for outdoor video monitoring

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Justin Henry
content: I love this camera.  It does so many things you'd never think you need until you have it.  The app is great.  It notifies you when there's motion.  It even knows the difference between a person and some other object.  You can send clips of videos to people, etc.  The nightvision works fine too.  The big catch is that most of this functionality is on a trial basis.  If you want to keep it you have to pay a yearly subscription fee.  If you don't pay the fee you can only view the live camera feed and see still images of things that happened in the last 24 hours.  Pretty f$%^ing lame if you ask me.
title: Awesome cameras with lots of features, IF YOU PAY A YEARLY SUBSCRIPTION!!!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: New York
content: I love this camera. I already have two indoor cameras with Nest Aware subscription, but at my new location I needed an outdoor camera as well. The traffic is really big on the street, lot of people coming in/out and walking by, and with a bus stop right in front of my door, so I had to keep an eye on the outside area. Therefore it was a no-brainer to buy my outdoor camera from the same brand/company I already use indoor. It is Nest. It works really well. The emails notifications are super, I only need to click on the link below the snapshot picture on the email and it takes me to that timeline on the 24/7 recording video history. But I also use zones, in fact 2 different zones, with different colors each. And, even if I just browse the timeline on the video history either on my phone or on the web, I am only looking for the colors of the zone I am interested in. It is that easy. Otherwise I would have to go through hundreds of markers what is going on the street. That would be really crazy. Nest really made it super easy and unbelievable pleasant to know only what I want to know. I only was afraid of the drilling part of the installation when mounting it on my building's wall (concrete/masonry), because I had to make 3 holes on the wall to mount it. With my brand new hammer driller it worked out much easier than I expected. Well, I am a female, and never driller before. I did not even had a driller. I had to purchase one, so I had really no clue about how to drill and what is what. But it was not that difficult. I also checked out some YouTube drilling tutorials. Oh, yes, and with the camera the package includes all tools needed for mounting the camera on walls, and routing cables  through out. So, you do not need any extra. Maybe an extension cord for your driller, unless you use a battery based driller. Enjoy it !
title: Super convenient to follow up (Nest Aware subscription) and really great quality video recording 24/7.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: momentum
content: I can't tell you how much I am satisfied with this product. I thought it would be complicated to set up and it is not. The designers have thought of everything as far as I am concerned. I installed it myself. It comes with a magnet that fit securely on my metal door which overlooks the front yard. I didn't have to run the wire outside which is what I initially planned to do. I connected to an indoor outlet and to the adapter and voila video feed-obviously after setting up the blue tooth and wi-fi connection first. The package comes with all that you will need except the tools obviously. There is a youtube video that explains how to go through the steps and so far the camera has logged the FedEx delivery guy. The quality of the photos and video is excellent. We had an incident with the neighborhood kids alleging that some vandals broke our mailbox post so we bought this to secure our safety and prevent any hearsay. Now we will have proof of any further property destruction. Thank you for making set up a breeze.
title: I can't tell you how much I am satisfied with this product

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Dan
content: First thing to note when it comes to Nest cameras is the need for "Nest Aware" if you want to use some of the premium features such as people detection. The pricing can vary but ultimately it's around $6 a month. With that aside, the camera is great for the price. The camera itself is pretty small and extremely easy to mount. The image is pretty wide and can cover just about the entire yard. The Nest app is clean and easy to use and seems to have a pretty strong/stable WIFI connection.
title: Very simple camera to set up. Good picture and detection

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Michael shaf
content: UPDATE 6/13/17 Changing my review from 3 to 5 stars.  The offline issues have completely stopped.  I assumed there was a strong wifi signal near my camera because my phone seemed to indicate there was one at its location.  However, after installing a wifi extender near the camera I have had zero offline issues.  Really liking the camera now and customer service has been responsive with help!  Thanks Nest! Generally works about 95% of the time.  I do get offline issues about once per day (about 10min offline/day) and they are not due to connection issues since I verified a strong wifi signal.  Expect to pay for the monitoring $100/year otherwise it is useless.  Picture is clear though.  On the fence whether I would buy another one though.
title: Very good camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Amber D
content: These are great cameras, and the picture and sound quality are awesome. They disconnect from the wifi a lot. its quick and usually last a minute or 2 before it kicks back on, but that can be frustrating.  I made the mistake of mounting one on the side of my garage under a flag. If a flag is anywhere in the view of the camera be prepared for constant notifications. I suggest also having a long cobweb broom to remove spider webs that inevitably will form. Spider webs moving in the wind and spiders set off the camera motion too. The last thing you want to see when opening a motion notification is a spider filling the screen.
title: Love these

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JasonSM1
content: It's hard to identify what is best with security cameras, frankly just having one attached to the house dramatically reduces the likelihood someone will break in. But, if you're like me and you want it to be easy to setup and work efficiently - then these cameras are for you. Took less than an hour to have them up and running. I like that they plug into the wall, that way I don't have to fuss with batteries. Video and images are great. It notices a lot, so the alerts were something to get used to, but well worth it for the piece of mind.
title: Easy to install and work in all weather, day and night

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: That Guy
content: Installation:  Took me about 1/2 hour to get 2 cameras installed.  Simple drilling of 2 screws to mount the magnetic base, then magnetically attaching the camera to the base.  The cameras are small and inconspicuous. App setup was the same, very quick and easy. Functionality:  The picture is great in both day and night.  High Def picture on my phone and computer.  The cameras can be set to notify you of movement and/or when it senses a "person" on the camera.  The movement/person sensor is accurate 100% of the time, so far.  The app is super easy to set up and use.  Sound is solid too. I can hear the kids playing on the driveway, down to the little side discussions they are having. I can also talk to them via the app, and they can hear me clearly. Wires:  Because these are powered, you'd have to have a power source/outlet nearby in order to plug in the camera - or account for where your wires will be placed, unless you don't mind them being visible.  I have siding where I placed the cameras, and was able to tuck the wiring into the siding far enough to the ground, then run an extension cord on the ground to the plug (buried the extension cord in mulch, to the plug). I will likely be purchasing an additional camera.
title: Great system and easy to set up.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: M. Service
content: This is a great device if you have an concerns about security. If your reading this you are getting packages from Amazon. This will allow you to see who’s at your door if your home or away with the app. With the ability to address anyone around the camera it could help scare off someone attempting to steal a package. Plus, you can install it high enough that someone won’t steal or damage the camera. Not taking a shot at Ring but currently people are  prying them off doors, or walls. This works for me, but would assume there are other good cameras out there.
title: Great Product.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JUSAYHI
content: I absolutely love everything about this camera. I had the old bullet style IP camera and it was a major pain to set up and maintain. The Nest is plug and play and super easy to install especially if you have a metal place to just stick the magnet.  The picture is super crisp and clear during the day in full color and it picks up sounds as far away as 150 feet! I plan to buy about 5 more of the outdoor model and 2 more of the indoor model.  You will be happy with this camera. I did a TON of research on ALL the available cameras and after months of studying the information, I decided on this camera and I am totally pleased.  Thank you to Nest for inventing this camera!!! Update 11/28/17: So I love this camera so much that I bought two more, and get this, one of them was delivered today and I caught on my currently mounted Nest Cam, the Amazon driver literally throwing my new Nest Camera out the passenger side window of the delivery truck while still seated in the drivers seat. The camera crash lands on my paved driveway...all caught on my original Nest Cam!! So funny, but so sad.  I had planned to return it as damaged since I don't want a cam that has been in a crash, but now its out of stock...so, I will keep it for now and hope it works ok.  One plus is Amazon informed me they have a 60 day return window on electronics so that will give me some time to make sure its not damaged.  I also reported the deliver incident to Amazon.
title: I plan to buy alot more!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Chad Maddux
content: DO NOT BUY!!! Google Nest has decided that the privacy of burglars is most important so they have decided to disable the ability to turn off the blinking green light on all cameras. Now, burglars can easily spot these cameras in the dark so they can avoid, cover, or disable them. Thanks Google for protecting the burglars!
title: Burglars Can Easily Spot Camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Todd W. Carnes
content: Mounting is a little tricky as you can't mount at a 90 degree angle but it's not a show stopper.  The magnet mount is very strong and has handled high winds without issue.  The cam is in use outdoors in Western Arizona where daytime highs this summer topped 120.  The camera never showed signs of heat issues.  The picture is very wide and the ability to zoom and lock on that zoom for future views is great.  I mounted in a balcony fence railing and am able to zoom in a little bit to exclude the rails from the image.  The picture/video quality is decent but not great.  Some areas are not sharply focussed.  Not sure if that is due to signal strength issues.  I plan on getting a wifi extender and will report back on how the video improves if any.  The phone app and website are easy to use and offer full screen viewing.  The 2 way sound is a plus.  I use it to hear thunder during heavy storms.  The audio isn't great since it gets blown out by wind easily but good for those storms that haven't yet kicked up the wind in the area.  Set up was easy if you have any wifi setup experience.  A little better wifi performance and a completely focussed image would make this the best residential outdoor cam.  As it is, I'm happy with it.
title: Nice outdoor cam with very few issues

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Daniel Zawistowski
content: The Nest Cam Outdoor security is a great concept and has good video and audio quality however its usefulness for a home with a moderately busy street and sidewalk is very poor. My major complaint about the Nest Cam is the Nest Aware service (which without the service the Nest Camera is practically useless unless you want to watch the live video feed all the time) which feels like a beta product with limited real world applications. My scenario is something was removed from my property and I only noticed the missing item afterward, but I am not sure when over the last 5 or 6 days to was stolen. In my case due to neighbors walking their dogs and families going for walks I have numerous email alerts and even more fales alerts due to lights from cars activating other zones. It seems a dramatic change in light levels will trigger a zone alert. So, I know something was stolen from my property and I can't find at least when and any photo from the timeframe unless I want to review days of video or hundreds on email which I would have to look at individually. My opinion is the Nest Aware and therefore the Nest CAM is a beta product which in the future could be a useful product for homes on busier streets but not now. I would not recommend the product to any of my extended family until the Nest Aware significantly improves. The new car smell wears off quickly and I feel I got caught up in the "reviews" for very tailored use cases.
title: The Nest Cam Outdoor security is a great concept and has good video and audio quality however ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: B. Burress
content: I have a number of Nest products and they were all easy to set up and work great.  The cameras have great day clarity and decent night (total darkness) clarity. Why the one star? Google has just announced that they are dropping support for the "Works With Nest" APIs which allow interaction with other devices and controllers.  This means that the custom solution I had developed for working with the devices such as thermostats will no longer in work in three (3) months.  How's that for awesome customer support?  Give your loyal customers a 3 month notice that you are dropping a key feature. So while the product itself is good, you can have no confidence that they will continue to honor the features which you use.  Buy another brand!!
title: Great product, horrible vendor

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: PaulM
content: the hardware itself is good, but the software is terrible. After having the cameras for a 12-20 months, purchased 4 cameras at different times. the cameras continually lose connection to wifi and I have tried numerous fixes (rebooting cameras, rebooting routers, using different wifi channels, and like). the cameras now go off line almost daily. I would suggest looking for a different brand, I will be looking myself to find a camera that is my dependable. these aren't cheap devices, so if need be I will buy cheaper cameras with the thinking of quantity since high end products dont last that long.
title: Disappointment in Nest cameras

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ravi Srivastava
content: 4 stars for excellence in software. The value of security cameras is not in hardware but in software. Nest is beginning to prove that. Creation of security zones works. The software can differentiate between people and other moving objects. I'm taking away a point for the following reasons: (1) If a zone includes a glass window, then any image (of an object outside of the security zone) in that window is seen by the software as a moving object and alert is sent. The software needs to be able to differentiate between a reflection and an actual moving object in the security zone. (2) There should be global settings and local settings for each device. You should be able to setup whether global will override local settings or local will override global settings. Necessary if you've multiple cameras and a many devices. (3) Occasionally, configuration changes require pulling out the camera and connecting it to computer, this is a pain. The camera device should be completely remotely managed and configurable. (4) When at home, devices should be able to connect locally to the camera to review alerts, at least for the last 4 or 5 alerts. It takes too long to connect to the Cloud server and find the reason for the alert, when you are already at home. Finally, on the hardware side, there needs to be some type of security protection for magnetic mount for the camera. I understand that the camera itself is its protection but I'm talking about situations during power failures, etc. I have used Ring camera too, which is excellent as a doorbell replacement but Ring doesn't have security software as good as Nest. At the end of the day, it is the software that differentiates.
title: Excellent security software but it would take more to make it great!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: MattM
content: I bought 2 of these, we love them because i already have nest products and the integrate nicely. installation was easy but be warned, like other reviewers stated the wire connector is pretty fat so your gonna need to drill i pretty big hole if you intend to hide the wires. I bought a plastic wire grommet and drilled a 1" hole for the wires. I mounted the magnetic plate over 2/3 of the grommet after I ran the wire and filled the grommet with silicone, so you can't see the hole unless your unclose and its mounted high so you really can't tell. As for the quality, daytime is excellent, night vision is pretty grainy. I have outside lights that stay on all night so it rarely goes into night-vision mode. Your gonna want a pretty good Wifi signal wherever you mount this, our house is a town home and the back signal was weak so i ended up buying a range extender for it and it works great now. We use apple products, including the apple TV4 and the app there allows you to watch the cams right on the TV. bought into the 10 day history recording, its $10 for the first cam and $5 for each additional, $15 per month is worth it for us to have the security. We get notices when people come to the door and at night we get notices of all the wildlife that transitions.  This is way better than the camera setup our alarm company sold us that came with 15 second clips that you has to download and sort through if you wanted to see what was going on. I can get live and history right on my phone as well. super happy.
title: Super Happy, So Far So Good!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: PFM
content: Nest is by far more expensive than others but though I would get the best out there. Needless to say they are not. Cameras daily go offline multiple times. No rhyme or reason and my network is great, bandwidth plenty and both cameras show full WiFi bars. I’ve had nest support ticket open since 2 weeks after I had them installed. Even nest agrees my network is good and all router settings are exceptional.  They keep having me do the same diagnostics over and over like changing my router band or deleting and re add the cameras, nothing works. Even was online with support when one went offline and they could see it on my account as offline but could not trouble shoot why it happens. My belief is they know this camera has issues and are stalling. Checked blogs and others have offline issues as well. Regret going nest. I should have looked into Arlo more or did the Samsung hardwire system to begin with.
title: Constant offline issues

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: CO momma
content: I really do love this camera.  It's so easy to setup just about anywhere.  The only reason I did not give it a full 5 stars are for the following:  The camera works great, but, there are some performance features that are needed.  If they were added, I would rate the product as excellent/5 stars.  Here are the features I would like to see added: 1. Enable multiple wifi's to be connected to the camera.  Being in an older or bigger home, you often have multiple wifi's and repeaters in order to get good connection throughout your house, and, all other electronics (phone, Roku, Apple TV, etc) will allow the product to automatically switch over to another approved wifi if the current one setup drops.  This is very much needed for the Nest camera, because it currently only allows for one wifi connection to be set up at one time.  If you want to change it, you have to remove the existing one, then add a new one, and, you have to enter in all of your camera details in order to make the change.  2. It would be great to set up the notifications so that you can customize what you want to be notified of.  Right now, you only have the option to be notified of everything, or nothing.  I want to customize notifications, so that, say, if it spots a person, I am sent a text, but, if it just hears a sound or notices activity, I am not sent a text.  But, I will say that the fact that it does notify you if it specifically spots a person is AWESOME.
title: Great camera, just in need of a couple features added

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Ty
content: I love these cameras. They are such an upgrade compared to the awful low def cams I had with ADT. Just make sure you have good enough Wi-Fi and enough bandwidth... and are ready for the install. Install Notes: They are kind of a pain to install and don't seem very well designed for outdoor use. We had to drill some rather large holes in our house in order to hide the cables and whatnot cleanly. You have to drill a hole big enough to fit the over sized USB cord. With that said, a little silicone and stucco paste w/ paint and it looks really professional. It may be a pain to uninstall them some day though. Changing the WiFi network setting is a ridiculous process. You have to either scan the camera with a small qr code that is hard to capture, or use the numbers written next to it. I highly suggest writing down these numbers and storing it in your phone. Anyway, this is just a continuation of the install and hopefully won't have to be re-done very often.
title: I'm loving these so far.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JM
content: After I purchased a Nest thermostat I was all in with Nest hello, these outdoor cameras and then got the Google Wifi router/access points. Suddenly stuff stopped working - was told that there was an issue with my Home account ... some incompatibility with other Google products. Huh? Save yourself a ton of frustration and don't buy everything from Nest... it appears that Google is not really supporting their products as you would expect.
title: Be aware that Nest cameras and Google Wifi don't necessarily play well together

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Darren Venn
content: If I were just writing about the camera and Nest software I'd give this product 5 stars. The camera works really well and the Nest software records well. It is a beautiful looking design and I found installation to be straightforward. The BIG fundamental problem is WiFi. We bought 5 of these cameras to install around the outside of our house. Once up and running, we found that they went offline ALL THE TIME. It was very frustrating. I called Nest support and they were extremely helpful. Seriously, their support line is great. But... they couldn't help me. After a long time on the phone the Nest support guy determined that I had an "environmental problem", i.e. the camera kept losing the connection to our home WiFi. Anyways, after suffering through this for some time, I finally decided to get some WiFi Access Points to mount outside, right next to each camera. I chose WAPs that connected via ethernet cable to our Home Network. Voila! The problem is fixed! The WiFi signal from the WAPs is strong enough, and close enough, to avoid the camera's WiFi connection going out. But... this now makes me think that the fundamental design of this device is silly. The whole point of WiFi is to avoid having to make hardware connections - but... you have to drill holes and make hardware connections for this device anyway. To install it, you have to drill holes to mount it, then drill holes and run the cable down the side of the house, then you have to drill THROUGH THE WALL to connect the power cable to an outlet. It would have been much more sensible for Nest to just have run two cables from this device, one for power, one for Ethernet (or maybe just one, with Power over Ethernet). As it is, I had to do double the wiring and mount extra devices to get this to work. I'm sure this is a problem for MANY people, as Home WiFi is designed to stay limited to the interior of your home. It's not designed to reach your outside walls. I'm all installed now, so it's too late for me, but future purchasers would be well served by a redesign of this device that ran both power and Ethernet over the cable, and ditched WiFi altogether.
title: Fundamental Problem with WiFi

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: mike000mike
content: If you like paying into the home nest situation then fine but I think you can get better overall product by going with a hikvision camera and managing storage yourself. I inherited a nest doorbell and although I like it had I had my choice I would have gotten a hikvision I don't think nest offers a product with good customer support at all.
title: I'm not going to pay for the Google name and trust me nest support 50/50

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: P Scott
content: Camera works very well, fidelity is great and the connection through the App is excellent. Beware the install. The camera has two leads with plugs, one from the camera terminating in a USB that plugs into a converter box that then leads to a regular wall power plug. Unless your install measurements EXACTLY match these these two cable lengths then you have no options but to either coil unsightly cables on you wall or drill a large 7/8" hole through your walls and try to hide them inside.
title: Terrific camera, poor practicality for tidy installation.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RisingPhoenix
content: I've wasted so much money with other cameras. Hundreds of dollars, if not a couple grand. This camera makes me feel like a company finally cared to develop a durable home security camera. -I've owned Foscam IP cameras. Ultimately, their wireless modules died and they would have to be plugged in to communicate then, defeating the purpose of why I bought them. -I've owned trail cameras, one of which arrived faulty (that's what I get for buying refurb.) and another which ultimately died. -I own a Zmodo NVR security camera system, which actually still works, though the recorder faulted and makes it difficult to interact with. -I own a porch motion light + security camera combo which ultimately faulted. -I own 3 FLIR security cameras, all of which either arrived faulty or faulted over time, rendering it useless... It's about time I found something that works well out the box and is easy to set up. As someone who has owned the FLIR cameras, let me tell you - this Nest camera is significantly better. The FLIR camera has practically no night vision performance. It's just pitch black. The FLIR also has poor software for motion detection. It continuously picks up false readings on motion, which could either be a teensy bug flying around, or just clouds casting shadows. This camera has not produced the plethora of false alarms that my FLIR cameras have. This was also very easy to install. At first I was dubious as to the security of the install (because the body is magnetically attached to the base), but the inclusion of wire loops means that this camera is no more easily tampered with than any other. It is a sleek design that looks quite marvelous and functions just as well. Regarding software - this camera has done great to alert me of motion in the area. I have utmost confidence in its ability to accurately send me notifications if it sees something. The recording history is also very easily accessed and scrolled through. I actually love the app on my phone and its ease of use, and I love that it both highlights the region in the timeline when motion was detected, and that it will include a snapshot of the suspected object in my email notification. This camera has made up for all the wasted money in the past. While I prefer NOT to pay a monthly fee for a recording history, I'm happy to have a working solution and can appreciate that my hunt is finally over. A camera with great resolution, easy to access recording history, easy to install, with live feed, all in one stylish package. Way to go, Nest. You've restored my faith in humanity.
title: FINALLY someone has made a good, cost-effective home security camera.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Online Cowboy
content: Unfortunately, this camera (or these two cameras) are not really useful without a subscription.  I purchased the camera in an attempt to get the best resolution possible.  Unfortunately, to maintain even basic functionality as a security device, there is not much that you can do without a subscription.  All the fancy features do not work without said subscription AND you only get to look back for 3 hours of recordings.  For the amount of money that you spend on the hardware, you would think you had an option to at least record locally without advanced features like people recognition and face recognition, but that is not the case.  You also have to deal with the possibility that you will go over data caps that your ISP has set and be forced to reduce the resolution to save data.  If this device requires me to run a power cable through walls, doesn't allow me to store information locally and forces me to record at a lower resolution and THEN on top of it pay more for a subscription, why would I get it?  I am returning this because the negatives overwhelmingly outweigh the positives.
title: this camera (or these two cameras) are not really useful without a subscription

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RJ
content: The performance is very good, like my Nest indoor cameras, but I'm not a fan of the magnetic mounting. While it holds the camera in place well, it's easy to knock it out of alignment when trying to use the cable clamps to secure it. But once it's mounted, it stays in place. I'm also not a fan of the magnetic mount since Nest does not offer a free replacement if it's stolen, like Ring does with their doorbell. With Ring you submit the police report and they'll ship you a replacement for free. With a hard-mounted camera someone could cut the wires but you still have the camera to reconnect. With the Nest Outdoor Cam they'll cut the wires and walk off with it for spite. And you're out $200. I also wasn't happy with having to drill a 3/4" hole in my wall to fish the cable connector through when the cable itself is about 1/4" wide. I don't need the waterproof USB connector to the power module since the outdoor cable run is about five inches and then it goes into the wall. There should be some way to make the waterproof cable connector optional during the installation. But now that they're up and I see how they work, I'm thinking about buying two more for full exterior coverage. :-)
title: Works well but the magnetic mount is a weakness

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: deimos
content: Well, the pros are it has some of the best picture out there. The little speaker is weak, you can't really talk to anyone via these unless they are up close. The wifi range isn't amazing. I have a Cisco Linksys E4200 I believe and get about 100 to 150' depending on the walls its going through. In the old brick building I'm in it's probably closer to the 100' range. for free you get snap shots of people but thats about all. With the 100/year + 50/year subscription that backs up the video for 10 days it's up to you how much that is worth. I travel and what not and dont come home every day. So that 10 day plan works. I formerly had a nice foscam camera. I think the night picture was def better. Although it recorded 24/7 onto a spare laptop. Then when something happened you would have to go through endless recording. It was a serious pain.. it has zoned alerts and all but the software with foscam sucks.. Then if someone breaks in any local recording is obviously at risk. i have my modem/router and cameras all on battery back up. *shrug*
title: the pros are it has some of the best picture out there

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Coreburner
content: Expensive as hell and won't stay attached to the base under wind load. Speakers are not very loud and a little rain on the lens makes it useless till you clean in. Pros: Great picture quality day or night. Incredibly easy to install. Very easy to use. Cons: Weak magnet Lens is not Hydrophobic Monthly fees are very high No blue iris support If ring doorbell comes out with 1080p camera this size I'll switch.
title: Speakers are not very loud and a little rain on the lens makes it useless till you clean in

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Alvaro
content: Me gusta mucho la aplicación Nest y la calidad de la imagen, es muy amigable para configurar las opciones que permite nest aware. Sin embargo, la estabilidad de la conexión que ofrece el producto no es de lo mejor, tiene caídas frecuentes(5 al día como mínimo), lo cual deja la percepción que no está realmente monitoreando constantemente.
title: Buena calidad de imagen, intermitencia en la conectividad

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Lex Lyford
content: I've set up nearly a dozen of these now for different clients.  they're super simple, though if exposed to the weather you should get a housing for it as well.  I try to place them under eaves instead of out in the weather, but sometimes it's just not possible. And, I haven't found a housing for these I love yet. Edit 1-17-17: Today I had to chat with a Nest rep (had the choice of calling, text was easier at the moment) and discovered that their customer service is wonderful.  I had dropped a magnetic mount from an outdoor camera out of my pocket, on a roof.  It rolled across the roof and dived into a snowbank, and even a strong magnet and a magnetic sensor couldn't find it.  So I had to buy a new mount.  Except I didn't, because they just sent me another one for free, no problem, maybe 15 minutes of my time in a chat doing other things too.  So the customer service is exemplary, and another reason these cameras are freaking awesome.  And no, I don't work for them.
title: Awesome, easy cameras. Amazing customer service.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RD
content: The installation of this product is challenging. If you had an outdoor electric source it probably would be okay but since I have to use my indoor electric source getting the hole large enough for the USB housing to go through the hole is very frustrating. Wish I had known this prior to purchase and now it's too late to return the cameras. Updated 11/13/2017 I have changed my rating from a 3 to a 4, after finally getting the camera installed, I admit that the video night and day are excellent. The recording of the video and being able to save the video is a wonderful bonus.  I am on the trial and I am considering paying for Nest cloud, I think it is somewhat pricey but I can always cancel the service.
title: Best video camera!!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: H. Cook
content: Hooked it up a couple of weeks ago on my porch. Also bought a colored skin to match the house, and painted the white cord to match. It blends right in and isn’t annoyingly noticeable at all. I plugged the USB directly into an extra USB plug-in brick I had and directly into an outlet since there was an outlet so close, and that works fine. Had a power outage while I was out of town and for some reason the camera didn’t come back on after the power returned, but after a second power outage a day later, it mysteriously came back (this is a vacation home so I was out of town). I have no complaints except for the barn swallows on my porch constantly setting off alerts, but that’s more of a complaint against the birds than the camera. I do wish Nest would get over themselves and become HomeKit compatable though.
title: Good little outdoor webcam

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Snake Plissken
content: Once a person is in the view the person lags out.. it’s like playing an online game with someone cross country. This is my 3rd camera as it’s a good deterrent, but in no way are these useful unless the person is moving in slow motion or puts their face right up to the camera. It would also be useful for them to post that after 5 days you have to pay per camera per month. One more thing to note if there is a bad WiFi signal or the internet gets cut you basically just don’t have cameras. Edit after almost 1 year: Trash. Cannot ID anyone ever. Even walking super slow and at the camera you will get nothing.
title: Not great. Not good.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Grasbefore
content: Superior external WIFI camera, the second I’ve installed; though I wonder if it’s design engineers ever think of ways to make installation easier especially when trying retrofit to existing conditions. A Perfect example is the power cable with it’s 13/16” diameter plug that will not fit through an existing 3/4” diameter electrical conduit opening requiring drilling out the opening with a 7/8” masonry hammer drill bit on a ladder up about 20’. What a pain. A 15 minute job thereby ends up taking several hours.
title: Excellent outdoor WIFI cam with trial and tribulations

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Hilary
content: I love it. However, the time laps function has it kinks. Also the support hotline sucks incredibly. I called them twice and used the chat service once. The people behind it apear to have never seen this product and just read out of the manual. A call goes like this: Me: "I'd like to create time laps videos of a full day and typcially choose the 15 second time laps option. 90% of the time I get an error message. What am I doing wrong?" Nest Support: "Can you please hold on for a moment. Let me check if I can find something about this in the manual...." .... Nest Support: "It says that the maximum time laps you can create is for 1 hour" Me: "Sir, the hour refers to how long the time laps video will be once it compressed the captured time frame. The manual says you can create time laps videos from up to 24 hours periods" ------- These guys have no clue what the Nest Cam, what a time laps video is etc. I'd say if you are blind, they will read the manual to you but that about all they are good for. Don't expect a reasonable interpretation of the manual. They don't seem very technical. I like the video quality and subcribed to the 30 day subscription where I can go back in time and create videos. Some things don't just work and you should expect to play with it for a while before you can make it work. I would really want a feature where a longer period time laps video can be created at a click. The mount is genious, love that its plugge to a power source but connected to wifi.. There are many pros and cons for this product but overall I'd recommend it. Oh, we are using it to capture the construction of our new house and the idea is to create a time laps of the 6+ months construction phase.
title: Terrible Technical Support - Great innovative product

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RainyDay
content: I have installed this above my garage door.  I snaked the cord through an air vent and then plugged into an outlet within my garage.  We had a problem this past spring with someone allowing their animal to do its business on our grass.  Since then, I wanted a camera.  The problem hasn't returned, but I am ready.  In addition, it's a great way to see when the kids come home in the afternoon and anyone who walks up the driveway to my house.  I get an alert that tells me if the camera has spotted motion (car) or a person.  Very handy. It's actually a little addicting scrolling through the frames where the camera captured something.  I  can see who taking a walk or walking their dog.  The picture quality is very good.  The evening resolution is good.  It's also a welcome surprise to check on the weather.
title: Best money spent on electronics - picture is beautiful

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Paul S
content: I bought the Nest Cam Outdoor model and installed it outdoors above my garage door.  It was a fairly easy hardware and software setup. It did not disconnect from my network until ...  well occasionally it rains in Ohio.  After a few weeks of operation, it started disconnecting from wifi. After a solid two-day period of light rain and drizzle it disconnected from wifi for good. Nest support suggested the "weatherproof" power supply had failed. After I verified this, they sent me another power supply and suggested I install the new power supply indoors. Instead I installed the new power supply in the same outdoor location, but upside down and inside a "One Gang Vertical Metal Weatherproof Receptacle Cover." This should keep the USB connection dryer than before. It is working fine again and with no wifi disconnects.  I will update review if Fall/Winter weather cause a failure. Revised review: The camera worked for a few (sunny) days with the replacement power supply. The camera disconnected and its light will not stay lit even with an alternate power supply and is completely dark with the replacement supply.  So I think the camera has a short circuit and burned out the replacement power supply. All this during a dry period, there hasn't been any rain. And the winds have been moderate (less than 12 mph).
title: Easy setup but problem with rain

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: gunniwolf
content: Wow! Love it. I was a little intimidated when the box arrived and there seemed to be so many pieces for install. Well, I was worried for nothing! The instructions are pretty straight forward and easy to follow. My only "gripe" is that I had to plug in to a computer to get the camera setup on wifi....and that is only a gripe cause I don't really use a laptop so had to pull it out of the closest! Ha! Now, there was a question as to whether it was working cause I never saw the lights on the monitor .... It's working, just don't see any indicator light. Anyway,  install super easy and having the notifications is great....it let me know that the yard man had arrived! I put mine in backyard to watch the pool and the picture is easy to see. Feel so much more comfortable knowing what goes on when no one is home!
title: Great camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Terry Brent Stamps
content: I got this so I could keep an eye on my dog while at work.  Gives me piece of mind when I can see he's doing just fine.  I'll probably get the subscription to record and store video soon.  Thinking about going with their doorbell next. Product arrived in perfect, new condition.  No complaints except for how long it took to get the camera.  Over 2 weeks!  But can't blame them with this Covid 19 thing going on.  I'd be confident ordering from DD US again.
title: Just what I needed

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: LadyBug
content: Love our cameras but they often disconnect due to wifi issues. The motion detection is almost overly sensitive. We get notifications for tree shadows in the driveway. But then sometimes a UPS person will be dropping something off on our porch and it does not even notify is that it spotted a person. The quality is good, but I am sure it could be better. I wish that the cameras would zoom in more clearly. We have a long driveway and often times people go all the way down and turn around on our property. I rarely am able to zoom in enough to be able to see clear numbers on the plates. My main concern is if they hit another car in our driveway, we would want to be able to catch the plate number, but often we can not see the plate numbers.
title: Make Sure You Have Good Wifi Connection
