product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Knopf
content: Setup is easy and fast and picture quality is good as well. However, the Nest Aware service is quite slow and also quite inaccurate. I am myself programming AI solutions and am not impressed at all with the detection algorithm from Nest. Also, sometimes it takes a minute until you get an alert, which is too late when someone tries to break into your house.
title: Good picture quality, the detection software is too slow.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Jeff Kernohan
content: I have now had to replace each camera once and one of them is on the third replacement as these outdoor cameras are not able to be outdoors.  When they work the image quality is great, but if it rains they fry and I have to wait for Nest to send me a replacement.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: RR
content: Love this camera. Easy to set up and high quality picture with wide angles. I actually like that it is stored on the web for 10-30 days and don't mind the $10 per month as it is cheaper than a security system. Ordered another one after seeing how good it was.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Paul M Van Sickle
content: Only lasted 10 months.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Brian Carroll
content: This is a perfect camera! I have been wanting to get one for awhile now but couldn't settle on the right name brand. A friend of mine told me about this and I bout the indoor model. Liked it so much that I had to have the outdoor one.
title: This is a perfect camera! I have been wanting to get one ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: david morley
content: Supposed to have a “night vision” capability, but (from new), it does not work at night. Matter reported but nothing ever done about it. Conceptually brilliant with a good and ‘user-friendly’ design and easy installation. Some basic instructions would be helpful (and indeed might overcome current capability shortfalls).
title: Good but not great as it only works by day (or with lights on).

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: BL535
content: install and forget (and pay the subscription fee). Reliable, easy to use with app, and very few false alarms. I find these to be much more useful than Arlo devices because of the continuous monitoring.
title: easy to use with app

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Trisha
content: I never expected to like this as much as I do - love the wide angle picture of the front of my house and the alerts when there's any action out there.  I even enjoy just watching my yard on a sunny day

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Frank V.
content: Very nice camera. The setup took a while but that's because I wanted to run the power cable to an internal connection. The one thing that would be nice is to have different length of cables or a way to chain segments together to make the length longer or shorter. This wasn't an issue for me as I used most of the cable since I ran it internally. However, the cable would have been way too long if I had just connected it to the external socket.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Alexander Z
content: This is by FAR the BEST security camera you can get for your home. Now that it's weatherproof, there is no more worrying about it getting damaged and it still does all the amazing things my indoor nest cam does! I've tried the other cams and none come close the ease of use of NestCam!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Maj C. Henderson
content: Best wi fi connection ability of any wi fi cameras I've tried. This works at least 100 feet. The Nightowl system does good to work 50 feet. The Arlo is second best, but shows a substantial loss of signal at this distance.
title: Great WiFi connection. Surprising since it has not external antenna.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Gammy
content: I searched for a camera that also gave me video, quality and easy to set up. Nest is the only camera that does this. I love the outdoor camera as it is sturdy and easy to set up. I own 7 Nest Cams total with 3 being the outdoor version. They are the best. If you have wifi you are set!
title: Love my Nest Cams!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: lb1780

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kevin Southern
content: Up to 8 total camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Bob B
content: Excellent camera and video quality. Easy to install. Covers a much larger are than I anticipated. I do wish it had a feature that through software you can adjust the area of coverage. I do love it though!
title: Excellent Camera and Video quality

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Hank S.

VERY EASY to setup using the NEST app on a smartphone. Impressed right from opening the package. All materials were there and not just thrown in. product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Rob Blue

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Joe Thrower
content: Best surveillance camera I've seen / used. This blows the arlo cameras out of the water. I wanted to mention how amazing Nest support is. I had a bad experience with a Nest Pro installer where they damaged my house and Nest stepped in to refund me the money and discuss what happened directly with the service provider.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

content: I had it working the first day, but i had to take some extra care installing it under the eaves, and used special clips (not included) for stucco.  Overall, I did pretty good for an older disabled gal.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Zachary W.
content: Tends to cut out sometimes but may be because of my internet signal strength. Works good to keep an eye on my home when im away
title: Good product

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

content: This has been amazing. The video quality is amazing day and night! We even caught someone breaking into our house and we’re able to identify them. Win.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: PK
content: These nest cams used to be great but ive been having a ton of issues. The camera, app and online access have become awful to use.  It can be slow at times and picture quality has become so so.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Debra McDonald
content: We have used the Nest camera inside for a year and recently added the outdoor camera. It was very easy to set up -- we knew what to expect since we had been using the indoor camera. We do have the 10 day subscription -- I don't think you get the full benefit of the camera without it. It's very reliable in recognizing a person. I like to know if someone is a my door when I'm not home.
title: Very useful camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: C. L. Kehoe
content: My 4th Nest camera and 1st outdoor model.  The picture is great, very clear.  Easy to set up and install.  It comes with everything needed to install it.  The magnetic piece is powerful so I'm confident it will stay where I put it.
title: Works as advertised.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Dustin
content: a little concerned on the 45seconds it takes to notify me on my phone or e-mail. I have 20mbs internet at the house. Was hoping closer to 20 seconds when activity is detected. Other than that nice
title: a little concerned on the 45seconds it takes to notify ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Christie L Maclin
content: I researched between Nest & Arlo. Realized I didn’t want to deal with replacing batteries in wireless cam so I went with Nest. Good video quality & playback for day & night.
title: Good value for the money!!!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kyle
content: I mounted mine on an exterior wall with the garage on the other side of the wall, so I drilled through the wall and ran the power cord into the garage which really cleaned up the install and made it more tamper resistant.  Video is crystal clear, and being able to talk and listen to people at the front door is a nice feature.  Test out your camera location before installing to make sure that you can get a strong wifi connection.  24/7 recording at 1080p resolution will require a good connection and decently fast internet service.
title: and being able to talk and listen to people at the front door is a nice feature. Test out your camera location before installing

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: J P
content: Kudos to the manufactures of "Nest" indoor and outdoor cameras. The pictures, audio and immediate notification process via text and / or e-mail is superb. I finally caught the culprits who were taking short cuts trampling through my lawn and garden, it was the Letter Carriers who deviated from the concrete walking path to my home. Research your State laws regarding your camera inadvertently picking up private conversations via audio (which you can turn off) and the requirement for conspicuously posting signs warning of video and / or audio surveillance.
title: Better than I imagined!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Yellow_Notepad
content: Every software update makes the camera worse and worse.  I've had two of these cameras since January and one would just shut off for no reason while the other camera would stay on.  It would stay off for over three hours while I would disconnect the power and wifi just to try to make it work and to no avail.  You're better off buying a standalone system.
title: Every software update makes the camera worse and worse

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Trevor William Jones
content: Great Camera
title: Love them

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: joseph henrichs
content: Love these. They work perfectly. Install was super easy and getting them connected to my wifi and set up was a breeze. Would recommend if anyone is looking for a simple camera set up for the house.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Michi
content: Wow!  How easy to install!  No electrician needed, easily adjustable and clear images, even at night.  We installed several aroundmthe property and are very pleased.  Even my elderly mother can use the user-friendly app.  Highly recommended.
title: Great cameras and easy to install!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Elizabeth
content: Awesome camera and app. Only wish they made a direct wire version without a cord - hopefully that's coming from Nest soon - and a camera integrated with flood lamps, like Ring has.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Victor N
content: Nice, unobtrusive, easy to install system.  Easy to put up and to hook up with your WIfi.  Lives up to all expectations.  Easily integrates with Nest's other units installed at the house.
title: Useful

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: King
content: Had to send them back.  They will only work with a full Nest system. Not happy with the fact that only a magnet holds the base to the camera.  That doesn't look very secure.
title: Nice looking.  That's all.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Maria Vasquez
content: I was hesitant to buy this camera because of the price of Nest Aware but I'm really glad I read the reviews for this. The clarity is awesome and I can hear everything so clearly. It's also nice to tell my dog No when she starts trying to dig a hole in the backyard!
title: Don't let your dog ruin your yard. Get a Nest cam.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: ImConfused
content: I had a Uniden four camera system for the last three years.  I had no idea my system was such garbage until I got a couple of these.  No comparison to any other camera I've used including linksys.  They are more expensive because they worked flawlessly, the user interface is intuitive and offers more features than most other systems.  The only downside I see is their optional monthly annual service is a little too costly for me to buy with multiple cameras for the extra features.  Would still recommend Nest however.  Also I say this having previously owned a nest thermometer which was a complete nightmare.  My wife and I were on vacation from our home in Phoenix and received a call from our friend who is caring for our dog and the AC had magically switched to heat when it was over 100 degrees outside. It melted candles, food etc and our poor dog had some mild heat exhaustion but she did recover fortunately.  Threw the nest thermostat away the minute I got home, a few hundreds buck down the drain along with the hvac bill to perform a system check and install the new thermostat . Still giving credit to Nest for the cameras though.
title: I had no idea my system was such garbage until I got a couple of these

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: rayinchicago
content: Great outdoor camera. Love the video image quality, IR mode is good for at night, visibility is the best deterrent for home camera use. The Nest Aware cost is a bit high -but the service is nice, I really like the clips and the ability to control zones for active monitoring.
title: Great outdoor camera

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Adam J Schmidt
content: Very simple to install - impressed with the functionality - I need to fine tune the areas for the camera to focus on so I stop getting alerts every time a car drives by, but that's 100% on me.  It's impressive the app can detection motion so consistently and from such a distance! The magnetic attachment of the camera to the anchor secured to the house is genius!  Allowed me to make all the adjustments necessary for the right field of vision after the drilling / screwing was complete.
title: Big fan of these cameras!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Lm
content: Camera has been working fine for two years, then Google took over and now it will not connect to any internet. Lot of money to become obsolete. Not happy!!! This was with the $11 each month subscription that is now cancelled.
title: Do not recommend since Google took over

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: A Customer
content: Only useful  with an annual charge
title: annual fee

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: JMC

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: eDude

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kard
content: It's not perfect but it is likely the best camera in this price range.  Unlike other cameras, their software eliminates most false motion alerts such as when trees blow in the wind and the sun goes in and out behind clouds. I await an improved zoom that maintains image quality at a distance.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Maria Zavala
content: easy to install, and good to keep house under surveillance

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

author: Tanya S.
content: One of the cameras is not working

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Brian
content: These cameras are the best out there. IMHO

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: N. Baltus
content: Great outdoor camera with different mounting options.  No issues with the outdoor weather conditions so far.  Easy to install / setup.  Great picture during the day and evening (night vision).  I have a total of 11 Nest cams installed in my home. author: WATCHMAN
content: Love the camera ! but....  what they don't tell you is that you HAVE to purchase storage time IF you want to keep your videos to review at a later date.  The basic storage pkg. is $10.00/month or $100.00 / year for 10 days of video storage in the cloud.  Or....  $30.00/month  or $300.00 per year for 30 days of video storage.  Other then that you will have to settle for "snapshots" of any intruder the camera catches. (It caught my wife - see snapshot). Those are sent to your Email.  You still get to watch "live stream" of your camera though.  The camera is fairly easy to set up (considering you have the tools and the know how to do it.)  Usually requires a ladder, drill/large bit, small bit, screw driver, etc. Fairly easy to install though.  Once up it is fairly easy to connect to your WIFI system.  Works pretty good too.  Good resolution.  I DO like the advantage of the ZOOM feature too.  First day so can't comment on the night vision yet. Updated the night vision.  Loved it too !  Posted a picture of the backyard with NO lights on except the infra red vision of the camera..

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Zzyzx Oh
content: I bought the indoor unit first to check out the video quality, and it was very good unless you zoomed way in on something, at which time even the 1080p image was grainy. So, at that point I ordered the outdoor version in hopes I could place it on my porch ceiling and hide the wires in the ceiling. But, there is an issue with that. Electrical codes in USA usually prohibit the AC-DC end of the wiring from being hidden, so the videos show them being fastened to an exterior wall. There is no warning about electrical codes, so some clever DIYer will "do better" and create a potentially dangerous situation by hiding the cord.  The alternative is to get a long USB extension, but there is no guidance about how long the 5v USB cord can be before voltage drop becomes an issue with camera or Wi-Fi performance. So, I have changed my plans and will use this in my garage, and go for a power-over-Ethernet camera for my porch. But, it was worth a try. I do think NEST could be more accountable in educating buyers and potential buyers on the codes they need to follow for their own safety.
title: Do-It-Youself isn't always Do-It-Wisely; Be Aware

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: D. James
content: Really wanted to love this cam. Long time user of the Dropcam Pro and have enjoyed it a ton. We decided it was time for another camera and wanted an outdoor view so the Nest Cam Outdoor Cam was a natural fit.  First the good.  Its nicely designed, comes with a decent amount of cable and has a unique mounting kit that offers flexible placement of the camera. You are instructed to set the camera up inside before taking it out to determine its final mounting place. I did so using my phone and that all went very smoothly.  Then you're instructed to take the cam outside which is where things went south for me.  I took the cam outside, toward the front of my garage where I wanted to place the cam.  As soon as I got there I lost signal. Of course, wifi can be spotty so you might wonder if that's my problem or the Nest Cam Outdoor problem. I took my phone and tablet out to the same spot and was able to get a decent but less than full strength signal.  So I thought maybe the Nest Cam was a bit weaker and would need a better signal to work.  I bridged another wifi router in the room that the garage is attached to and still couldn't get a steady signal. Then I thought "well, I guess this cam won't get to see the front yard but will just monitor the inside of the garage" so I moved it several feet back inside the garage where I have full strength wifi on my phone/tablet.  Even in that spot I was getting spotty performance from the cam.  My last effort in troubleshooting was to take my Dropcam Pro out to the same spot to see if it would exhibit the same issue.  It performed flawlessly.  Very responsive, smooth video with hardly any delay.  That was enough for me to decide to return the Nest Cam Outdoor cam.  It did run decently when I was inside the house near the wifi/router but its too big with an unruly cable for indoor use.  So, I'm a bit bummed that I bought this on Black Friday instead of the standard Nest Cam for 70 bucks off as I am guessing the standard Nest Cam would perform as well as my Dropcam Pro.  Planning on trying to find a decent used Dropcam Pro or Nest Cam to try to get back down to a Black Friday level price and I'll hold off on trying to get outside coverage for now.
title: Wanted to Love it...Had to Return it.

The power adapter adds another 15 feet of cable for a total of about 25 feet of cable. My cameras are mounted about 10 feet from electrical receptacles, so I end up with 15 feet of excess cable, which looks horrible against my house. Because of the excess length of cable, I purchased USB electrical receptacles, so I wouldn't have to use the included power adapter. All of my outdoor electrical outlets are on a GFCI circuit, so the outdoor receptacles do not need to be GFCI receptacles. With the Nest Outdoor Cameras attached directed to the USB electrical receptacles, there's no excess cable and the appearance is much improved.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Amber Morales
content: I waited a long time to review these. Along the way, I have also field tested Yi, Blink, Ring stick up and a few others. I use these as security cams (and wildlife) at a vacation home. Having said that, these cameras are great...They really stand up to the elements. I've used them in 10° weather with no problems. The picture is top notch. As far as I can tell though, there is one huge flaw...The mount. The mount is magnetic. It's strong, but three times now I've had the cameras knocked off their axis by birds...yes birds. Once they are moved, the only way to move them back is physically...meaning they are almost useless as security cameras for remote or seldom used locations, or places you don't have anyone nesrby to immediately fix them.  I worried when I purchased them (I purchased 6) that this would be a problem and talked to a rep who"assured" me it would not be an issue....I'm here to tell you in no uncertain terms, it's an issue and a huge one for me, and people like me who depend on these cameras for security. NEST...Please come up with a better mount than this? This can't be the best you can do? It's a security camera...It should at least be secure. If a small bird can knock it off, so can a rock, stick or a person. Aside from this one flaw, which I consider pretty big, they are great. Please be aware that there is a subscription fee for each camera to save video to the cloud for review. The subscription fee isn't cheap.
title: Great outdoor camera with a huge flaw

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: James A. Verzani
content: Wow. Picture is clear as looking out the window. Works well with android phone. Have it about 50 feet from my WiFi router and no problems. Long range camera keeps everything in focus and can zoom in on playbacks.Sound is a little weak when greeting someone that gets close to it.  My elderly neighbor usually walks his old dog but i never knew it until watching the playbacks. One day he did not have his dog so I went and asked if his dog was okay. Helps me stay in touch with neighbors and check on the neighbor hood patrol constables to make sure thy are watching my house as they said they would.  I have it up too high to reach and secured the power cord to the house with clips and screws. You can also hide the cord behind a piece of trim painted same color as your house. Now I see all the deliveries and get alerts when someone is in the zone I've chosen to receive alerts on. I also see which direction my dog took off to. I know when the mailman arrives so save steps running out to check the mailbox.
title: Keep your nest safe with Nest Cam

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Michael A Morganford
content: Although the nest cams are pretty expensive, so far I think we are getting our money's worth. The nest cams are very well made, easy to set up as possible, and most importantly, they WORK unlike a lot of other wireless cams. I've had some dropcams (nest original company) running for like three years I think non stop, with basically no problems. So I hope these outdoor cams have the same longevity. The subscription service adds the capability to set zones and better monitoring, but personally i would like it to be $10 for like 2 cameras or 3 cameras. Currently it's at 10$ for the first camera monitoring/recording and $5 for EACH additional cam per month. And I think that's the CHEAPER per month rate where you only can go back 10 days. So overall a great product, we're able to EASILY access from our phones, and even share the live cam views with family with a simple link and password. Just wish the cameras themselves were cheaper, and the monitoring cheaper. Video quality, night vision, reliabilty, all that is there and more than adequate for your home security system. I actually mentioned that at the end because those parts are boringly good with the nest cam. Much much better than some other wireless cams I tried that basically were a waste of money due to horrible software, impossible to set up phone/pc access, bad image quality, control panel would never even properly connect to the camera, etc etc.
title: Although the nest cams are pretty expensive, so far I think we are getting ...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Burrgandy
content: The Nest Aware service is expensive but worth it. The only significant (very significant!) issue I have is that the camera randomly goes offline for 15-20 minutes. The same thing happens with my Nest thermostat. None of my other devices have this issue and it's consistently just these two. The response from Nest support is to restart the everything which is just...really? C'mon?! That's so stupid for an expensive piece of equipment like this. There's a bug and they need to fix it. When it works, it's great, but you have to hope and pray that it doesn't go offline at the time you really need it. To a lesser extent, I have an issue with the cord length. The company should include longer and shorter cord options in the purchase package. There should be battery backup and removable storage backup in case of power outages too. Also, you should be able to configure the app to send you alerts when it detects a person, not for every movement. I get a lot (I mean a lot) of alerts because of passing cars. It's better than Arlo though. I pretty much never got an alert for that system so I got rid of it quickly. Beyond all this, the setup was easy, installation was a breeze, the app is very intuitive and support promptly responded to my question.
title: Worth the buy but it has bugs...

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Kalani
content: This is day 4 of having this camera operational, and I have subtracted a star every day. I got this camera because I trap-neuter/spay-release stray cats in my neighborhood, and I thought this would be a perfect way to know when they are showing up. That was a huge mistake, and I know it is not operator error since I occasionally get notifications that a cat is at my feeding station or approaching from the backyard, but more often than not I can be actually watching a cat approach and I never get a notification. It didn't even tell me about the raccoon raiding my bird feeder last night but I can view it on the timeline! I've tried various tweaks, set up four completely separate zones, set notifications for motion inside zones, added motions outside zones, canceled person notifications - nothing has helped. Since it occasionally does what I expect, it is worse than useless because I cannot rely on it and find that I still need to frequently check for cats. That was a lot of money for a very ugly "ornament" above my back door.
title: Total waste of money!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: jbsibley
content: This is a great camera with two really annoying quirks for me. It's super simple to set up. The image quality is great. The microphone is very sensitive, I was surprised how much I could hear. The DVR is top-notch and the software simple and powerful. However. The camera ships with an unbelievable amount of wire attached to it. That's fantastic if you're 50 feet from the outlet, but if you want to mount the camera 6 feet from the outlet like I was you're going to have a giant, ugly coil to deal with and there's no way to shorten it - it's a data cable with a custom waterproof USB on it. I REALLY wanted the ability to share the stream with my tenants. Great, no problem. They can't control anything or use the DVR, which is fine with me. BUT, to use the link to watch the camera, they MUST be using flash player, which iPhones and iPads don't support. Nest won't tell you this, it just gives a "camera not available" error, which is a huge waste of time. Other than those two serious annoyances it's a good camera, and still probably the best on the market for most people.
title: Great camera, minor annoyances.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Arnold Carson
content: My overall experience is meh.  I like Nest thermostats -- have purchased many iterations and would do so again.  But the camera isn't as exciting.  My first CAM was dead on arrival.  Amazon immediately sent out a replacement, and the replacement is installed and working.  The actual camera seems to be well built (experience with the first one notwithstanding).  Day-time viewing is all you would expect, although to be clear, the camera presents a wide-angled view, but the application does allow for digital zoom.  Night vision works well, but is limited to what can be illuminated by the infrared lamp on the camera.  The microphone also seems to work well enough.  As for speaker ... I've tried talking to my dogs (my primary reason for having the camera), and they hear *something*, but I've otherwise been unable to validate the quality of sound.  The installation has the potential to be simple and easy -- but you do need an outlet relatively close to where you want to mount the camera.  If it's optimal to mount the camera upside down, you can configure the camera to invert the image 180 degrees.  My first choice of mounting location was too far from an outlet without additional extension cords.  My second choice had some sheet metal flashing nearby, and the magnetic mount clamped to the flashing without the need for any additional screws.  My chief complaint mirrors that of other reviews -- many of the analytic features ("Nest Cam detected a person in the area") require a subscription to Nest services.  Full functionality is not a one-time purchase, but simply an initial investment in an annual subscription.  I will probably not invest in any additional cameras from Nest.
title: It's okay

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Shortstack
content: I was very hesitant to buy this camera because it's a Nest product.  I always hated the Nest thermostat because it's a useless piece of fashion tech and does nothing that your $20 programmable thermostat can't do.  It's basically a Fitbit.  However, after doing the research and observing a friend's Nest cam, I got over my reservations.  Don't get me wrong: this is a piece of fashion tech, complete with ridiculous packaging and little cardboard drawers to hold screws.  But there has clearly been a ton of thought and testing that has gone into it, and that just makes it work better than other products with less flash appeal. I chose this camera because it has continuous 24/7 recording, which means when you get a notification, you don't just see the back of the UPS guy's head.  That's the biggest feature in my mind, and most (or all) other consumer wifi cameras don't do that.  It also has excellent video quality, and the person alerts and activity zones are a huge convenience.  Both the web and mobile apps are very user-friendly, packed with features, and make a lot of sense.  I get notifications on my phone and email, which I have set up to go off only when no one's home, which is great because my wife is often home and I don't need to be notified when she picks up the mail from the front step. Now for the criticisms:  I really wish this was battery-powered, with maybe a cord to keep the battery charged.  I really wanted to chose the Ring stick-up cam over the Nest because it's battery powered and has a solar panel to keep it charged.  However, since the Nest records 24/7 and the Ring doesn't, I assume it needs more power.  But it would be so great if they could do it with a solar panel instead.  Installing the cord is easy, and I had JUST enough length with the 25' cord to get the camera where I need it from my exterior outlet box.  There is no way I would drill a 1" hole in my house.  As an architect, I strongly discourage that, and they shouldn't even suggest it.  I really wish I didn't have to screw all of the cord clips into the siding of my house, but I was able to hide them pretty well. I also think it's silly the way the cord comes out of the camera as hard-wired and stiff.  It limits how you position the camera head since the cord will "pull" the camera toward where it's clipped to the house.  If you pull it tight, you don't have enough cord to position the camera, and if you have too much, it will push the camera away.  It's a very fine-tuned process.  I don't know why they didn't make the cord connect to the camera with a gasketed plug connection instead. The wifi antenna strength is not great, although I don't know enough to compare to other outdoor cam products.  I made sure it was in line-of-sight to my router through a window, and it still disconnects a few times a day.  It seems to reconnect seamlessly and doesn't have much downtime though.  I even returned my existing router and got the latest model from Verizon and although it improved, it still loses connection occasionally.  It will not connect to the 5g wifi at all (out of range).  The router is about 20' inside the house (and of course I will not move it; that's ludicrous). The email notifications are great, because they say "your camera spotted someone", "your camera thinks it spotted someone" or "your camera noticed some activity", and there is a thumbnail image in the email, which means you don't have to open the app every time.  Most of the time it sees a person, it's a UPS guy or the mailman, and most of the time it's activity, a squirrel ran across my steps.  Note that the person alerts are only available if you buy the $100 per year subscription, which seems totally worthwhile for me.  It would be GREAT if Nest could figure out how to put the thumbnail image into the phone notification, so I wouldn't have to open my email OR the app, both of which take time to load up.  And concerning the Nest Aware subscription, I don't think it's right that they charge you more for more cameras.  It seems to me that $100 should cover multiple cameras, but they charge $50 additional for each one. Finally, for the apps, it should be easier to click on events.  The interface is really cool, but it makes no reference to the events that it just emailed me about.  There should be a list of events, sort-able by person or activity in each zone, that I can click on and have it go to that spot in the recording timeline.  Overall not a huge deal, but it's a little frustrating when you know from the email that the Lasership guy threw your box from 20' away, but you can't find the footage without scrolling through the recording for 10 minutes. In conclusion, following from this I bought an indoor Nest cam and look forward to using that.  I have two Vimtag cameras inside my house now, and the 24/7 recording along with video quality push Nest head-and-shoulders above those ones, even without Nest Aware.  The Vimtag ones have on-board storage and make it easier to click on events, but that's not good enough to beat Nest.
title: Far superior to comparable products, great interface, but could be improved

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Thomas R Patchen
content: Small, elegant cameras which are easy to install... delivering clear video with a lot of great features. I was wary of getting wireless cameras because I did not want to have to bother with changing batteries all the time so these cameras were exactly what I was looking for. They plug in and send the video via wifi to the Nest website. I do not have a smart phone and use a PC to view the video. The video and sound are very clear and you can even talk to people through the cameras if your pc has a microphone.... though the 5 second time delay makes it a little awkward. It's very easy to go back and review a full day because the screen puts symbols where there has been activity. It's also easy to set activity zones and make video clips. Yes, you have to pay $12.50 per month ($150 divided by 12) for two cameras for 10 running days of video storage with Nest... but I think it's worth it... though a 5 day option for a little less money would be even better... hint, hint.
title: Small, Elegant and Powerful

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: J Bailey
content: This is my first review for any product that I have ever purchased. So I decided to write one for this product. As a LE officer in one of the top 5 Most Violent cities in the US I  have purchased and seen many cams in my work. Nest by far has one of the best on the market. Yes, being able to hard wire a cam is better, but when it's not practical as in my case, the Nest cams are the best. It's not a sales pitch...just a fact. I have been able to use two Nest cams for the coverage area where it took four cams from other manufacturers. The night vision is excellent and does a fantastic job. I was like most people when it came to using the Cloud for storage. Didn't want to pay that extra money. But unfortunately criminals adapt to technology as well. A new trend has started where they will take the security DVR or recording device with your other belongs. No recording device...no video. Haven't seen a Cloud stolen yet. Lol. Possible hacking? That's why you make sure your password is secure. I commend Nest for their work on staying out in front of the criminal mind. As for what should you chose?...the choice is yours...I have already made mine. Also I have the Nest cams on the inside and outside. They all work better than advertised. If you have Wifi issues just use an extender as I did. Works perfectly. Now while at work watching over others I have equipment watching over mine. Thanks for taking the time to read this. Hope it helps.
title: Nest by far has one of the best on the market

Allows you to talk with the person via Bluetooth. Quality appears to be very good; however I would recommend getting the silicon skin. Cons: The subscription cost too much without a lot of options. product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: George S. Mitchell
content: If wireless with quality video and reasonable sound is what you want, this is the best.  I tried Ring Cam and Netgear Arlo.  Both were suggested as a good choices.  Not for me.  Ring video quality was not good enough and neither had sound quality good enough for anyone to hear you talk to them.  I did not like the recharge battery deal with the Arlo. So if my concerns I listed are yours, this is the one you should buy.  I have two.  Many complain of the subscription rates but the 10 day deal may be improved on.  I am going to test a camera monitoring software Blue Iris for a $60 one time fee that will cut the cord with Nest.  That may or may not be an option for all to cut the subscription cost down stream. UPDATE:  Over the time I have used the cameras, I now have four, I have one major complaint the lack of timely notifications from the nest aware subscription service.  Example I just received an email alert of activity that occured 2 hours ago.  Not good service.  I get the impression that Nest is not keeping up with their end of the service that we pay a lot for.  For this I have reduced to 4 stars.  I never tested the Blue Iris yet but may need to.  Anyone have a work around to improve security notices?
title: Best of the wireless gang for now. updated 1/20/2020

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: jg17316
content: I was looking for a security camera for my home for about a month. It was either this Nest Cam of the Arlo Pro 2. Well i decided to go with the Nest Cam after reading all the reviews on here and other security and camera sites about the Arlo Pro 2 having ALOT of battery issues. I am not disappointed that I went with the Nest Cam at all!!! Pro: Great Picture Quality Looks Great The Alerts it sends you are very helpful (must have Nest Aware monthly subscription) Price is very competitive with other cams on the market No having to worry about batteries No need to have a hub or anything it just runs off your WiFi The Nest App is Great and works wonderfully Cons: Has to be plugged into a power source so its not 100% wireless like the Arlo 2 to watch vids more than 3 hrs in the past and to access most of the great features you have to subscribe to their monthly service, but i honestly think that isnt a big deal because it is very reasonably priced. I ordered one Nest cam for my front door/porch area,  to see how i liked it and plan to buy at least one maybe two more Nest Cams to cover other areas of my home.
title: Great Camera. Works very well and the picture quality is Top Shelf

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: John M. Hanley
content: What a great product the folks from Nest have developed. I did a fair amount of research of Nest v. Ring v. Arlo as well as speaking to neighbors who had various products.Easy online instruction and those included. I would have actually given it 4.5 stars if that was an option. Let's take a quick pro/con look: Pros- In my case, the cord was long enough for installation. Paintable code. Easy setup with the app and router Pretty much plug and play so to speak All that I needed was in the box Crystal clear video streaming for daytime and good to very good at night Good price from Amazon Free 30 day trial of Nest Aware Cool phone alerts w video clips Ability to adjust activity zones (what you wan to see versus just a car driving by on the street) Our Nest faces the street and covers the front  yard Cons - Need to drill a 1" hole to feed line inside. 7/8 inch just barely gets the adapter through Higher price for monthly video storage $10 v. $3  for Ring for only 10 days of storage Has to be wired. Nice if they had a solar powered one with battery backup Needs a better app instructional video...I haven't found it yet. Only installed for one day so far All in all, I would buy this product again. I may add additional cameras depending on the price for additional upload storage.
title: Nest outdoor: Very good product even compared to the competition!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: DTB
content: Installation very easy. Download the app, open an account and scan the bar code on the camera and you are ready to go. Mounting was also quite simple. I just put the magnetic mount on a down pipe. Didn't need to screw it in as the magnet was strong enough to hold it there alone. It comes with a comprehensive mounting kit which seems simple enough. The video feed quality is quite good. There is a noticeable lag of about 1 to 3 seconds. I have cable 100/40 internet and a N wireless router only 5 meters from the camera so I don't think it is a result of my internet. This is not a problem for my use. The push to talk works fine. The speaker in the camera is certainly not loud though as long as you are standing within a meter or two of the camera it is acceptable. However the person talking into the camera really needs to speak loudly/shout to be heard. The motion alerts are not particularly useful on the free plan. It picks up many false positives. The washing on the line is enough to make it send an alert. I understand that under the paid subscription this is addressed by being able to send alerts only when it detects a person. A particular gripe is that you can’t set alerts on a device by device basis. They are either on or off for all devices linked to your account. For instance, I have installed the app on my iphone, Nexus 7 and Kindle Fire. All three go off when movement is detected. I would rather just to be able to select alerts for the iphone only. I have somewhat got around this by sending alerts via email only rather than via app based alerts. This becomes a particular annoyance when I linked my wife's account to the camera. She is not interested in receiving activity alerts but it isn't possible to just have me receive the alerts. If I shut off her alerts then it also shuts off mine. To get around this I have flagged the Nest alert emails as spam on my wife's account and now they just go into her spam folder which solved the problem. Overall impression is that this is a nice bit of kit. No real complaints so far. We purchased the camera to keep an eye on the pool so that my wife could duck inside for a minute or two but still watch the kids swimming on her phone while she did so. For this it is perfect. However I would question the utility of this camera as a security device at the front door unless you went with the paid subscription to limit alerts to “people” and zones only. Otherwise I think you would soon turn off all alerts. I have no regrets having purchased it so far.
title: Great camera but you need a subscription to really get the most out of it

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Chuck
content: Very high quality build.  Even the parts supplied for the install (screws, etc.) are the best.  You just can't strip the heads on these screws.  I wish  all screws were this good.  There are some nice updates to this camera since my other Nest Cam (indoor) purchases.  The quality mode now offers 480, 720, 1080, or "auto". Installation was easy though I just built a house and made sure to put electrical outlets high at the four corners and high near the doors.  If you don't have an accessible (though not too accessible) electrical outlet, you may have some work to do. There are two power cables; each about 12 feet long.  The first has a standard electrical outlet plug (two prong) and ends in a power adaptor for a USB plug.  The second cord is is the USB that plugs into this adaptor and is hardwired to the camera. To install, you tie up the cord (screws and holders provided), and install plates for the adaptor and the camera.  The camera attaches with a strong magnet and is adjustable at any time.  So, you can install the camera about 25 feet from an electrical outlet.  The camera and cables are white.  The instructions say that you can paint the cables, and they do seem to have a paintable "feel" to them.  All of the connections seem to be watertight. Unknown to me is whether you can skip one of these cords if you don't need the 25 feet.  Not sure if you can plug the USB camera directly into an apple adaptor and plug that in.  My next install will only need about 5 feet and so I may end up looping 20 feet of cable unless I can find out the power requirements. The only reason for not assigning five stars is the monthly fee ($10/mo for the first camera and $5/mo for every camera thereafter).  There are good reasons for a cloud recording service but, for this monthly fee, they could give away the cameras.  Nest has made some charitable changes to their software.  If you don't pay for the monthly fee (it is only an option), the camera can still be sent to email you a still photo of any activity.  Nest has done an amazing job of preventing you from recording from the video feed.  I've tried a few creative ways and can not make it work.  I also don't like seeing a Nest ad for the monthly service taking up space on the feed.  Since this is Google, I presume that those who don't pay a monthly fee will someday see ads for potato chips and soft drinks on their security feeds. The minimum and maximum operating temperatures are exceeded every year where I live, so we will have to see how it survives -30 and 110 degree temps.  The included materials only advise that picture quality may be affected.
title: Very high quality.  Everything you need is included (assuming you have the needed electrical connections).

author: E. Brown
content: Amazing product and we've already chased off 2 people trespassing at our vacation rental property. If you want "easy" and "it just works" then I recommend this camera! We have a Nest thermostat and indoor camera at our own house and we just bought a vacation rental property. We installed 2 Nest thermostats and soon after we added this outdoor camera. WOW! Within 1 week we caught a suspicious couple trying to enter our home, we got an alert and my wife (From TX) asked them what they were doing. They got nervous and said they were at the wrong house and left. But when they left they didn't try to go to any other home. And then last week we caught 3 young men from the rental house next door come to our house and try to use the hot tub (ours was empty at the time). Again, my wife got an alert on her phone and then from her phone asked them what they were doing. They got spooked and ran away. Well worth the money, a MUST have for vacation rentals or for general security.
title: A must have camera for peace of mind and security

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Rick B.
content: Great camera, works well in rain and sun.  Wifi signal is strong through multiple walls outside.  You get what you pay for.  I use the Logitech cameras at my parents house, Nest at my house, and the Netgear Arlo at my parents house.  Nest the is the best in terms of quality and stability.  Doesn't go offline, and keeps a consistent, high quality connection.  The Logitech Logi cameras would be ranked second.  Quality isn't as high, but they have a daily review function that shows what happened during the day in a time lapse mode which is actually really useful.  Other than that, the Nest software is better.  Arlo is a distant third.  Battery power is nice, but in order to save power, they quality isn't very good, and they have to turn on when they sense motion, meaning that you miss a large majority of the motion because the camera is switching on.  For example, we have an Arlo by our front door.  If there is a delivery guy, the camera only catches him walking away after he's been within range for about 15 seconds.  So as he's walking towards the door, camera isn't recording.  Dropping off package, camera isn't recording.  Walking away, camera finally starts recording.
title: Great security camera, rarely (if ever) goes offline, worth the price.

author: James Slack
content: I did a lot of shopping and asking for suggestions before this fairly expensive buy. The neighborhood Sargent touted an old neighbor that had the nest and he said it was far better than his Arlo system. 24 hours into having this set, I love it. The hardest part I had was figuring out where to mount it strategically enough to cover enough ground with only two cameras. The alerts I get are frequent, but really nice. The cameras do a really good job of not picking up nonsense and alerting you. For example; I have a flag waving in the line of sight constantly and it has yet to send me an alert, yet a car going by or the mailman coming down the sidewalk from next door, bam alert with a screen shot right to my e-mail, phone and it even picks it up on my smart watch. I really enjoy nest products and looking forward to expanding on additional cameras and their other tools soon as well. Their customer support is also top notch and was very very helpful with some questions I had once delivered, even did some shopping for me to make recommendations for camera covers.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Lynn
content: I installed my Nest cameras in February of 2017 to help validate that I did not have a barking nuisance issue with my dogs, as they had been accused by a neighbor. We were found not guilty!! I installed cameras in both the front and back of my home, and Let me tell you, it has been an eye-opening, enjoyable, and enlightening experience to have the cameras! I have caught drones flying by my windows at night,  far closer than is allowed by federal law. I reported it to the police. I saw my landscaper left the gate to my backyard wide open after he cut the lawn, and was able to contact him immediately to tell him to close the gate before my dogs got out and were run over by a car!  I am amazed at the wildlife, and sometimes a bit concerned LOL, that comes out and about in my neighborhood during the evening! Deer, foxes, raccoons...  Very enjoyable to watch them from the safety inside my home, playing back the video in the morning! And just this week, my neighbor's car was broken into and he reached out to me to see if I had captured it on film. Of course, my Nest cameras picked it up and we turned over the film to the police. These cameras give me an amazing amount of Peace of Mind. I couldn't recommend them more highly.
title: I have an amazing amount of peace of mind, and couldn't recommend these cameras more highly!

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: PT
content: It looks clean and the installation process was a breeze.  The resolution is great and the 24/7 video is perfect for what we were looking for.  $100 a year for 10 days worth of recording isn't that bad for the amount of data stream required to record everything.  Just wished they secured the camera a little better.  As of right now, it is only held on by the main power line and a magnet.  No nuts and bolts to hold onto it... maybe it's a good thing for some but for our application, we feared that it may one day be yanked off and hauled away lol I mentioned that the resolution at 1080p is great but it still was not able to pick up license plate number ... even in sun lit day and only 50 feet away.  The details just wasn't there even at maxed out resolution.  Still worth buying it for me just because of the 24/7 recording and being able to browse the entire day worth of recording with just a swipe of the finger... awesome!
title: Simple install and easy enough for the wife to use

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Mr. Dean
content: So I was excited to install this outdoor camera to monitor the front of my house. Particularly to catch package thrives that are plaguing my neighborhood. I really liked the waterproof house and aesthetically pleasing look and design.  I found the power cord way too long for my application since I have a power outlet right at my front door, but I could have mitigated it by mounting a secondary to stuff the overflow cords. I liked all the app features and video quality. My greatest frustration was the wifi performance. I was evaluating this at the same time as the Logi Circle. The nest seemed to struggle to maintain a smooth video feed at my front door whe the Logi Circle was very smooth at the same location. Not sure if that is due to the waterproof housing.  I could have moved the access point closer but I thought the distance, maybe 30ft plus a closed front door should be sufficient. Also, I didn't like how the camera would go offline each time I changed a setting but this may have been exaggerated by the weak wifi connectivity.  Ultimately, I returned both next and Logi Circle and am evaluating other options such as the Netgear Arlo Pro.  If wifi connectivity is not an issue, you should be happy with this outdoor cam.
title: Great Design and features, wifi range was lacking

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: hesselgesser
content: I purchased a Nest Outdoor Camera about two weeks after purchasing a Nest Indoor Camera. In general, I found the packaging and overall fit and finish of the product to be very good. On the hardware side, I had some issues with power. Given the location of the mounting, I didn't have any convenient power sources within the range of the USB cable and associated power cable. I investigated extending the USB cable with extenders, but was ultimately not successful as the length of run of the USB that I needed could not support the power requirements of the camera. My biggest problem with the camera is that, when you initially install the camera and receive the 30 day trial of Nest Aware, you just don't realize how much functionality is removed for the non-subscription mode. Purchasing the indoor camera and seeing the great functionality of the software, I naively purchased this camera. Now that I know how poor the non-subscription experience is, I likely would not have purchased the camera in the first place. Yes, I can spend the $100/year to get the subscription, but that will be contrasted against the better subscription free experience that I get out of my Canary home monitoring solution.
title: Great form factor but unhappy with the non subscription software

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Edmund Cramp
content: A fancy product that appears to work well at first but is a pain to set up and administer.  I've spent more time trying to figure out how to stop it generating false alerts than anything else.  My general impression is that as a "user" they view me as a potential customer for every other product they make.  It was a royal pain to setup and install - they have this long thin cable connecting the camera to the power supply - except that it has a huge connector on the end so it's very difficult to actually thread it through any openings or conduit.  Thus you are limited in locations for the camera - the end result is something that looks good, is marginally effective, and manages to constantly annoy you with spurious alerts. When it does function and sees something, you end up getting a grainy picture emailed to you that is virtually useless - but the camera looks pretty.

author: Raleigh
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I’ve had my outdoor nest camera on my front porch for one year now. My subscription just ran out which is $100 per year. The camera is pretty useless without the subscription.  When you have the subscription I can distinguish people from Pats or motion of trees blowing in the wind and sounds versus voices. Now that my subscription is over it can’t do any of those things is just notifies me anytime there’s motion and it can’t distinguish. It doesn’t even routine video for five minutes so you can go back and look and see who was on your porch because by time you receive the notification there already gone so the live feed is really  ineffective unless someone  hangs out in front of the camera for an extended period. So if you’re comfortable with being stuck with a subscription every year at $100 per camera then it is a decent camera but it’s useless without the subscription.  I’m looking into other cameras where I don’t have to have a subscription.
title: ***Only works if you pay for subscription***

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Larry Hinman
content: I expected to like these cameras--I bought three--much more than I do.  The biggest disappointment is that it only streams Flash video to phones and tablets, so I can't see the video on my iPhone or iPad.  All I get is a still photo.  In addition, despite having a very robust home network, I sometimes find a camera is off-line, with no explanation. On the plus side, it's the easiest setup imaginable in a market where that is extraordinarily rare.  You can be up and running in five minutes for each camera.  Each of my cameras happens to be close enough to an outdoor outlet that I only have to plug them in and put in two screws for the mounting bracket.
title: Not ideal for iPhone users

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Brandon
content: I really liked my Nest Cam Outdoor Security Camera for the first month that I owned it. It works very well. Picture quality is very good and I get notifications when it detects activity. Using my iPhone app, I am even able to have a 2 way conversation with the person standing in view of the camera. If you would have asked my opinion during the first month that I used my Nest Cam Outdoor Security Camera, I would have probably given it 4 or 5 stars. WHY DID I GIVE IT ONLY 2 STARS?? For the first month, you are given a free subscription to "Nest Aware". During this time, you are able to view at least 10 days (might even be as many as 30 days) of activity detected by your camera. There are also a few other premium features you are able to take advantage of (ex: getting alerts when it thinks it detects a person, setting up "activity zones", etc). After the month came to an end, I thought I was totally prepared to lose those premium features... until I realized that one critical feature I relied on (the snapshot history) is limited to 3 HOURS FOR FREE ACCOUNTS. That means unless you pay at LEAST ten dollars a month, you will only be able to view activity that was captured in the last 3 hours. This may not seem like a big deal, but I became VERY frustrated with this after just one day. I woke up at 8am and saw several notifications on my phone telling me that the nest cam detected activity between 2-3am. Since that was more than 3 hours ago, I was not able to see what the activity was. Now the camera is causing more paranoia than it is helping. What good is an activity notification if you can't see what the activity was?? I don't expect to get multiple days or weeks worth of history for free, but I would expect to get at least 12 hours (like other companies like Canary do). Because of this one feature (or lack thereof), I would not recommend this product. My 30 day return period has lapsed, so I cannot return... but I plan on trying to sell this camera and use the money to purchase a Canary Flex.
title: GREAT until the app's free month trial ends... then you only get 3 hour snapshot history unless you pay monthly

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: NashvilleLady333
content: It would be a 5 star review IF you could use the camera without the $10 (or $30) a month subscription, but that knocks it down a few stars. If you don't pay the monthly fee, you get 3 hours of "snapshots" only (not video). Most people sleep more than 3 hours, so that makes this camera pretty much useless without the monthly fee. A competitor offers a $3 a month subscription that Nest really needs to consider - maybe for 24 or 48 hours of video. I would buy more of these cameras if the subscription was more affordable. Now, the camera itself - I do like it a lot. It was super easy to install - I put it on the outside of my garage and ran the cord inside and plugged it in inside. I used the clips that came with it to attach it to the brick. That same competitor mentioned previously includes a (masonry) drill bit with their product, but Nest does not - so you may need that, if you don't already have one. Sure, it might get stolen, but they would have to cut the cord in order to steal and it's mounted pretty high up to do that. Plus, I'd get a great close-up of their face while they tried! IF you get the subscription, the zones are fantastic. My driveway is right next to my neighbors, so I set theirs up as zone 2 and I don't get notified when there is motion over there. It woke me up last night when a cat walked across my driveway - that is now sensitive it is. The night picture is ok, and the day picture is very good. I do like it better than said competitor's product (which I also have, obviously) but the monthly fee kills it. NEST - offer a lower monthly subscription and I'll change this to five stars and buy a few more!! ;)
title: At least $10 a month or this is useless.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: N. Galloway
content: I like the Nest cam outdoor for more reasons than I do not. The reasons for not liking the camera, is for what they do not tell you. Without the Nest Cam Aware subscription the alerts will drive you nuts. The ability to set up zones is only with the subscription service. These zones allow the camera to focus on just areas within the field of view I can configure. Thus limiting the amount of notifications received. Also without Nest aware the video play back history kept is a mere 3hrs. It would have been nice to know these things up front. Probably would have still purchased because the seem to be the best cameras on the market right now. Setup was a breeze, I did have some trouble syncing the camera to my device. There was a step that said "I should now see live video", but I was not. So I started over a couple of times then it worked. As others have no doubt pointed out. The unnecessarily huge tip on the camera plug make through wall installs kind of irritating because you have to drill a larger 7/8s hole for the smaller camera wire to fit through. In my case I used dual feed through bushings with a little silicon to seal the hole. The camera display is clear and in HD. The sound quality is pretty good, actually better than expected and the ability for 2 way communication is genius. I plan to pick up more of these as this first one I am totally pleases with... Update... So after months of have my Nest up and running I am running into issues. When I first installed (didnt sign up for Nest Aware trial), the cameras worked well. After constant pop ups/reminders I signed up for Nest Aware, cameras worked well. I have since let the Aware trial lapse without continuing the service. Now the cameras work like crap. Nothing with my network has changed. The camera consistently goes offline. When it does record incidents or motion now, there is no video. Seems to do just stills. I'd hate to think this is a tactic by  the manufacturer to get me to subscribe to the Aware service. I would have returned the product if this happened in the first 30 days. I am hoping the extended warranty can help out.
title: I like the Nest cam outdoor for more reasons than I ... UPDATED 9/18/17 Rating dropped

content: The camera itself is build solid and easy to set up. What Nest forgets to mention is that 1080 p is Available only when the WiFi Signal is very strong ( Modem in the Basement Camera on the 2nd Floor 1080p is Gone). When you have strong wi-fi signal you can recognize faces if not even at 20 feet away  you wont be able to see a face. Subscription is very Expensive for more then 1 Camera. 100 $ a year for 1 Camera is OK add 50 for each after that and you're better of Calling ADT. A Package for more then 1 Camera Will Be Helpful.I Have Installed More then 30 of them for myself and Customers . Clear Face Picture has Been a Problem With Weak Wi-Fi Signal.Camera Recommends Switching to 720p or Automatic.

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: S. Shalit
content: WARNING - these cameras will NOT notify you if a person is there unless you pay $150.00 per year to Nest! You can set them to see "motion" without paying the $150.00 but I experimented and apparently "motion" does NOT include if they see a PERSON! Further, if you don't have mega bandwidth these cameras will HOG your bandwidth which negatively effects everything else you use from your iPad to your wireless computer. I phoned my provider to find out why my service declined in the middle of the day and it was seen that a huge upload was happening, which could only have been Nest. I called Nest to ask them to only do the huge upload after 1 am and was told I needed to buy more bandwidth. I already have to have these cams set to the lowest possible resolution so the video is not clear enough to identify a perp. Believe me I am waiting for fiber to come here but meanwhile, I feel that Nest is ripping off the consumer by not telling them the truth about the above issues. I am sorry I spent my money and a lot more time than Nest puts out to have these installed.
title: Caveat emptor!

author: TMB
content: This security camera does everything I expected and wanted. I've tested it for a week (using my iPhone 6 & Apple Watch) and moved it around just to get an idea of how it would work in a variety of locations. It switches to night vision when there isn't enough light. It detects people and the alert is immediate. The microphone and speaker work well enough to have a conversation.  The Nest app works incredibly well and alerts me within seconds of seeing a person. Twice I noticed that I or my husband was able to get through without detection - which means it did not film us at all so there was no alert. I didn't do any other research but I'm guessing this must be something to do with the film capture rate.
title: Great image and sound quality

author: Mj
content: Cameras are not a good security solution. These go offline numerous times a day. Through our the night, I would get 5 to 15 notices saying the cameras were offline. Checked my WiFi and these drops were not as a result of my router. Camera has good optics live but recorded streams seem degraded. Night images were pretty good but I am use to 5 meg cameras so these seem like glorified webcams not true security cameras. These are easy to setup but the cable can create some challenges with the USB connector from camera cable to USB cable. It is very well made. The whole system feels very robust. But the execution as a security solution fails miserably. I really wanted to make these work. I did even mind paying for the service. I was still in the free month but I would have been furious if I was paying for the recording solution.
title: Frustrated

product: Google Nest Cam Outdoor - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
author: Scott  Kruse
content: We purchased our first Best camera two years ago when our son was born. After tons of research I came to the conclusion that this was our best option for a baby monitor. My wife was skeptical because all her family and friends with kids used a dedicated baby monitor. After using the Nest camera for about 24 hours, she admitted that we had the best monitor on the market that can also serve as a security camera when we stop using it as a monitor. When the recent bombings started in Austin, we decided that we needed some outdoor security cameras. We didn't consider another option, due to the quality of our first purchase. I know that having the exposed wires might be a turn off for some, but the price to have cameras professionally installed is very expensive if not installing during a build. We love being notified while at work when the camera has spotted something. If your expecting a delivery it's nice to know it's arrived. I could go on and on about these cameras. If your in the market for some extra security or for a baby/pet monitor, you can't go wrong with a camera from Nest.
title: Easy to install amazing quality!!
